author: {'steamid': '76561198066391846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6315, 'last_played': 1707089973}
review:
This game has so much potential but it should be called "Cities in Gridlock". If you have trams, busses or trolley busses eventually you will get to a point where everything just stops moving due to the amount of people crossing the road.
You will then get a message saying last departure missed as everything is stuck in one place. If you have built a network across the city this can affect several lines.
Another annoying thing is the price adjustment, every 5 minutes the ticket prices are either too low or too high and its a pain having to keep adjusting them.

So for the first issue, it would be good if you could have some simple pedestrian bridges to stop people blocking traffic.
The second issue, either make the pricing more stable or allow automatic pricing that would adjust for you, perhaps within an upper and lower limit.

All in all, it comes across like this game has been released without testing or if it has been tested without fixing a few bugs. I would not waste your money on this as its a shame due to some really cool features such as custom timetables etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198328402532', 'num_games_owned': 15, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 20064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20064, 'last_played': 1693204666}
review:
交通系のゲームではtransport feverやcities skylinesと遜色ないほどよくシミュレーションされている。

住民一人一人がそれぞれ目的地を持っていて、マップの広さも丁度良い。
バス等で長距離の循環路線を作ると、何週か車庫に入らずループしていると途中で車両のコンディションが赤くなって速度が非常に落ちるので、長距離の循環路線は作らない方が良い。

車両関係のmodは無いものの、DLCで各交通手段の車両の種類を増やせられ、モノレールも追加される。

ゲームの処理は比較的軽く、低スぺでもほどほど遊べるが、路線数が増えると車両がスタックすることがある。スタックしても自動で再配置されないので、自分で除去しなければならない。

author: {'steamid': '76561198160197507', 'num_games_owned': 8, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6740, 'last_played': 1700602165}
review:
Одни сплошные минусы...
-Игра не сбалансирована по вместимости транспорта (например, автобус 10-32 человек, максимально длинный поезд метро около 100 человек)
-Наземный транспорт вечно стоит в пробках из-за трафика, приходится использовать только водный транспорт и метро
-Водный транспорт застревает на пирсах, если ставить интервал меньше 25 минут
-NPC иногда сходят с поезда посреди прямой ветки, делают 2-3 пересадки через другую ветку метро и трамвай, обратно садятся на первую ветку и едут дальше. Проводят в пути больше времени и парализуют работу трамваев и автобусов.
-Постоянно прыгающие цены на билеты в зависимости от спроса, успокаиваются примерно через 3 недели игрового времени.
-Нельзя продать сразу весь транспорт в депо.
-Нельзя поменять направление движения в тоннеле метро.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983520599', 'num_games_owned': 925, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1371863274}
review:
The first game was a charming transport tycoon type game with a ton of character and delightful real-world cities and time periods. This stripped away all of that in favour of half-baked city growth mechanics, and was absolutely just a test bed for Cities: Skylines.
If you want a city builder, this is extremely mediocre. Get C:S instead.
If you want a transport company sim, this is extremely mediocre, get CiM1 too. You won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065079767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1692989412}
review:
Le concept, de construction/gestion de transports en commun dans une ville à 90% déjà construites, est génial mais... :
- L'interface est dégueulasse ( une spécialisation chez les jeux Paradox ).
- Le jeu est pas évident à prendre en main, l'absence du Français n'aide pas ( même s'il y a des patchs Fr sur Internet ).
- On est un peu perdu sur ce que la destination des PNJs, alors on fait des lignes par logique sans réellement savoir si on va répondre à toutes les demandes.
- Il y a une micro gestion des horaires, que je n'ai pas utilisé car flemme, là où à l'inverse où ne choisi pas exactement le nombre de bus qu'on va mettre sur une ligne..
Etc etc etc
Et pourtant le jeu est beau, prend très peu de place, et n'a pas de bug.
C'est jouable, et au prix qu'on le trouve maintenant ( sur instant par exemple ), c'est pas une arnaque. Mais c'est loin d'être une pépite malgré son âge, et on va tous ensemble l'oublier assez vite.
Dommage car le multi permet de la coopération, de la coopération en versus, et du versus. Mais va trouver quelqu'un pour jouer en ligne mdr

author: {'steamid': '76561198054139870', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2737, 'last_played': 1598727573}
review:
Ausbaufähige Mehrspieler-Synchronisation und unerfüllte Hoffnungen auf eine Fortsetzung

"Cities in Motion 2" ist ein ansprechendes Simulationsspiel, das den Spielern ermöglicht, ihre eigene Verkehrsgesellschaft zu gründen und ein effizientes öffentliches Verkehrssystem in einer Vielzahl von Städten auf der ganzen Welt zu entwickeln. Die Spielmechanik und die Liebe zum Detail bei der Gestaltung der Städte verdienen Lob und bieten eine unterhaltsame Erfahrung für Fans des Genres.

Leider hat das Spiel jedoch einen signifikanten negativen Punkt, der die Mehrspielererfahrung beeinträchtigen kann. Die Synchronisation im Multiplayer-Modus lässt nach einiger Zeit zu wünschen übrig. Dies kann zu frustrierenden Situationen führen, da es zu Verzögerungen oder Unregelmäßigkeiten bei der Darstellung der Aktionen anderer Spieler kommen kann. Dies mindert den Spielspaß, besonders wenn man mit Freunden oder anderen Spielern zusammenarbeiten möchte.

Ein weiterer Aspekt, der viele Spieler enttäuscht hat, ist die Tatsache, dass es keine Fortsetzung oder weiteren umfangreichen Updates für das Spiel zu geben scheint. Die Community hatte sich auf eine Weiterentwicklung und möglicherweise neue Funktionen oder Städte gefreut, doch diese Erwartungen wurden bisher nicht erfüllt.

Trotz dieser Mängel bleibt "Cities in Motion 2" ein solides Einzelspielererlebnis mit einer breiten Palette von Möglichkeiten, um sein eigenes Verkehrsnetzwerk zu gestalten und Herausforderungen zu meistern. Die Vielfalt an Fahrzeugen, die Möglichkeit, Strecken individuell anzupassen und die detaillierte Darstellung der Städte tragen dazu bei, dass das Spiel einen gewissen Wiederspielwert hat.

Insgesamt gesehen bietet "Cities in Motion 2" eine unterhaltsame Spielerfahrung für Fans von Verkehrssimulationen, solange man die Multiplayer-Synchronisationsprobleme berücksichtigt und keine Erwartungen an eine Fortsetzung hegt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007134962', 'num_games_owned': 1411, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4301, 'last_played': 1675619591}
review:
[h1]A disappointment but can be salvaged[/h1]

Out of the box CiM2 is a frustratingly mediocre game. It is better at simulating city transport than the first Cities in Motion and yet arguably it's worse as a game. It's better at the former mainly because of the addition of timetables but it feels less polished and lost most of the charm of the first game. Unlike in CiM1 there is no era progression. CiM2 is modern times only and looks quite bland.

[u]Gameplay[/u]
Timetabling is the standout feature of the game. It allows for good separation of the vehicles on the lines (in CIM1 they tended to annoyingly bunch up) and for the simulation of fluctuations in traffic. Sadly the default timescale choosen by the devs doesn't allow this feature to shine too much. When it takes your metro 6 hours to travel its line you can't really timetable for 1-2 hours of rush hour traffic. Luckily in sandbox mode (but not in the campaign) you can use custom rulesets  and change the timescale. I advise setting it to 20-25% of the original. You might have to rebalance costs and passenger generation rate as well though.
Another important addition is the ability to build roads which greatly increases your options in developing your transport networks. It's quite clunky and hard to master though. You can't change lanes to bus or parking lanes for example, you have to delete and rebuild the whole road. If the buildings hug the road tightly you won't be able to fit in the updated road without deleting buildings. Very annoying.
The economic simulation is wonky, and if you change the timescale it might require quite a bit of trial and error to get it to behave reasonably. There are also oddities like inspectors always generating more income than their wage. You can have a small company with only 10 vehicles and the 100th inspector will still generate a profit for you.

[u]Vehicles[/u]
There are way too few vehicles in the base game, you need a few DLCs to add variety. (I prefer the mixed vehicle packs.) The stats of the vehicles are not well balanced, some are useless, some clearly superior. There are also odd inconsistencies like some solo buses having more capacity than articulated buses twice their lenght. This results in an irrealistic meta where these magical solo buses do better in congested areas. If you want meaningful tradeoffs with vehicles that shine in different niches/situations you'll have to rebalance vehicle stats for yourself. (There's a tool for that.)

[u]Cities and presentation[/u]
The base game comes with North American style buildings. Variety is low (too few building models) and there are no colour variants for the models so cities tend to look grey and bland. The DLC European building pack is more colourful but doesn't have more building models either. Unlike CiM1 there are no railway stations and airports that represent connections to the larger world and tend to be natural focal points of city transportation networks. Landmarks are a poor substitute and offer little help in making cities look more lively. In stark contrast to the nice handmade maps of CiM1 that look like real cities most official maps are poor to mediocre with randomly generated looking blobs of cities and patches of settlements. Luckily there are several nice user-made maps in the Steam workshop.
Only trolleybus lines have overhead lines. Catenary for tram tracks and third rail for metro tracks are missing. Should have been present at least as an option. Weirdly most metros have only one cab. Can't really understand this design choice.
All in all game looks okay enough for a management sim game but it could be so much better.

[u]User friendliness[/u]
It takes time getting used to the menus and tools. Feels unintuitive and overly complicated at times. Would greatly benefit from some automation options, most notably for setting the ticket prices. (Be warned, you'll spend a ton of time adjusting ticket prices manually.) CiM2 was apparently also harder to mod than the first. There are no user-created vehicle packs for this one. Basically eis_os' BundlePatches and PatchPlus are the only larger scope mods. (Highly recommended!)

[u]Support and value for money[/u]
CiM2 seems to have been a commercial failure and Colossal Order quickly moved on to Cities Skylines leaving this in quite a bad state.  CiM2 is forgotten with zero support. The workshop was broken for years before they bothered to fix it. The CiM2 Collection available in official stores is not complete, missing several DLCs. DLCs usually don't go below 50% off so if you want the complete game it's unreasonably expensive for a 10 year old flawed niche game. Worst of all the in-game store is closed down and the items that were exclusively available there (vehicles, landmarks, combined stops, etc.) can't be bought anywhere. So you can't even acquire the full game legally anymore. It's the predictable end result of Paradox's over the top monetization schemes. They could have made those items freely available if they didn't want to bother selling them anymore but it was easier leaving the game incomplete, I guess.

[u]Conclusion[/u]
As is, CiM2 is mediocre and I can't recommend it. On the other hand if you are an enthusiast of the genre it might be worth the effort to turn it into a good simulator. But it requires further spending and quite a lot of work on the player's part:
[list]
[*]Get a few DLCs for vehicle variety.
[*]Rebalance vehicle stats to fix incosistencies and introduce interesting tradeoffs and niches.
[*]Create a custom ruleset with 20-25% timescale and the other options tailored to that.
[*]Create your own map or download a nice user-made one that suits your playstyle.
[*]Install the mods made by eis_os.
[/list]
If that feels too much hassle but you would still like to play a city transport management game I recommend going for the first Cities in Motion instead.

review: The performance is better than CIM1. CIM2 does not use as much computer and graphic resources as CIM1. But it is too complex for casual players. I don't like the trams returning to depots after one round. This is silly. Secondly, it is too complex. I love the fact that you can build roads, and the city grows, and that you can do curves the way you want to. But the depot, the complexity and overly poor interface prevents me from enjoying this game. CIM1 is much simpler in this, and thus is better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032589399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 269, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1452459038}
review:
Cities in Motion 2 - це симулятор міського транспорту, який був випущений в 2013 році. Гра намагається змоделювати роботу міського транспорту в різних містах світу, де гравець виступає в ролі керівника міської транспортної системи.

Один з головних плюсів гри - детальна графіка і реалістична фізика транспорту, що дозволяє зануритися в атмосферу міста і почувати себе керівником транспортної системи. Гра також містить багато різних місій і завдань, що дає можливість гравцю відчути себе в ролі диспетчера міського транспорту.

Однак, гра має свої недоліки. Наприклад, меню гри може бути дещо складним для розуміння і не досить зручним для користування. Крім того, гра може бути дещо повільною і нецікавою для тих, хто шукає більш динамічних ігрових досвідів.

У загальному, Cities in Motion 2 - цікавий симулятор міського транспорту, який може зацікавити шанувальників жанру. Однак, вона не підійде для тих, хто шукає більш динамічних ігор.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207504571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 33468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22842, 'last_played': 1707062700}
review: 毕竟是多年前的老游戏，细节方面不是强项。但它对交通环境的模拟程度确实是非常不错的，尤其是拥堵。缺点就是AI不够智能，道路的利用率不够高。

author: {'steamid': '76561198135406185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 27628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10785, 'last_played': 1706916010}
review:
Como o jogo evolui com base nas opiniões dos jogadores, digo que esse jogo é incrível!
A evolução do mesmo com base no primeiro foi incriável 
O que poso acrescentar é que esse jogo poderia haver retornar com os pontos de Aeroportos, estações ferroviárias e os parques de diversões. Acrescentar novos veículos e idade aos mesmo trariam uma nova opção para aposentar os antigos e trocar por novos caso o operador queira trocar o modelo ou manter a manutenção do carro. A operação com grade de horários foi um ponto que me conquistou muito, podendo totalmente controlar o numero de veículos com base na grade de horários. Acrescento que o jogo poderia haver mais opções de imoveis e novos modelos de pontes. As estações de trem e metro no ponto de só colocar onde deseja foi uma avanço incrível, contudo a estética das estações poderiam trazer uma semelhança com a primeira versão do jogo, trazendo um pouco de realismo ao trocar d plano terreno, dito isso , eu digo que esse jogo é impecável para que gosta de planejamentos e elaaboração de malha de transporte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053783918', 'num_games_owned': 1166, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1519517258}
review:
Cities in Motion 2 to gra symulacyjna, w której gracz wciela się w rolę właściciela przedsiębiorstwa transportowego. Celem gry jest zarządzanie siecią transportową w różnych miastach, tak aby jak najlepiej spełniała potrzeby mieszkańców i przedsiębiorstw.

Plusy gry:
[list]
[*]Realistyczna grafika i dźwięk, które pozwalają na pełne zanurzenie się w świecie gry.
[*]Duża liczba różnych pojazdów transportowych, takich jak tramwaje, autobusy czy metra, do wyboru gracza.
[*]Interesujący system ekonomiczny, w którym trzeba rozważnie decydować o cenach biletów, inwestycjach w nowy sprzęt czy rozbudowie sieci transportowej.
[*]Możliwość rozwijania miasta i jego dzielnic, co pozwala na dostosowanie sieci transportowej do potrzeb mieszkańców.
[/list]
Minusy gry:
[list]
[*]Niektóre aspekty gry mogą być trudne dla początkujących graczy, np. zarządzanie ekonomią czy planowanie tras transportowych.
[*]Czasami trudno jest dostosować sieć transportową do potrzeb mieszkańców, co może skutkować brakiem zysków z działalności transportowej.
[*]W niektórych przypadkach trudno jest uniknąć korków na trasach transportowych, co może utrudniać przemieszczanie się pojazdów.
[/list]
Ogólnie, Cities in Motion 2 to ciekawa i wymagająca gra symulacyjna dla graczy, którzy lubią zarządzanie i strategię. Chociaż posiada kilka minusów, to jednak przeważają plusy, które sprawiają, że gra jest bardzo interesująca.

[h1]Dziękuje za przeczytanie mojej recenzji na temat gry Cities in Motion 2, jeżeli ta recenzja ci się spodobała, przydała podczas zakupu lub poprawiła ci humor - zapraszam do rozdania nagrody lub pozostawienia oceny pod recenzją.
Zapraszam również do przeczytania [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/HyperSonic0/reviews]moich recenzji na temat innych gier[/url].[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198134285001', 'num_games_owned': 2386, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 15631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13142, 'last_played': 1699085661}
review:
很好玩的遊戲，以2013年發行的遊戲來說，遊戲畫面算是相當精緻了。

我個人很喜歡模擬類的遊戲，這款遊戲也不例外，
cities in motion的優點在於玩家只要專心經營交通運輸的部分，
城市會自動生成建築物和居民，
而玩家建設的路網會影響到周邊的城市發展，
遊戲的設計理念算是相當優秀。

但是，很可惜的是這款遊戲對於新手來說不太友善，
最主要的原因就是新手很難知道如何賺錢，
賺不了錢就沒有盈餘可以繼續建設，
當然也沒有繼續玩下去的動力。

我認為教學模式應該要從建設捷運主幹線開始，
先教會新手貸款拉出一條主幹線(類似魚的脊梁骨)，
再以捷運幹線為骨幹，延伸出輔助的公車幹線，
這樣可以讓新手了解貸款並不可怕，
而且健康的路網應該要是什麼感覺，
比起分散各地的鄉村公車系統，
集中在市中心的捷運路網要來得有收益多了，
這時候要關注的問題應該集中在解決塞車問題，
如何巧妙的讓各種交通工具經過人口密集區，
卻不致於超過每條道路的車流負擔極限，
這才能享受到這款遊戲的醍醐味。

最後補充一些個人的經驗，
可能有些人會覺得這遊戲裡面車這麼多，
但大多數都沒用，只要無腦買最貴最多載客量的車就好了。

我會建議初期最好買一些耗油/耗電少的小車專跑夜間時段(每條線約2~4輛)，
會經過市中心區的長程路線請選用維修時間短和加速快的車輛，
閃過紅綠燈很重要，放慢遊戲速度觀察就懂了。

舒適度? 最無所謂的數值，
問問自己就知道，你會想坐在提供飛機座椅的客運塞車一整天嗎?

author: {'steamid': '76561198115193682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1447, 'last_played': 1668910711}
review:
I only played this game in 2022 and I have to say I liked it. All in all it's what the game promises to be. That said, a couple of flaws:

- The variety of vehicles is rather limited (3 buses, 2 boats, 3 trams...). Could have done with some more choices
- The popularity rating is useless. If it has an impact on anything, I wouldn't know. But I finished the game with 0% and I can't say it bothered me
- Ticket inspectors are god-like. It doesn't matter how many you hire (at some point I had 500), they will always bring you a linear profit increase. Just keep hiring them
- The timetables are a bit useless. Who waits for a bus that comes every 90 minutes? But if you set it to a reasonable 20, you will need so many buses that the game will become unplayable. This only affects your popularity though. And there are mods that fix it to some extent
- The game finishes when it starts getting interesting. As I was finally making enough money to create underground lines and trams, the campaign came to an end. You can play sandbox in any of the maps, but it's a shame that it's not more balanced in that aspect. It feels the game could have offered more in that aspect.

Even with the above, the game is totally worth it

author: {'steamid': '76561198046285083', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3173, 'last_played': 1668202578}
review:
Nie wieder Paradox - wer Probleme möchte und das Risiko eingeht Geld für ein Spiel auszugeben, welches dann irgendwann nicht mehr zu spielen ist, kann sich hier gerne bedienen. Leider gibt es seit geraumer Zeit erhebliche Probleme mit dem Paradox Launcher v2, der sich nicht installieren lässt. Auch die vom Tech Support ausgegebenen Anleitungen helfen in der Regel überhaupt nicht.

Kurzum: Das Geld den Kunden aus der Tasche ziehen können sie alle, daher sollte man eher auf Anbieter setzen, die das intelligenter und zuverlässiger gelöst haben.

review: If you like pretty much JUST the traffic and transportation managing aspects of city-builders, then this game may be for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046383785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 11675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10199, 'last_played': 1667466166}
review:
This game is clearly abandonware right now; the developers seem to concentrate on Cities:Skylines, which offers much more scope. Worse yet, the game feels unfinished - some essential tools seem to be missing.
+ A nice concept with decent visuals
+ Map editor, allowing to recreate any terrain (eg. your home city) - sadly, some third party tools supporting such creation no longer work

- Flawed line concept - in real life public transport lines do not start at depots
- Incomprehensible economy: the monthly commuter ticket may cost as much as building a depot or purchasing a small bus. Some notifications about prices (e.g. "tickets are too cheap/expensive") appear out of nowhere.
- Strange traffic rules, leading to massive traffic jams on expressways (but not only) and pedestrians running around like crazy. In C:S there are mods to correct such behaviour, while there is nothing similar in CIM2. Thus, any map is bound to require substantial rebuilding.
- Minimalistic but clumsy interface (fixed position windows obscuring one another), making most tasks difficult.
- Inability to change/improve the vehicles (e.g. lower the energy consumption); the only way to have more vehicles available is to purchase some DLCs.
- Crashing (on W10 Ryzen 4800/GTX1650Ti with lots of RAM) - I would expect much more stability from an ageing product (edit: it may be something with the page file size - C:S is sensitive about this)
All in all, while interesting to play, it has a steep learning curve and fails to recreate a real life transport system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107212373', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1549381855}
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278066213', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1688024564}
review:
一刀包购入，先玩了前作
整体感觉没有一代那么经玩，这一代里面很多有意思的设定都没有了，本体自带的城市也都是一些虚构地图，完全是靠创意工坊活着的，载具种类也很少，做工比较粗糙，给人感觉完全是在向《城市：天际线》过渡的试验品，联机模式比较有意思，但是我没有好友玩这个游戏....
对于一般的购买渠道，我是不太推荐购买的，除非只是想浅尝一下，这一作没什么特色，论经典不如一代，论自由度不如天际线，论可玩性和画质不如狂热运输，这一作的地位本身挺尴尬的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198090679957', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1180, 'last_played': 1656373602}
review:
Lame.

My main issue with this is that it lacks in features, content and that it is relatively simple.  I don't know if you can unlock more vehicles in some way. I've only seen like 3 of each bus, tram, metro etc which isn't enough. There's plenty of DLC of course but there just isn't enough in the base game to justify it. It is a game about vehicles so I'd expect there to be more. I haven't seen a way to unlock more. I can also complain about overall lack of features. Maybe a first person mode> Line coloring? Something else. The existing game needs a lot more to justify DLC. I wouldn't mind buying DLC in a complete game not in something you can figure out how to play in an afternoon and the game ends up being really easy.

In terms of gameplay really the challenge is learning how to play rather than actually playing it. The UI is pretty difficult to understand and unintuative but you get used to it. Once you figured out how to make a successful tram line or a metro line you get crazy amounts of money. If you run out you could still borrow crazy amounts of cash. Loans are OP in this game. The cost of the loan dwarfs the income you generate from building new lines and getting new passengers so if you have a small amount of experience knowing the game you completely steamroll through all the objectives because you have an enormous amount of cash. Some modes of transit I don't see there being much of an advantage to using. Trolleys don't have a capacity advantage to buses but have the restrictions of having to lay track.


The game runs fine although I have some problems with glitches like the game thinking the track I have is submerged in water when it isn't. Strange visual glitches in the game's pathfinding for the lines. These will sometimes happen when playing the game. The problem is when they do you have to demolish what you've built and rebuild it, getting no money back from it.

Now, to be absolutely fair there is multiplayer but I've tried using it and haven't gotten success finding anyone to play.

The one thing I do actually like about this game is it as a city builder. It is a complete road and street network editor. The city building elements are a lot better than the actual gameplay. This game is even more hollow than Traffic Giant! A game from 2000. That had way more buses, tram and trains and it was honestly a bit more challenging than this. There are better transportation games like the Transport Fever series, A-train, OpenTTD etc. Transport Fever has tons of vehicles and has a legendary campaign mode. A-train has a really good campaign as well. OpenTTD has active multiplayer.

I can't recommend this game because there's so many better transit sims now and it's lacking content. I've pretty much described this game completely. There are random missions you can complete for money. There's ferries in the game too. That's about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020460761', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 5408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5408, 'last_played': 1649981540}
review:
[h1]Cities in Motion 2[/h1]
Is a city builder simulation with management focused on transports. You have a few means of transportation availble: Busses, trolleys, trams, waterbuses and trains. The game is designed towards taking loans and with different transportation being better than other. Trains are the best and trams follow a bit behind while the others aren't nearly as good with profit. 

[h1] The Good [/h1]
Stunning visuals and simple easy to learn gameplay overall. While it isn't great the game has a campaign which I think is good for games like this. There are tutorials available which is great as the game at first can feel a bit overwhelming with the UI etc. It has multiplayer which is cool.

[h1] The Bad [/h1]
The economy doesn't make any sense at all sometimes. I have a decent amount of profit and I still magically can end up losing money. When I have very high loans I seem to pay them off fine without getting as much losses as I should meaning that loans don't seem to claculate the interest correctly. Mostly You do the same thing over and over again and while building and making lines can be fun it doesn't feel rewarding enough. I took my time and made lines I could keep track on so I could manage it all a bit better. There is some tweaking you can do to make the lines better with time tables but overall it doesn't provide enough to build up a transportation system that makes sense and keeps the citizens happy.
I don't like multiplayer achievements, but most importantly I don't like when multiplayer doesn't work. After many tries and almost giving up I managed to solve the issue by using the Asus Router App and enabling Open-nat with the rules selected for Cities in Motion 2 Steam version. This seems to be a big issue for many people that normal portforwarding etc. doesn't seem to work properly.
Game balance pretty much makes building metros and tramstations  so much better that you only use the other means of transportation for visuals or coverage with bad profits.
Another big issue is when you build. I took my loans and built a huge metro system when I exit pause it doesnt work since it allowed me to build a too sharp turn which means I don't  have a fully connected track. I can't take another loan and I can't earn any profits so I have to restart. Same goes if you accidently sell something or add something by mistake. There are no "redo options" in this game so you can essentially have to restart a map because of a missclick.
Some of the missions I couldn't complete no matter how I built the lines or whatever transports I used. While not breaking the game it sure makes the temporary missions annoying if you keep getting ones that don't work.

[h1] The Conclusion [/h1]
I got this game for free by a friend and while I enjoyed surprisingly well I would only give it a 5/10 despite spending 90 hours on it (a decent amount was AFK) . The gameplay feels underwhelming and while its alright for sandbox play it isn't anything special. The big points of the game goes to the graphics. At the highest setting the game looks amazing with great details zooming in and looking at the city close-up. I don't recommend the game, its pretty cheap at a sale and I doubt it gets much better with dlcs so only consider it if you really are into these kind of games.

//ECE//

author: {'steamid': '76561198005819127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 21169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20810, 'last_played': 1692588419}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049502568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1652728860}
review:
[h1] Rating: 1/5 [/h1]

Cities in Motion provides the experience of operating a company that plans transportation in cities. As I played this game all I could really think is that I could just be playing a better game that does the same thing. 

This game's UI is barbaric. It's spammy, aggressive, and constantly cluttered with crude pop-up windows and tiny icons, which makes building a nightmare. In fact, even the tutorial messages are lodged in the top left corner in size 8 font, potentially to taunt the player.

Even getting past the UI building does not feel good in this game. The options are far too limited, and duplicative. Sadly, they couldn't even be bothered to implement roundabouts. ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

I obviously cannot recommend this game. It plays about similar to a hypothetical scenario where the dude who made Stationeers was asked to make The Sims in Python only. Play Cities Skylines instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075767343', 'num_games_owned': 3659, 'num_reviews': 500, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1649994716}
review:
É incrível como Cities in Motion 2 tem tanta coisa boa quanto coisa ruim, nem sei por onde começar..

Bem, antes de tudo é importante frisar que CIM2 não é um jogo de criação de cidades mas sim de gerenciamento de transportes. De qualquer forma, é possível colaborar no crescimento da cidade fazendo ruas, avenidas e estradas, também dá para se jogar no modo sandbox e você controlar as ruas como quiser, mas ainda assim não chega a ser um SimCity ou Cities Skylines.

A nível do que o jogo se propõe a ser, ele é bem competente e cumpre bem. Há 5 tipos de transporte diferentes, diversas ruas mas em relação a mapas provavelmente você precisará baixar algum do workshop e ainda se acostumar a mover os arquivos para uma outra pasta pois a implementação no jogo foi mal feita. Ao mesmo tempo que parece ser simples no sentido de fazer pontos, terminais e linhas de transporte, é bem complexo por ter muitos detalhes e você ser obrigado a seguir um padrão do jogo para o desenvolvimento do seu transporte, tornando um tanto tedioso no começo.

Eu pessoalmente não recomendo se o objetivo for algum gerenciador mais completo ou até mesmo um de cidades. Dentro da proposta dele é até que bom mas pensando em expandir conforme o que ele parece ser já começa a pecar em vários pontos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059202680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1666990807}

I stopped playing after realizing that, in order to add bus lanes to a 6 lane bridge, I was going to have to completely demolish the bridge and rebuild with a new road type. author: {'steamid': '76561198048347273', 'num_games_owned': 1029, 'num_reviews': 389, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1641654222}
review:
[quote] [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36579661-Setna/]Başlamadan önce diğer incelemelerimin olduğu küratör sayfamı takip edin.[/url] [/quote]

Eyvah eyvah, çok sıkıntı.

[h1] Görevli Kısımlar Bile Sıkıntı [/h1]

CiM1'de de olduğu gibi burada da hikaye yok ama görevli bölümler var. Lakin bunlar bile sıkıntı. Hatta oyunun eğitim kısmı bile sıkıntılı. Görevleri fena uydurmamışlar yine de.

[h1] Mekanikler Düzgün Çalışmıyor [/h1]

Normalde hoş bir tarza sahip, detaylı bir seyahat yönetim oyunu. Toplumların kullanacağı metro, tramvay ve otobüs gibi toplu taşıma araçlarını bir şehir için yönetiyorsunuz. Yollarını bile siz yapıyorsunuz. Lakin mekanikler o kadar sıkıntılı çalışıyor ki oyun seyahat yönetiminden çok şehir yönetimine kaymaya başlıyor. Her şey saçma sapan yerleştirilmiş, basit 1-2 inşa işi için onlarca ev yıkmanız gerekiyor gibi gibi.

Bu tarz oyunları oynarken boşa harcadığınız her para size çok ciddi sıkıntı oluşturabiliyor. Kuruş kuruş hesap yapmalısınız. Lakin oyunun CiM2'de mekanikler sorunlu olduğu için en uygun şekilde ayarlayamıyorsunuz kendinizi. Örneğin iki metro yolunu birleştirmeniz gerekiyor, fakat istasyona gelen metro yolu bir anda birleşmemeye karar veriyor. Eh yol istasyonun içinden geçmeyince sistemi başlatamıyorsunuz, harcadığınız onca para havaya gitmiş oluyor. İnşa mekaniklerindeki sorunlar da eklenince oyun bir çileye dönüşüyor.

[h1] Düşük Grafikler[/h1]

Yani önceki oyunda da kötüydü grafikler. Aradan 2 yıl geçmiş, yahu şu oyunu 2013'e göre şekillendirsenize. Bu grafik kalitesi neden bu kadar kötü. Oyunun boyutu artsın biraz daha ne var ya? 1GB oyun mu olur anasını satıyım? Hayır böyle hafif bir oyun yapıyorsun ama ona rağmen teknik sorunlar var. Özellikle yükleme ekranları. Şu tarz bir oyunda 5-10 saniye sürecek yükleme ekranı 50-60 saniyeyi bulabiliyor. Üstelik ben bu oyunu çıkış tarihinden yıllar sonra oynuyorum, yani kullandığım sistem çok daha modern. Kaldı ki sistemim modern şartlara göre bile üst düzey ama ben böyle sorun yaşıyorsam diğer insanların vay haline!

CiM1'in üstüne az çok bir şeyler konulmaya çalışılmış lakin şu eski arayüz ve grafiklerden kurtulamamışlar. Bolca mekanik sorunu var, teknik sorunları var. DLC'lere de yaslanıyor. Yüksek indirimdeyken merakınız varsa alın. 55SP

review:
Ahoj, tuto hru jsem poprvé viděl u mého kamaráda, velice se mi zalíbila, teď po dvou letech mi můj strejda tuto hru zaplatil, mám sice jen tu hru bez balíčku, ale velice se mi líbí. Máte k dispozici Autobusy, trolejbusy, Tramvaje, Metro a přívoz, ( v balíčku je i Jednokolejka). hru jsem si zamiloval a velice ji doporučuji těm, kteří rádi staví, řeší trochu složitější situace. jediné co mně mrzí je že ve hře nejsou naše České Tramvaje, kromně 15T v balíčku. Doporučuji 9/10

+ Grafika                                                 - Nejsou zde České Tramvaje
+ Hratelnost                                            - Balíček je celkem drahý 
+ pěkné mapy
+ jednoduchost a složitost
+ musí se u toho přemýšlet :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198245123216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 65459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28320, 'last_played': 1708604589}
review:
「貴方は、公共交通が全くない大都市の、初代・交通局長に任命されました！」
（あるいは、運営を委託された民間企業の社長さん？）
…という感じのゲームです。

与えられた予算で、赤字路線を作らないように注意し
内部留保から新路線の建設費用を捻出し
全都市を公共交通でカバーし
「顧客満足度１００％」を目指します。


「電車・バス1日乗車券」や、
定期券の値段を決めたりも、できます
（海外でも定期は、1か月・3か月・6か月なのか…）

このゲームでは、始発駅の時刻に限り
「駅・バス停に掲示してある時刻表」の書式で、ダイヤを設定する事ができます！
電車・バス等が大好きは方は、萌え萌え～、では？
最短、5分間隔での運行が可能です
（「Ａ列車で行こう」等と同じく、ゲーム内は時間の流れが速いので、実際は15分位が限界のようですが…）

ほかに、休日ダイヤ
朝夕ラッシュ時の増発（同時発車も出来るので、夜行バスの「２号車」みたく「続行便」の設定も可能）
終夜運転（海外では大晦日以外も実施）

※このゲームでは、短い路線でない限り
終夜運行しないと、翌朝、車両が来ない区間が発生する…


車両は運行中、コンディション100％から低下していき
０％になる前に車庫に戻る路線を作り（渋滞で帰着が遅れる事も…）
車庫に帰着した車両は、整備を受けてコンディションが100％に回復するまでの時間を考慮し…
車庫に何台、配車するかも腕の見せ所です。


メトロ（電車）は、線路の建設費が高額ですが
渋滞に巻き込まれないので、余分な車両を買う必要がなく
乗務員の人数＝人件費も抑えられ
速く移動できるため、市民から好評です

※「単線」レールの敷きが独特すぎで、慣れるまで大変ですが…


ＤＬＣ「モノレール」を導入すれば『エヴァ』の「第三新東京市」を再現可能…？？
→路面電車より定員が少ないモノレールは、メトロ（電車）の代わりには成りません（涙）


Cities:Skylineや、Transport Feverみたく、乗り物の定員が少ないですが…
（全員着席させる、立ち席も、座席定員の1.5倍まで…快適な車内環境がモットー？）
感染症対策が必要な世界では、より一層「車内の密を避ける」リアリティが…（涙）

author: {'steamid': '76561197999042947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1633430727}
review:
Contrary to many reviews, this is a fun, enjoyable game for building urban transportation systems.  

But the original Cities in Motion was better, even though it was *very* limited, and had numerous technical problems and simplifications that this game improved on, for one simple reason:

The cities in this game have no soul.  

In the original Cities in Motion, you felt like you were in a living, breathing city, with some history and presence.  Its versions of Berlin, Vienna, London, etc are obviously simplified, but they are built like their namesakes, and they *feel* like the cities that inspired them: wide plazas sit in front of churches and public buildings, gardens peep through in strange corners, and large train stations connecting the city to the wider world see locomotives steaming in and out, while the occasional airplane from the airport buzzes overhead and the barge traffic on the river chugs past.  

In CiM2, all of that extra depth is gone, completely lost in favor of procedurally generated cities that, by virtue of potentially being able to exist "anywhere" give you a sense of being nowhere.  I'm sure that this change made the game *way* cheaper to make, but honestly, it is a major loss for what could have been a beautiful and unique game.   Instead it is just a transit-focused city simulator without zoning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198991093580', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2440, 'last_played': 1690945617}
review:
对这种经营类游戏完全无法抗拒~
相比之下，TransportFever更倾向于跨城的物流、物资的运输方面，而Cities in Motion则聚焦城市内：在各种奇奇怪怪的地形下，产生出了各种古灵精怪的城市布局，也有了许多交通方面的需求。市民们的通勤、上学、旅游、购物都是需要细细考虑的因素。剧情模式下系统给出的任务也是十分有趣，如收益达标、交通覆盖率、答应某些组织的交通需求等……往往耍上一局就是一整天，昏天黑地，真的肝~

就是有两点感觉不太满意的：
（1）没中文，希望第三代可以跟进（如果有的话）
（2）AI市民的智商有待改进~

review:
Just get Cities Skyline. It is from the same developer and publisher but 100x better in controls. By controls I mean trying to place the roads, train tracks on the areas you exactly want it to be because this game will not help you do that at all.

Only get or play this if you're achievement hunting (or trying to maintain achievement streak per day) or if you hate yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339946405', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 32049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31492, 'last_played': 1628182781}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992911206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1627820408}
review:
Nice in theory, but sadly the controls and UI are aweful. Placing and removing costs money, so every misclick is expensive. And those happen quite often, as you keep the last building option selected. I've deleted a couple of roads, when I actually wanted to inspect cars. In addition, it's not always totally clear what you've got selected. I've placed an entire set of wrong stop signs, and only realized that at the end.

For the creation of lines: In most cases when anything changes on an existing line, you have to delete it and redo it, as it only fixes itself sometimes, and mostly in the wrong way.

The worst part: there really is almost no traffic in the city, so it feels kind of stupid to place all of the infrastructure, when it's not really needed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198295875913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1669654979}
review:
O jogo tem um gigantesco potencial, mas a execução não é das melhores. A gente percebe que ele é um antecessor do maravilhoso Cities Skylines, mas até na proposta do CiM, o Skylines se sai melhor. A forma de construção no Motions não é tão intuitiva. Esse negócio de as linhas obrigatoriamente terem de voltar à garagem atrapalha o planejamento, além de a própria garagem ter uma capacidade pequena de transportes. É bem enjoado construir as vias (apesar de em alguns momentos você ter bem mais liberdade que no Skylines), mas o maior problema do jogo são os crashes. Já perdi a conta de quantas horas de trabalho foram jogadas fora porque o jogo simplesmente fecha. E não é problema de hardware. Tô com um notebook novo, de 2021, muito mais potente do que a configuração pedida pelo Cities in Motion 2, e o jogo simplesmente fecha. É muito frustrante.

Quer construir sistema de transporte público de uma forma legal? Vá jogar o maravilhoso Cities Skylines.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239912758', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7450, 'last_played': 1705527651}
review:
[h1] Una oportunidad perdida [/h1]

Cities in motion 2 tiene como premisa encargarse del transporte público de las distintas ciudades; tanto incluidas en el juego, como de los mapas del workshop. Nos entrega múltiples herramientas y modos de transporte variados para lograr este cometido, sin embargo, para mí el juego esta mal hecho, no tiene autoguardado, no es posible acuatizar el tamaño de las carreteras. el juego crashea de la nada, los vehículos se quedan detenidos provocando atascos gigantescos, etc.
A pesar de todo lo anterior el juego es divertido, bastante original. Si quieres jugar un juego como este no tienes otra opción, características como los horarios y frecuencia sólo están en este juego.
Debes tener mucha paciencia para aguantar los bugs, guardar la partida manualmente de forma constante para no perder tu progreso.
Mi paciencia aguantó hasta jugar  124 horas ya no aguante más los problemas del juego y lo desintale , los bugs pueden ser pequeños pero arruinan de gran manera el ánimo de seguir jugando.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11095, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1617368690}
review:
Cities in Motion 2, like the first Cities in Motion, is not a city building game like Sim City.  It's a transit route building game, more like a pathing puzzle game than a city tycoon game.  Take Sim City and remove all the gameplay except placing bus stops and train stations, and you have Cities in Motion. 

The upside to Cities in Motion 2 is that it does have 4K support, unlike the version this obsoletes.  Unfortunately despite being made in 2013, the developers never heard about DPI scaling so the text is impossibly small to read.  In a game where text forms a major part of the gameplay (budgets, plans, all that stuff), having unreadable text makes it impossible to play.  It's unusual the developers didn't do any software testing on the kinds of PCs that were available in 2013 or they would have picked this up. 

Anyway, there's a crazy $20 USD price tag on this, which is more than you can get Cities Skylines for (from Paradox, too!).  Skylines has all the same gameplay PLUS all the city building stuff.  This is just impossible to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198994796062', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1598986168}
review:
This game saved my life.

I am 43.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiralling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007215043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1614015583}
review:
По сравнению с первой частью - большой шаг назад. 
Разработчики сделали ставку на бизнес модель Crusader Kings и Cities Skylines. Но эта бизнес модель подразумевает идеальный и абсолютно играбельный клиент без всех DLC. И как раз с играбельностью у CiM2 большие проблемы.
Исчезла историческая прогрессия. Только огромные и уже развившиеся современные города. Только современный транспорт. Никаких междугородних перевозок. Все что вам будет нужно делать в этой игре, это строить новые линии, ловить блох в ценах на билеты от которых зависит счастье пассажиров и нужное накопление денег на следующую линию.
Хочу отдельно подчеркнуть - от фана из CiM1 не осталось и следа. Но даже CiM1 балансировала на грани и не баловала контентом, а в CiM2 его считайте и вовсе нет.

review:
InGame Zeit ist eine Katastrophe. Fast Forward ist so langsam, dass man Ewigkeiten warten muss, bevor ausreichend viel Zeit vergangen ist für Geld etc.
Keine sinnvolle Möglichkeit den Verkehrsfluss zu analysieren, damit man die passenden Busverbindungen erstellen kann. Sollte man ja von so einem Spiel erwarten. Interface und Analysetools sind insgesamt katastrophal und nehmen einem schnell das Vergnügen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023755485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1613089768}
review:
Im Vergleich zu anderen Stadt-Transport-Simulationen zwar Detailverliebt einerseits:
+ wer fährt
+ zu welchem Preis
+ bei welcher Zone
+ und Uhrzeit
+ in welcher Taktung
+ wohin
und so weiter, jedoch bezüglich der Bedienbarkeit schlecht.
- Unzureichendes Tutorial
- Mangelhafte Konfigurierbarkeit
- Zu leicht kann man durch unpräzises Klicken riesige Schäden auslösen, die sich nur durch neuladen - sofern man entsprechend häufig speichert - lösen lassen

review: What sets me in motion is the fact that cities could be in motion the way they are in this game. No puns here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284749614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 38324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26699, 'last_played': 1663580150}
review: Im addicted to this game, as you can tell, so my opinion might be swayed. People keep comparing it to C:S, and that is unfair. 1. They are different genres, CIM2 is a transport tycoon thingy, but C:S is a city builder. 2. More importantly, CIM2 is quite older than C:S. As time goes on, games evolve, and if CIM2 was released after C:S, it would be on the same level. I hate reading through reviews, and seeing half of them not recommended, just because C:S has a better feel. It is stupid. You can't compare the original Super Mario Bros to Mario Oddesy, or even Mario 64, games evolve, and such has C:s to CIM2. Yes, this game is buggy and a not as good as it could have been, but stop comparing it to C:S.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296793086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1589551019}
review:
YOU MUST DO RESPECT CHN MARKET or YOU’ll BE IN A BAD NAME.【务必尊重中国市场，不然坏了名声】
刚随意逛逛评论，看到bbblucky的熟肉搬运，我决定给一星差评。如果真的源自客服说的话，那确实太不客气，太不礼貌了。结尾搬运的那句“在steamworks文献库上有这么一段话，说如果游戏不支持中文，厂商可能会得到大量中国玩家的差评。”  虽我没去证实源文，但苦于一款通篇文字的游戏，等候中文多时无果，足以让人生气。
客服这样不尊重人，玩家请求中文，你却叫人出门右转玩别的游戏。那我们成全你。

author: {'steamid': '76561198055232461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3209, 'last_played': 1658339044}
review: I love this game its a great mix of Traffic Giant and Transport Tycoon. I have found that I can easily get lost in the game and spend hours immersed in play. I found that some aspects take a while to master such as time passing in the game in relation to time tables, managing some of the routes and occasional bugs. But overall its a great game for those who are into traffic management and transport tycoon games. The modding features are also really good and make the size and capacities of the buses/trains more realistic

author: {'steamid': '76561198052084477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2130, 'last_played': 1703278876}
review:
Лучшая игра в сфере менеджмента общественного транспорта. Изначально может отпугнуть своей не самой красивой графикой, но к ней быстро привыкаешь. Разработчики отказались от использования прототипов реальных городов из первой части, вместо этого у нас 6 вымышленных поселений. Активно я играл на 2-3 картах, другие мне показались неудачными. Остальные я скачал из Мастерской, выбор там огромный, поэтому рекомендую сразу любительские накатывать. Сама игра очень затягивает, геймплейно вопросов почти нет. Из самого большого минуса: иногда может сбиваться время ожидания (т.е. транспорт почему-то слишком рано/слишком поздно выезжает из парка/депо), но это возможно я где-то косячу. Инструментарий большой, можно даже город на районы делить, чтобы для каждой из зон устанавливать свою цену за билет


P.S. Отдельное спасибо за троллейбусы, обделённые вниманием со стороны других подобных игр

author: {'steamid': '76561198088132057', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1918, 'last_played': 1608387822}
review:
https://forum.paradoxplaza.com/forum/index.php?threads/is-ther-any-plan-to-add-chinese-support-in-ck2%E3%80%81eu4%E3%80%81hoi4-and-stellaris%EF%BC%9F.1077611/

Just today I saw the paradox support rep. refused the request from a Chinese player that supporting official Chinese.

就在今天，我看到了P社客服对一位玩家的官方中文请求表达了拒绝。

They said:

他们说：

"We sell our games to people in many many countries in the world, we can't localise for all of them. Aside from China we've had similar comments (in some cases demands) from Turkey, Japan, Russia, and others I can't think of right now."

“我们游戏卖到了全世界，我们不能为每个国家都推出其语言。除了中国，我们还有来自土耳其，日本，俄罗斯以及其他我现在说不上来的国家的类似的评论（有时是需求）”

"The answer is always that our marketing department constantly evaluates all these markets to see if a localisation makes economic sense; so far it has not for those PDS games, it seems. Cities:Skylines has Chinese, if you're interested in that game."

“我们的回答不变：我们的市场部门一直在评估所有国家的市场，以发掘推出本地化语言包是否可以带来经济效益；对于这些游戏来讲，至今为止似乎并不能。城市：天际线有中文版，如果你喜欢的话可以去玩。”

"The other point is that old games like CK2 and EU4 are never going to be completely re-written at this late stage in their lives."

“另外，像CK2和EU4这样的老游戏不会在他们的晚年被完全重做。”

Firstly I must say that, for stellaris, Chinese players have contributed 100K sells, It's the fifth most purchase in all nations. However, Chinese is still not be included in the newly updated official localizations. So I don't know why they are thinking the 100K cannot afford a readable official Chinese update. Or, let me ask, is the new sellings more important than the money from 100K players they have already gained?

首先必须说的是，中国玩家已经为群星贡献了10万的销量。这个数字排在世界销量的第五。然而，最新发布的官方语言包仍然没有中文。所以我不知道为什么他们会觉得100K销量无法换来一个官方中文版。或者，我想问的是，难道新的销量比已经到手的100K玩家的钱更重要吗？

Okey Okey, let me share some records. FM2016, without Chinese, sold 50k in China; FM2017， with Chinese and a selling number more than 100k. Total War : Warhammer updated a Chinese language very late and gained 60k Chinese buyers, and Total War : Warhammer II with Chinese language is released for half a year, obtained the 50K purchase in Chinese and of course the number is increasing. No I'm not talking about the economics stuff but the attitude of Chinese people: we respect the producers who respect us.

好吧好吧，那让我来提供更多的数据。没有官中的足球经理2016在中国卖了5万，有官中的足球经理2017在中国卖了10万以上。战锤1在后半段才有官中，在中国卖了6万；而有官中的战锤2发售了半年，销量已经超过5万，当然这个数字还在增长。不，别误会，我不是在说经济问题，我是在说中国玩家的态度:我们尊重那些尊重我们的厂商。

I also don't know what is "CSL has Chinese if you are interested in that game" meaning. Dude he purchased for your products and when someday he is asking for a service, you says he can play another game?! I don't think it is respectful words for a customer group. Do you think we are only focusing on Chinese language? Our emphasis is THE RESPECT TO 100K PLAYERS.

顺便我不太明白“城市天际线有中文，你喜欢可以去玩”是什么意思。大哥，人家卖了你们的游戏，然后人家在请求服务时候，你跟人家说你可以玩别的？我不觉得这话尊重一个玩家群体。你觉得我们只关注中文吗？不不不我们关注的是你们是否尊重这10万个买了游戏的人。

There is such words on steamworks: The less a language looks like English, the higher the expected return. Many customers in Asian territories for example do not speak English, while many customers in European countries do. Also, I know while the producers are releasing new games, there would be a notice mentioning that they are going to have a lot dislikes from Chinese player if the games do not have Chinese localization. Thanks a lot for steam.

在steamworks文献库上有这么一段话：最不像英文的语言，投资回报率越高——比方说，许多亚洲的顾客不说英文，而许多欧洲国家的顾客会说英文。同时我也知道在厂商们上线新游戏的时候，会得到一个提示，说如果游戏不支持中文，厂商可能会得到大量中国玩家的差评。非常感谢steam。

Thank you for reading it.
感谢阅读。

author: {'steamid': '76561198416047375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 5532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1663461653}
review:
写评测的时候，比较复杂。
先说说问题和缺点，游戏没有中文，虽然没有很难的单词，但是P社看似并不愿意在这个游戏上增加中文。当然，可能是销量实在是不咋地，加入一种语言的成本太高。其次，车型也不是特别多，创意工坊也不要指望有什么车型，就算创意工坊有，用到地图上也是单头的。顺便还有一个所有P社经营游戏总是存在的问题——只要有线路，无论运营时间，刁民都会在车站等。
不过游戏呢是个好游戏，首先时刻表这个玩意我很喜欢，当然司机等工作人员工资以及可以调整的票价确实不错（一直提醒我票价过高过低很烦）。顺便修改游戏时间、价格、容量等都比较简单，在Tools里面都能改，修改范围为1%~1000%，时间进度3%为真实时间。如果使用原版时间，时刻表不建议使用5分钟的间隔。

author: {'steamid': '76561198117998858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3307, 'last_played': 1558130014}
review:
Benutzer "tomdotio" hat bereits sehr treffend zusammengefasst, wie sich CIM 1 und CIM 2 grundlegend unterscheiden und ich kann das nur bestätigen. Daher gehe ich darauf nicht weiter ein.

WARNEN muss ich aber in aller Deutlichkeit vor der Erwartung, der Multiplayer-Modus könnte Spaß machen. Das tut er leider nicht, denn das Spiel gerät dabei reproduzierbar nach einer Weile aus der Synchronisation, was sich nicht beheben lässt. D.h. die Mitspieler sehen, obwohl sie gemeinsam auf einer Map spielen, unterschiedliche Bauzustände. Früher oder später führt das zu Frust, denn man kann eigentlich ständig neu anfangen.

Ich hatte den Publisher Paradox schon vor längerer Zeit, als gerade Cities: Skylines erschienen war, darauf angesprochen. Mir wurde mitgeteilt, man könne sich damit gerade nicht befassen, da Cities: Skylines gerade alle Ressourcen binde. Man würde sich dem aber später annehmen. Das ist aber NIE geschehen.

Als Single-Player-Spiel, ggf. für einen rabattierten Kaufpreis, kann man sich CIM2 antun. Aber als Multi-Player-Spiel: Finger weg!

author: {'steamid': '76561198809350475', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1637486690}
review:
[b]Jouabilité, ergonomie : 0/5[/b] [i](Les menus ne sont pas ergonomiques et ils se referment constamment. Nous sommes donc constamment obligés de développer chacune des catégories pour effectuer - à la suite - deux actions pareilles.)[/i]

[b]Réalisme, immersion : 2/5[/b] [i](Vous n'aurez jamais vu une ville aussi vivante.)[/i]

[b]Graphismes, interface : 3/5[/b]

[b]Général : 2/5[/b]


[b]Moyenne : 2/5[/b]


Je ne recommande ce jeu à personne. Il s'agit d'un jeu de gestion dans lequel la quête de l'amusement ne doit pas être une priorité. Les menus sont horribles et illisibles, les missions n'ont aucun sens et le tout est très compliqué. Si vous souhaitez tout de même vous y risquer, n'y dépensez pas plus de quelques centimes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198845688243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1607584094}
review:
几乎是最专业的市内客运交通模拟游戏......但是靠车辆包恰饭所以不开放创意工坊还是令人吐血，另外不支持中文的问题，可以去网上下载大神制作的1.6.3版的汉化包。
界面-6分 略显过时并且陈旧繁琐，令人眼花缭乱，字体太小。
玩法-9分 交通的模拟贴近于真实，有早晚高峰（天际线那个是假的早晚高峰）、排班表/调度系统（功能是交通模拟游戏里面最强大的了）、还有分区票价，除此之外电车还可以直通地铁、搞快慢车，这一点令人惊喜。
游戏体验-8分 总得来说相较于天际线流畅很多，甚至相较于1代也有所进步，但是教程实在是令人看不懂。

https://forum.paradoxplaza.com/forum/index.php?threads/is-ther-any-plan-to-add-chinese-support-in-ck2%E3%80%81eu4%E3%80%81hoi4-and-stellaris%EF%BC%9F.1077611/

Just today I saw the paradox support rep. refused the request from a Chinese player that supporting official Chinese.

就在今天，我看到了P社客服对一位玩家的官方中文请求表达了拒绝。

They said:

他们说：

"We sell our games to people in many many countries in the world, we can't localise for all of them. Aside from China we've had similar comments (in some cases demands) from Turkey, Japan, Russia, and others I can't think of right now."

“我们游戏卖到了全世界，我们不能为每个国家都推出其语言。除了中国，我们还有来自土耳其，日本，俄罗斯以及其他我现在说不上来的国家的类似的评论（有时是需求）”

"The answer is always that our marketing department constantly evaluates all these markets to see if a localisation makes economic sense; so far it has not for those PDS games, it seems. Cities:Skylines has Chinese, if you're interested in that game."

“我们的回答不变：我们的市场部门一直在评估所有国家的市场，以发掘推出本地化语言包是否可以带来经济效益；对于这些游戏来讲，至今为止似乎并不能。城市：天际线有中文版，如果你喜欢的话可以去玩。”

"The other point is that old games like CK2 and EU4 are never going to be completely re-written at this late stage in their lives."

“另外，像CK2和EU4这样的老游戏不会在他们的晚年被完全重做。”

Firstly I must say that, for stellaris, Chinese players have contributed 100K sells, It's the fifth most purchase in all nations. However, Chinese is still not be included in the newly updated official localizations. So I don't know why they are thinking the 100K cannot afford a readable official Chinese update. Or, let me ask, is the new sellings more important than the money from 100K players they have already gained?

首先必须说的是，中国玩家已经为群星贡献了10万的销量。这个数字排在世界销量的第五。然而，最新发布的官方语言包仍然没有中文。所以我不知道为什么他们会觉得100K销量无法换来一个官方中文版。或者，我想问的是，难道新的销量比已经到手的100K玩家的钱更重要吗？

Okey Okey, let me share some records. FM2016, without Chinese, sold 50k in China; FM2017， with Chinese and a selling number more than 100k. Total War : Warhammer updated a Chinese language very late and gained 60k Chinese buyers, and Total War : Warhammer II with Chinese language is released for half a year, obtained the 50K purchase in Chinese and of course the number is increasing. No I'm not talking about the economics stuff but the attitude of Chinese people: we respect the producers who respect us.

好吧好吧，那让我来提供更多的数据。没有官中的足球经理2016在中国卖了5万，有官中的足球经理2017在中国卖了10万以上。战锤1在后半段才有官中，在中国卖了6万；而有官中的战锤2发售了半年，销量已经超过5万，当然这个数字还在增长。不，别误会，我不是在说经济问题，我是在说中国玩家的态度:我们尊重那些尊重我们的厂商。

I also don't know what is "CSL has Chinese if you are interested in that game" meaning. Dude he purchased for your products and when someday he is asking for a service, you says he can play another game?! I don't think it is respectful words for a customer group. Do you think we are only focusing on Chinese language? Our emphasis is THE RESPECT TO 100K PLAYERS.

顺便我不太明白“城市天际线有中文，你喜欢可以去玩”是什么意思。大哥，人家卖了你们的游戏，然后人家在请求服务时候，你跟人家说你可以玩别的？我不觉得这话尊重一个玩家群体。你觉得我们只关注中文吗？不不不我们关注的是你们是否尊重这10万个买了游戏的人。

There is such words on steamworks: The less a language looks like English, the higher the expected return. Many customers in Asian territories for example do not speak English, while many customers in European countries do. Also, I know while the producers are releasing new games, there would be a notice mentioning that they are going to have a lot dislikes from Chinese player if the games do not have Chinese localization. Thanks a lot for steam.

在steamworks文献库上有这么一段话：最不像英文的语言，投资回报率越高——比方说，许多亚洲的顾客不说英文，而许多欧洲国家的顾客会说英文。同时我也知道在厂商们上线新游戏的时候，会得到一个提示，说如果游戏不支持中文，厂商可能会得到大量中国玩家的差评。非常感谢steam。

Thank you for reading it.
感谢阅读。

author: {'steamid': '76561198797807102', 'num_games_owned': 37, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1102, 'last_played': 1689446506}
review:
Отличная транспортная стратегия. Как по мне одна из лучших игр жанра. Лично мне понравилась за реализм. По крайней мере я не видел еще такого уровня в играх этого жанра. Хочется похвалить игру за ее проработку. Здесь можно и график работы распланировать, и выпуск на линию. Так же иногда заставляет пошевелить мозгами, за что отдельно заслуживает внимания. 
Единственный минус игры, это моддинг. Из него нам представлено только лишь картостроение, что колоссально отличает эту часть от первой. Да и кастомизация игры слегка хромает, но это уходит на второй план. Говорить, что игра плохая из-за отсуствия моддинга, я считаю глупым. Игра заслуживает своего внимания. Я бы дал игре 8.5/10

review:
Игра на любителей, на пару часов!
Не рекомендую так как сама игра пустая, вам придется покупать платные дополнения. Что по мне не очень хорошо!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019051664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 32843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26260, 'last_played': 1640274354}
review:
Итак, наиграв 400+ часов в этой чудо-игре, я всё-таки решил написать обзор.
Как и многие другие игры от Парадоксов, она не из самых лёгких в освоении (особенно, её интерфейс), но привыкнуть к ней можно (при условии, если вы будете играть настолько долго, что разберётесь во всех её аспектах). В наличии тонны графиков, статистики и недовольных маршрутами пассажиров. Можно прокладывать любые дороги, любые маршруты, транспорт представлен в удовлетворительном количестве, хотя и хотелось бы побольше; помимо джентельменского набора из автобуса (икарус!), трамвая (татра!) и троллейбуса (зиу!), присутствует метро, монорельс и водный транспорт. В процессе игры, к сожалению, практически невозможно строить здания самостоятельно, за исключением пары-тройки достопримечательностей. Маршруты же можно настраивать на любой вкус, есть даже комбинированные остановки автобус/троллейбус/трамвай + гибкое расписание с учётом выходных дней, ночи и часа пик… Остаётся только набрать кредитов, понаоткрывать линий и PROFIT! Лучше всего, начинать с метро или монорельс, с них всегда идёт большая прибыль, да и кредит отбить легче. 
Ещё в игре есть кампания (которую я так и не прошёл), несколько карт, заботливо созданных разработчиками, случайные задания и мультиплеер. Плюс, присутствует редактор карт (которым тоже нужно научиться пользоваться, иначе он может восстать против вас и в одночасье превратить вашу карту в подобие 3D-электрокардиограммы) 
Однако… Всё это нивелируется невообразимо тупейшим ИИ и постоянными за****тыми багами. 
Во-первых, машины всегда едут кратчайшим путём, из-за чего заторы могут возникнуть (и возникнут) даже почти на пустых улицах.
Во-вторых,  поведение тех же машин иногда ВООБЩЕ не поддаётся никакой логике. Выехать на встречку и крашнуть всё полосу? – да пожалуйста. Встать на месте и остановить полгорода? – легко. 
В-третьих, транспорт… он также часто застревает на пустых улицах, собирает вокруг себя толпы людей, которые кружат вокруг него, не пуская транспорт дальше, вследствие чего нарушается расписание, создаётся пробка. Решается это удалением дороги/отменой и быстрым возвратом линии, продажей застрявшего драндулета/выходом на рабочий стол и удалением игры к х**м собачьим. 
и так далее…
Но так бывает не всегда. Количество багов зависит только от настроения искусственного идиота, фазы ретроградного марса, частоты вспышек на Солнце и степени бомбления вашего пукана в процессе наслаждения игрой. 
Резюмируя, скажу, что, главный плюс этой игры в том, что у неё почти нет аналогов. И в этом же её главный минус.
100 несчастных пассажиров из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198861342661', 'num_games_owned': 926, 'num_reviews': 649, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 735, 'last_played': 1573783710}
review:
Казалось бы, что сложного в том, чтобы настроить автобусное/троллейбусное движение в городе? Ну, провел несколько маршрутов через весь город и все довольны. Не-а.

Вся суть стратегий - мыслить. Разрабатывать планы, реализовывать идеи и делать так, чтобы то, что вы делаете, функционировало хорошо. В Cities in Motion 2 этот аспект особенно важен. Вам нужно тщательно продумывать маршруты транспорта так, чтобы люди могли ездить из дома на работу, с работы на отдых и так далее, используя самые разные способы. Строить маршруты так, чтобы пассажиры могли пересаживаться с автобуса на метро, с метро на речные трамваи и так далее. Иными словами - построить мощную инфраструктуру, функционирующую так, чтобы пассажиры оставались довольны. А вот обеспечить это проблематично. Ведь если они будут стоять по 4 часа на остановке в ожидании автобуса, в который хоть как-то можно поместиться.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988689160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1591474286}
review: This game has great graphics and zoom capabilities - ok, not the first priority of things I look at in city builder simulation games so it's just a nice to have. While the idea of the game is great, unfortunately once going beyond bus lines the building functionality is just so bugged that it's ridiculous. Especially if you want to build subways you're either lucky or reload a 20 times until you finally manage to build a subway looking somewhat like what you wanted. I could play this for hours and hours if building worked fine, but like this the game was uninstalled after playing it for a few hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198836566749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1728, 'last_played': 1590958297}
review:
J'avais bien accroché au 1, avec ses villes "réelles" et ses scénarios tout à fait sympathiques. J'aurais mieux fait de passer mon chemin pour le 2. 
Alors oui, il y a de la nouveauté, avec une gestion du temps totalement différente (jour/nuit/weekend). Mais le mode campagne est terriblement décevant, avec des villes sans âme, et des missions aléatoires tout à fait ennuyeuses.
Bref, contrairement au 1, cet opus est pour ainsi dire un pur sandbox -personnellement, je ne m'y retrouve pas. j'ai fini la campagne par principe, mais sans entrain...

author: {'steamid': '76561198189439986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 4858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3005, 'last_played': 1639825467}
review:
Если вы любитель транспортных стратегий и хотите вспомнить старину, то эта игра для вас. Здесь есть компания, песочница и даже мультиплеер. К сожалению моды работают через одно место, но ничего не поделаешь, игра уже стара и давно ни кем не обновляется.
Так что играть можно, но придёться потерпеть её не большие лаги и баги.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021403893', 'num_games_owned': 2597, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1565403864}
review:
В данном обзоре я расскажу вам об игре Cities in Motion 2. От разработчика Colossal Order Ltd.  Обзор не содержит плагиата и написан целиком и полностью мной, Гвардом.


Игра Cities in Motion 2 это симулятор транспортной компании с элементами менеджмента. И надо отметить весьма проработанный и хардкорный.

На главном экране мы можем пройти туториал и тут я крайне настоятельно рекомендую пройти его даже если ранее вы играли уже в подобные игры. Хотя в данному случае туториал выполнен на отвратительном уровне и мало чему по сути обучает от чего игроку будет крайне сложно освоится. Но все же.
После запуска игры и старта в главном меню мы попадаем на экран выбора города в котором будет происходить собственно наше самоуправление. Города как абсолютно реальные так и вымышленные. Каждый реальный город обладает своей топографией полностью соответствующей реальному прообразу. Затем мы собственно попадаем на экран самой игры и первое что мы видим это красивейший пейзаж, который мы наблюдаем словно бы с высоты птичьего полета. А так же мы видим наш собственно город щелкнув по которому, и приблизив мышкой мы оказываемся над ним.

Графический движок игры великолепен и поддерживает возможность масштабирования как с огромной высоты так и практически до самого тротуара улица. Практически позволяя нам заглянуть в глаза прохожим. Ну почти. Детализация весьма качественная как для игры 2013 года.

И вот опустивши камеру до дорог и улиц мы видим что трафика нет, дороги пусты. Только по тротуарам ходят жители. Причем мы можем щелкнуть по любому человечку и прочитать краткую информацию о нем включая его ФИО. Как главе транспортной компании именно нам предстоит заполнить трафик в городе.

И вот тут мы сталкиваемся с первым камнем преткновения, а именно с интерфейсом игры. Откровенно говоря он крайне неудобен так как перегружен всяческими иконками, меню и кучами подменю сверх всякой меры. С непривычки у любого неискушенного подобными играми голова закружится.

Теперь поговорим собственно о самом главном — транспорте. Выбор у нас огромный и на любой вкус. Тут есть и автобусный и троллейбусные парки, трамвайные депо и метро. Есть и речной транспорт и даже монорельсовый. Каждый вид транспорта обладает определенными характеристиками и включает как свои достоинства так и недостатки.
Кроме того каждый из вышеперечисленных видов транспорта разделяется еще и на разные модели транспорта. Примерно по десятку на вид. Каждая единица транспорта обладает своими уникальными характеристиками включающими в себя расход топлива, привлекательность для пассажиров, вместимость пассажиров и так далее.

Нам предстоит строить дороги внимательно учитывая мнения и пожелания горожан, которые можно посмотреть просто щелкнув по человечку. Стоит учесть и расписания и загруженность маршрутов.
Строить можно не только дороги и остановки и депо, а так же различные городские достопримечательности словно в каком нибудь градостроительном симуляторе вроде SimCity.


Из минусов отмечу не проработанность погоды, а ведь так было бы здорово если бы скажем зимой транспорт ходил медленнее и вяз в снегу, а пассажиры с большим негативом реагировали на косяки с расписанием автобусов. Холодюга же... Или при ливне транспорт бы чаще ломался и тому подобное.
Так же отмечу крайне запущенную болезнь игры ДЛЦшками. Да, DLC тут очень много и все они очень недешевые, а без них игра выглядит пустой будто 50% контента специально вырезали дабы потом продавать в виде ДЛЦ.


На этом я заканчиваю свой обзор. Для вас как обычно старался Золотой Дракон Гвард. Всем удачи!

author: {'steamid': '76561198868232840', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 2894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1699098180}
review: Хороший симулятор транспортной империи. В игре есть 5 видов транспорта: Метро, монорельс, трамваи, троллейбусы, речные трамваи и , конечно же, автобусы, коих в игре довольно много. Графика приятная, игра в целом выглядит реалистичной. Есть небольшие глюки со светофорами и ценой билетов, но они не критичны и возникают только после создания 50-80 маршрутов. В целом я, как любитель таких игр, могу поставить 5 баллов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087417387', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 761, 'last_played': 1522948955}
