author: {'steamid': '76561198158135189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1527867009}
review:
Nachdem ich Cities in Motion 1 und Transport Fever gespielt habe, habe ich Cities in Motion 2 günstig erstanden.

Zum Glück, denn trotz mehrerer Anläufe schaffe ich es nicht mal, das Tutorial ohne einen mittelschweren Wutausbruch abzuschließen. Die Bedienung ist dermaßen unintuitiv, ständig wundert man sich, auf welche Stelle man wohl jetzt klicken muss, damit die Strecke so gebaut wird, wie man es möchte.

Wenn ihr die Gelegenheit habt, es auch für ein paar Cent zu kaufen - macht ruhig mal, und verzweifelt!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049484878', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1396, 'last_played': 1558750882}
review:
https://forum.paradoxplaza.com/forum/index.php?threads/is-ther-any-plan-to-add-chinese-support-in-ck2%E3%80%81eu4%E3%80%81hoi4-and-stellaris%EF%BC%9F.1077611/

Just today I saw the paradox support rep. refused the request from a Chinese player that supporting official Chinese.

就在今天，我看到了P社客服对一位玩家的官方中文请求表达了拒绝。

They said:

他们说：

"We sell our games to people in many many countries in the world, we can't localise for all of them. Aside from China we've had similar comments (in some cases demands) from Turkey, Japan, Russia, and others I can't think of right now."

“我们游戏卖到了全世界，我们不能为每个国家都推出其语言。除了中国，我们还有来自土耳其，日本，俄罗斯以及其他我现在说不上来的国家的类似的评论（有时是需求）”

"The answer is always that our marketing department constantly evaluates all these markets to see if a localisation makes economic sense; so far it has not for those PDS games, it seems. Cities:Skylines has Chinese, if you're interested in that game."

“我们的回答不变：我们的市场部门一直在评估所有国家的市场，以发掘推出本地化语言包是否可以带来经济效益；对于这些游戏来讲，至今为止似乎并不能。城市：天际线有中文版，如果你喜欢的话可以去玩。”

"The other point is that old games like CK2 and EU4 are never going to be completely re-written at this late stage in their lives."

“另外，像CK2和EU4这样的老游戏不会在他们的晚年被完全重做。”

Firstly I must say that, for stellaris, Chinese players have contributed 100K sells, It's the fifth most purchase in all nations. However, Chinese is still not be included in the newly updated official localizations. So I don't know why they are thinking the 100K cannot afford a readable official Chinese update. Or, let me ask, is the new sellings more important than the money from 100K players they have already gained?

首先必须说的是，中国玩家已经为群星贡献了10万的销量。这个数字排在世界销量的第五。然而，最新发布的官方语言包仍然没有中文。所以我不知道为什么他们会觉得100K销量无法换来一个官方中文版。或者，我想问的是，难道新的销量比已经到手的100K玩家的钱更重要吗？

Okey Okey, let me share some records. FM2016, without Chinese, sold 50k in China; FM2017， with Chinese and a selling number more than 100k. Total War : Warhammer updated a Chinese language very late and gained 60k Chinese buyers, and Total War : Warhammer II with Chinese language is released for half a year, obtained the 50K purchase in Chinese and of course the number is increasing. No I'm not talking about the economics stuff but the attitude of Chinese people: we respect the producers who respect us.

好吧好吧，那让我来提供更多的数据。没有官中的足球经理2016在中国卖了5万，有官中的足球经理2017在中国卖了10万以上。战锤1在后半段才有官中，在中国卖了6万；而有官中的战锤2发售了半年，销量已经超过5万，当然这个数字还在增长。不，别误会，我不是在说经济问题，我是在说中国玩家的态度:我们尊重那些尊重我们的厂商。

I also don't know what is "CSL has Chinese if you are interested in that game" meaning. Dude he purchased for your products and when someday he is asking for a service, you says he can play another game?! I don't think it is respectful words for a customer group. Do you think we are only focusing on Chinese language? Our emphasis is THE RESPECT TO 100K PLAYERS.

顺便我不太明白“城市天际线有中文，你喜欢可以去玩”是什么意思。大哥，人家卖了你们的游戏，然后人家在请求服务时候，你跟人家说你可以玩别的？我不觉得这话尊重一个玩家群体。你觉得我们只关注中文吗？不不不我们关注的是你们是否尊重这10万个买了游戏的人。

There is such words on steamworks: The less a language looks like English, the higher the expected return. Many customers in Asian territories for example do not speak English, while many customers in European countries do. Also, I know while the producers are releasing new games, there would be a notice mentioning that they are going to have a lot dislikes from Chinese player if the games do not have Chinese localization. Thanks a lot for steam.

在steamworks文献库上有这么一段话：最不像英文的语言，投资回报率越高——比方说，许多亚洲的顾客不说英文，而许多欧洲国家的顾客会说英文。同时我也知道在厂商们上线新游戏的时候，会得到一个提示，说如果游戏不支持中文，厂商可能会得到大量中国玩家的差评。非常感谢steam。

Thank you for reading it.
感谢阅读。

author: {'steamid': '76561198190710127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1525248270}
review:
It's a decent passenger transport sim with plenty of transport types and vehicles. And it runs well on older computers - so far I've not noticed any lag on a late 2012 iMac with 512MB GT 640M graphics.

You can build roads, metro, etc., and create transport routes, and, if enabled, the city will grow as a result. However, you can't upgrade roads which is midly annoying (you have to delete old roads first which will feel strange if you've played more modern games like Cities: Skylines or Transport Fever).

There are also some notable issues: Steam Workshop is broken (at least for maps - there are manual workarounds so all is not lost), the in-game purchases (extra vehicles, etc., which aren't available via DLC) don't work on Macs due to Steam Overlay bug, and there's no autosave (that I'm aware of) so if you get a  crash (rare) or just forget to save you lose everything.

Despite the bugs, glitches and quirks, I still find the game enjoyable - certainly much more so than CIM1. While I miss some of the flexibility of more modern games like C:SL, I like the fact that there's a strong focus on providing transport to passengers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046172854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1429711779}

Jedoch ging dafür das gesamte Feeling des Vprgängers verloren. Sowohl bei der Simulation selbst als auch (und vor allem) bei der grafischen Umsetzung, die einfach nur mehr seelenlos herüberkommt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105390979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1524934569}
review:
This game has a lot of potential, a lot of promise - it looks so fun...
It has nice graphics, letting you zoom all the way in to city level and watch individual cars. There are nice overlays that show you where people from different categories live/work/have leisure time/etc., traffic flow, service areas, and so forth. You can even click on individual buildings and get a list of specific residents/employees. I'm sure there's a lot of other neat stuff that I didn't even discover because I spent so little time playing this game, but none of that really matters because, as I now see many previous players have noted:
There is no "undo" button.
This is an issue because it is extremely easy to mis-click (e.g. when mapping bus routes along the roads, the arrows on two-way streets flip back and forth - if your hand moves slightly as you are placing the route point, you may end up inadvertently telling your bus to go the wrong way. Sure, you can put down another route point on top of it - but both points will stay. You cannot delete your misclicked route point, nor can you change its direction (though you can rename it - a neat aesthetic feature, but not useful). Same idea for building things (ex: I tried to build my bus depot right next to a tenement building and it instead built *over* the tenement building, instantly demolishing it without so much as an "Are you sure?" pop-up, let alone an "undo" option).
I feel that the lack of an "undo" button in a game like this is a dealbreaker. It simply must have it, or the game (however fun it would otherwise be) is unplayable. Looking back at previous reviews, it seems that this is an extremely well-documented problem. It appears that the designers have known about this issue for many years, and never deigned to fix it. As such, a future resolution seems improbable. I advise against purchasing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272078724', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 884, 'last_played': 1661097441}
review:
既存の街に鉄道などの公共交通機関を発達させていくゲーム。
開始時にcities:skylinesで見たような立派な街が既に用意されているんですが、致命的なことに公共交通機関が一切無い。
通勤からお出かけまで全部マイカー。そんな街にトロリー、メトロ、バス…などの移動手段を用意していく。船もあるよ。
開発元はcitiesなどの名作を世に放ったcolossal order。それだけでも一見の価値あり！

author: {'steamid': '76561198055167020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1907, 'last_played': 1521182308}
review:
A ideia do jogo é boa, é genial, mas a execução desse jogo é muito ruim. Aí vão os motivos.

1. Bugs constantes. Os veículos simplesmente travam na rua por algum motivo gerando um engarrafamento monstruoso. No começo é algo simples de ver e corrigir, mas quando sua cidade fica enorme, com dezenas de linhas e tipos de transportes, você só vai ver quando o estrago já está enorme e sua nota caiu muito.

2. Menus muito, mas muito, ruins. São menus não amigos do usuário, até você se acostumar vai um tempo, Nas primeiras duas horas de jogo você vai passar metade desse tempo procurando botões ou aprendendo como a mecânica maluca dos menus funciona. É horrível, sabemos que a Paradox pode melhorar isso mas eles não querem.

Juntando tudo isso, o jogo não vale o preço que cobram Há vários jogos antigos na Steam, cheio de bugs e com menus muito ruins, mas por preços justos, metade do preço de Cities in Motion 2.

Vale a experiência se você gosta muito de jogos de administração de transporte e cidades, mas saiba que não chega nem perto de jogos como SimCity ou Cities Skylines.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994544499', 'num_games_owned': 6576, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1490, 'last_played': 1522731570}
review:
Cities in Motion 2 is worse than the original game in almost every respect.  The campaign is shorter, has less interesting missions, and much more boring goals; whereas the first game taught you how to play by successively requiring that you use more and more complex mechanics, the sequel just throws a succession of "reach x%" requirements at you on five nearly-identical maps.

Many things are more complicated, but not in a way that makes them deeper or more interesting.  Setting up lines and placing tracks in particular are far more irritating.  You can adjust timetables, but there's nothing interesting to doing so.

Stick with the first game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961318107', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1521009950}

author: {'steamid': '76561198814862889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1519345639}
review:
I said I would not recommend it. But that isn't 100% true. Here's why:

This is a terribly mundane game. Not bad. Boring. You build routes, control schedules, set prices, make sure the white collar workers first and foremost have transportation, etc. Whether or not you will like this game all depends on what does it for you. Do you have a fetish for monorails and buses? Are you entertained by woodwork shows? Then this game is great for you. You can stop reading now. Enjoy. 
For those of you who are all disappointed because you thought this game would be the s***, DON'T FRET. I HAVE GREAT NEWS! Cities skylines (by the same developer) has WAYYY more things to do. And you can even build monorails and bus routes. Actually, you'll probably want to when you have a higher density city and crowded roads. So the only difference really is that you just have 1000xs more things to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998208049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 7707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6074, 'last_played': 1678392387}
review:
Working in the transit industry myself, cities in motion provides probably the most realistic gameplay options for transit simulators.   Mind you I usually use mods to tweak the realism and add a more realistic amount of traffic.  But...  10/10 for the game itself.

It has preformed for me over 115 hours, fairly flawlessly, on a variety of computers including a few laptops.

Haven't been able to try multiplayer yet, but would love to, if anyone is willing?

author: {'steamid': '76561198081959127', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1394910329}
review:
Co za szajs!

Gra opierająca się na budowaniu tronsportu publicznego, który nawet przy dobrym zaplanowaniu działa gorzej niż PKP wydawała się spoko. Przestała się wydawać po włączeniu. Muzyka jak z kibla w centrum handlowym, gameplay potwornie nudny. Miasta w ktrych budujemy nie mają praktycznie żadnych animacji i o tym że wogóle coś się dzieje informują nas statystyki. Gry bez animacji to może byle gimbus na informatyce wyprodukować. Naprawdę ktoś uwierzy, że w ponad milionowym mieście jedynym pojazdem na ulicy jest autobus. Co to jest Czarnobyl, że nikt tam nie mieszka. Projektowanie komunikacji publicznej to jeden z podstawowych elementów w grach typu city builder jak na przykład Cities: Skylines. Tutaj na budowaniu komunikacji jest oparta cała gra. To tak jakby ktoś zrobił grę polegającą na rozbrajaniu bomby w CS'ie. W to się nie da grać. Pomijam fakt, że nawet jak coś zrobisz to gra i tak stwierdzi, że jest źle i wszyscy są niezadowoleni i kit z tym że nawet nie istnieją w innej formie niż cyferki w statystykach. Do tej gry nie powinna być wymagana karta graficzna, bo do oglądania modelu miasta w 3D i kilku pojazdów wystarczył by komputer zbudowany z drewna. Dodatkowo w grze są dostępne skiny do pojazdów. To już splunięcie na portfele nieszczęśników którzy tą grę kupili, bo nie wiem w jakiej rzeczywistości, ktoś chciałby w to grać na tyle długo, żeby kupić skina do tramwaju.

Osobiście współczuję każdemy kto zmarnował na to kieszonkowe i musiał w to zagrać mam nadzieję, że jakoś naprawisz szkodę jaką wyrządziła ona na twej psyhice i dysku twardym!

Nie polecam! Nudne jak stanie w kolejce po Hot-Doga w Żabce!

What a shit!

A game based on building public transport, which, even with good planning, works worse than PKP seemed cool. It stopped appearing after switching on. Music like a toilet in a shopping center, gameplay terribly boring. Cities in which we build have virtually no animation and that something is happening at all, statistics inform us. Games without animation can be produced by any gimbus on information technology. Really someone will believe that in a city of over a million, the only vehicle on the street is a bus. What is Chernobyl that no one lives there. Designing public transport is one of the basic elements in city builder games such as Cities: Skylines. Here, the whole game is based on building communication. It's as if someone did a game involving disarming a bomb in CS. You can not play it. I omit the fact that even if you do something, the game will state that it is wrong and everyone is dissatisfied and putty with the fact that they do not even exist in a different form than the numbers in the statistics. A graphics card should not be required for this game, because it would be enough for a computer made of wood to view the city model in 3D and a few vehicles. In addition, skins for vehicles are available in the game. This is a spit on the wallets of unfortunates who bought this game, because I do not know in what reality, someone would like to play it long enough to buy a skina for the tram.

Personally, I feel sorry for everyone who has wasted this pocket money and had to play it, I hope that you will somehow repair the damage it has caused to your psyhica and hard drive!

I do not recommend! Boring as it stands in line for Hot-Dog in Żabka!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002606662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1518429044}
review:
This is supremely disappionting. I will share my short experience with this turd. So on my very first mission I try to build metro tracks which is a nightmare because the roads block you from seeing the tracks making it really difficult to place stuff correctly. Eventually I manage to get the tracks down where I want and then I run into my next problem. Trains cannot use switches and require a loop to function. What the hell kind of metro train turns around with a giant loop of track? By this point my frustration with this game was getting close to breaking point but the final straw was when I said fine whatever I will just loop it back to the depot. I couldn't, the track was too long for the game to handle. You can't even make track from one end of the city to the other in this game.

Seriously I can't even imagine how they thought this was worthy of being released. It's mind boggling that there exists a game about building public transit which doesn't allow you to build public transit. What do you even call something that doesn't allow you to do something which is the entire point of its existence? It's nothing, a void. A void of diarrhea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036310712', 'num_games_owned': 935, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1518127220}
review:
Graphics/performance is great, I've played this on a i3 with a intel HD2000 and it runs smooth(ofcourse with lower settings)
The music is alright, in line with it's (kind of) sequel Cities: Skylines. 
Gameplay is another thing: building metrolines is horrendous, even harder than in CiM 1. even when you think the line is connected properly, the game will say that stops aren't connected when trying to build a line. 
Having depots for your vehicles is alright, but having to have the line connect with it, is weird, vehicles only return to the depot at the end of the day, not everytime they finish their route.
Everytime I start up the game, I get the store opened up with the sale going on: this store is not working...
Everytime I start up the game and start a scenario/sandbox, it'll show the tutorial. You have to tick off "start tutorial when starting a new game" each time you start the game.
That put me off and abandoned it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105602480', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1517969423}

author: {'steamid': '76561198101868918', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1546, 'last_played': 1671368370}
review:
จากที่ลองเล่นภาคแรก และลองเล่นภาคนี้ สื่งที่ต่างจากภาคแรกคือ กราฟฟิกที่สวยขึ้น การจัดการเรื่องอู่รถ และการบริหารรอบของสายว่า จะปล่อยรถห่างกันเท่าไร ซึ่งทำให้มีความสมจริงในการบริหารสายรถมากขึ้น (แถมหัวร้อนกว่าเดิม) รวมถึงสามารถจัดการถนนได้อีกด้วย
ที่ชอบคือเรื่องการจัดโซนให้ได้กำไรง่ายๆ 

แต่ที่ขัดใจมากจริงๆ คือเรื่องของการสร้างรางรถไฟขนส่งมวลชนที่ยุ่งยากกว่าภาคที่แล้วมาก (ถึงแม้มีอิสระในการสร้างเยอะก็ตาม) รวมถึงระบบ AI สำหรับผู้โดยสารที่ยังงงกับวิธีคิดของมันยิ่งกว่าภาคที่แล้วเยอะ 

ถ้าใครอยากจะลองเล่นภาคนี้ ขอไปดู Review แล้วชั่งใจเอาเถิด ส่วนคนที่มาเล่นซีรีย์นี้ แนะนำเล่นภาคแรกก่อน ค่อยเล่นภาคนี้ก็ไม่ว่ากัน

สำหรับผม 6.5/10 ครับ

author: {'steamid': '76561198049873045', 'num_games_owned': 1623, 'num_reviews': 258, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1517664736}
review:
Больше похоже на какую-то демоверсию. Возможно, многое исправляется в dlc, но учитывая их цену и колво - это грустно очень (говорю как обладатель СК2 и кучи дополнений к нему, я стиль Парадоксов знаю давно, но с СК2 всё иначе).

Так вот. В игре нет никакого развития. Повлиять как-то на город довольно проблематично. Ну т.е да, город как бы должен расти, но даже если включить читерный безлимит на деньги и застроить весь город транспортными линиями, у меня вышло только увеличить число жителей, и то не сильно значительно, в дальнейшее развитие города это не вылилось.
Ничего нельзя апгрейдить. Не хватает транспорта на линию? - строй ещё одно депо, расширить первое мы тебе не дадим. Не из чего выбирать? - соси лапу. Речь пр базовую игру, будет очень жаль, если в дополнениях сделали возможность улучшать транспорт, депо, дороги. Омг, даже дороги нельзя апгрейдить, только удалять старую или/и строить новую, это просто смех. В игре практически ничего нет, а что есть, сразу же доступно, нет ощущения роста и радости достижений.

Кроме ощущения абсолютной бесполезности многочасового геймплея, в целом очень приятная игра - симпатичная, удобная, есть мастеркая, музыка только унылая и мало треков. Добавили через несколько лет нормальный градостроительный сим, и вышла достойная Cities Skylines (у которой, кстати, всё равно осталась небольшая проблемка с "эндгеймом" - все возможности игры узнаёшь относительно быстро, и достигнув определённого уровня, дальше в игре делать нечего).

Резюмируя ощущения и впечатления от игры: выиграл на steamgifts, и всё равно жаба душит.

review: Cities in Motion 2 is a step forward. We have bigger, more complex cities, there are great new timetable and ticket selling systems, and we get an opportunity to build roads and modify the city's infrastructure. Sequel is better in terms of running a public transport company and even though there are some things that didn't work out and you encounter some technical issues, you can clearly see that the developers have done their best. Good job.

author: {'steamid': '76561198233343036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 12419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9691, 'last_played': 1576096274}
review:
Game Cities in Motion 2 is game that was promising back in 2013 but overpriced DLC and quality of bad changes ruined the experience turning this strategy game into grinding the time doesnt go too fast even in quickest speed and vechicles namely buses moves way too slow 
making order is pretty pointless as when your gets out of depot at morning it can came back at night also pretty unstable economy labeled as tickets are too expensive or too cheap from hours to hours makes micromanagement even more annoying also i noticed there. Quests range from being too easy or too difficult in terms of reward and Realistic Cities has been turned into uninspired blocks of habitable place not to mention main quests that focus on cover certain % by network on city are pretty unstable too sometimes it suddenly drops alot due to annoying grow of city further adding the Grinding scheme of this Failed experiment

As i would say Cim2 was beautiful back in 2013 but it didnt aged well due to its user unfriendly mechanics making experience Grindy and taking forever than it needs to be.

For fans of Cities (Franchise) play either first 2011 release of Cim1 or Cities Skylines

review: Я люблю игры, где нужно строить и планировать, и очень люблю заниматься построением транспортных линий. Когда увидел эту игру загорелся, что это эссенция того, что мне нравится, но нет. Возможно, авторы и изучили старый опыт, продумали какие-то логические, реалистичные правила мира, но это не удаётся прочувствовать, играть не хочется из-за того, как подаются задачи и реазультаты. Интерфейс не особо дружелюбный.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007329310', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1596004863}
review:
游戏从可玩性到流畅度都不错，这个几百兆的体积我觉得应该算是精品游戏。
有几个小问题，一方面是线路的设置不够合理，所有的线路都得是个闭环，没有从生活实际出发。
另一方面是游戏模式比较纯粹，或者说是过于单一，一条路走到黑，在游戏模式上缺少创新。最后就是没有中文支持，虽然理解文本提示不是多困难，但是原生的语言给玩家在游戏过程中带来的感觉是不同的。
>>>   请关注中文地区市场，关注中文地区玩家。   <<<

review: 画面が暗い。はじめからある都市の交通を改善するのがcities slylinesとは別でおもしろい。高速道路だけに集中して一般道が閑散とするのを改善してほしい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198003239995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1567788720}
review:
This is a cheap game, also its has a -iirc- small size and its learning curve is relatively less sharper then games in similar type. First of all I am against to "pay for everything" principle and I didnt purchased any of the DLC's. Without DLC's (dunno the situation with DLC's tbh) the game is pretty much incomplete. you have limited options and it gets boring after some time - in my games its like 5-6 hours. You can't really improve stuff and game offers not much change in later periods, other then financial challenge. 

Also I need to say it as optimization issues and sometimes it gets ridiculously slower when the time passes. 

You can play it if you think its price is low enough, for a cookie. Like when travelling for a couple of hours in a train or waiting in a lobby, when you dont have much time and dont want to give attention for a full scale game. 

I cant say its awful, but its nothing you can invest some hours, in my humble opinion. 

I adore city games, this game stands in a place far away from being a city management game or a public transport simulation. I really wished the it, but nah. When buying, consider you are paying it for a couple of hours experience, rest will be repeat of what you experienced in first game hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104995187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 23146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21842, 'last_played': 1605861640}
review: They fixed the workshop and it's still a fun game to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989000257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1512745084}
review:
[h1]Somehow, the things you get off workshop doesn't load nor appear anywhere in the game. Even in sandbox mode, the maps just won't appear.[/h1]

Tried playing this for an hour and the following is what I've experienced:

- 4 maps available in-game (sandbox)
+ very much like Cities in Motion 1 in terms of setting routes, stops, etc.
+ able to set frequency and schedules (micromanagement)
- limitation of 10 vehicles per route if you decide to have a depot per line (buses)
+ you can bulldoze buildings, create roads
- maps you get from workshop does not load/appear in the map selection in sandbox mode
+ you can create your own map, same as Cities in Motion 1

I had to ask for a refund due to the workshop maps not being made available in-game. Kind of sad as I was really looking forward in playing this game with community created maps, the initial deciding factor for me to purchase the game and its DLCs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198236839744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1626953701}
review: W porównaniu do jedynki jest sporo ulepszeń i rzeczy których tam brakowało, chociażby punkty kierunkowe które możemy umieszczać jeśli chcemy by między przystankami nasz środek transportu jechał inną trasą, wprowadzono rozklady jazdy więc można wysłać odpowiednią ilość pojazdów w zależności od zapotrzebowania, jest też dzień i noc oraz inny ruch w weekend niż w dzień powszedni, możliwość dobudowania własnych dróg tam gdzie ich potrzebujemy a obok tej drogi po czasie wybudują się domy i wprowadzą nowi mieszkańcy. Jedynym minusem jest bardzo denerwujący system stawiania torów i stacji metra, nasiedziałem się nad tym dobre pół godziny kombinując ale ani torów ani stacji nie mogłem nigdzie umieścić a jak mi się już udało to jednego z drugim nie mogłem połączyć.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064856425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2680, 'last_played': 1513262958}
review:
也不知道是谁规定的，p社游戏里的公交车必须走环线，好像只要不走环线p社办公室会立刻爆炸一样。
地铁必须入库折返或者灯泡线，就算你建环线也必须清客入库一次，不知道是不是他们公司那里地铁只有灯泡线，就没见过折返线。
目前我发现的唯一建折返线的方式就是建车库然后拆掉，我也不知道这是啥原理。
地铁车站只有侧式站台，没有岛式的，也没有换乘站，还不像天际线一样有mod可以拯救一下，也是不得好了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198041679472', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1943, 'last_played': 1676674662}
review: Gameplay is nice but... MP is buggy as fok. After 2h MP with my friend after some kind of a lag spike we where playing od 2 DIFFERENT SAVES!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198309799456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2167, 'last_played': 1592115895}
review:
Ich bin erbost. Aufgrund von mehreren aufeinanderfolegenden Abstürzen mußte ich heute meinen Windows-10-Rechner auf Werkseinstellungen zurücksetzen. Und anschließend wieder komplett neu aufbauen. Und jetzt will Cities in Motion einfach nicht laufen. 

Sollte sich an der ganzen Sache nicht schleunigst was ändern. Dann erstatte ich Strafanzeige.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017912186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1373897868}
review:
Cites in Motion (1) ilk oyun bu kadar mükemmel iken 2.oyunda oyun nasıl rezil ederiz diye uğraşmışlar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116137604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 6092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5794, 'last_played': 1509799175}
review: I absolutely loved this game. For years I have played Transport Tycoon and Sim City. This game certainly allowed me to enjoy a more modern take on this type of game experience. The tutorial is fantastic in aiding you begin. I preferred sandbox mode to the campagine mode. I no longer play this as Paradox released Cities Skylines with Mass Transit addon. However, I could see myself playing this again in the future. It is easy to build routes and even change a cities layout. It is hard to make profit depending on what settings you set at the beginning. The graphics are amazing! I love how you can zoom in and follow your vehicles along the routes you produce. The only negative aspect of this game I found was when building underground networks, there is no heights shown which would have been really useful. I highly recommend the addon "Cities in Motion Price Updater" as it is a considerable help with this game. A very challenging game but in a really enjoyable way. Highly recommended. You would spend many hours playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017213355', 'num_games_owned': 525, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 14251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12884, 'last_played': 1609680237}
review: Yes this game has some bugs (sometimes it randomless crashes and it has no autosave, however use to quicksave instead or save manually), but I love this game. If you really  like to create your own public transport lines, build your own roads, micromanage all your lines, this game is for you. Personally I prefer this game over Cities XL and even Cities Skylines because it has a much stronger focus on transport while the latter two more focus on the city building. It's not so expensive anymore and even less if you get it in a sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029031078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3051, 'last_played': 1703814071}
review:
It pains me to write a negative review, because I really wanted to like this game. It has so much theoretical promise - free laid tracks and roads, development responds to your actions (eg, put a new road in, buildings appear), quite nice graphics. 

But this is all so weighed down by the downsides. The cities are fake (not based on any reality) and basic. The vehicles available are extremely limited (3 types of bus, 2 types of metro train), and that's it. There's no research, no upgrades available over time, nothing. What you have at the beginning is what you have at the end, hours in after your computer's crashing.

The depots are extroadinarily limited, eg the largest metro depot can only hold 12 trains (so serving a single reasonable length line). A bus depot can handle no more than 20 buses, so if you want to make a long route with frequency over 1 bus per 2 hours - you can't.

Time crawls by, even on fastest mode; making a profitable service is meaningless, because the only way you're building anything new is taking out loans anyway, unless you leave your system on overnight and treat it as turn-based.

Being able to build on multiple layers is nice (you can have bridges over bridges, tunnels under tunnels), but the controls are nuts, and make it infuriating (and very expensive) to try to connect to things. Start with guesswork to try to locate the level the existing track is at, and see if and when your mouse is on the right pixel to connect it. 

I'd love to recommend that someone make a game like this one, but much much better. I cannot recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994365694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1560897492}
review:
All right people posting reviews for this game. Go to the blackboard and write 100 times [h1]"this is not a city building game"[/h1]

This is a [h1]transport business simulation[/h1] game. In other words this game is [u]NOT a SimCity[/u] clone. It's a [u]Transport Tycoon[/u] style of game.

Having said that I think it's a pretty decent game. I didn't play much of Cities in Motion 1 so I can't compare with that one but compared to [url=www.openttd.org]openTTD[/url] (that's a free game. check it out) it is very similar with some key differences. For instance openTTD focuses more on the transport of goods for the industry besides passangers while CiM 2 puts emphasis in the public transport systems.

There are tons of city/transport simulators out there that look very similar but, at least most of the ones I've played, are in fact very different from each other. So if you're fan of the Transport Tycoon style of games specifically you should try this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321435503', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1781, 'last_played': 1589378949}
review:
I played a ton of CiM (on another steam account) and was truly addicted so I bought the sequel when it was on sale so I could play it on my laptop on this account.

The game is awesome, however the first one is far supperior, and there are some problems.

Cool things about this game:
- Basic gameplay
- Multiplayer
- You can now build roads allowing the city to grow

Bad things about this game:
- Lot's of bugs, most notable in rendering (doesn't effect gameplay all that much)
- Cities not based on real locations, and little imagination was put into them (they don't even have proper names)

author: {'steamid': '76561197987727256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 32171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24143, 'last_played': 1675830607}
review: This is the spiritual predeseccessor to Cities Skylines.  The devs only transitioned to the Unity game engine to make this and as such theres some things wrong with the game.  Colors are dull and stale, the game has a 4Gb 32bit limitation which mean bigs map and big networks will randomly crash your computer.  The game idea itself is fantastic and unique, and offers a lot of potential for a unique franchise of managing a public transport network, timetabling and network management that holds a special place for those Tycoon freaks and those fascinated with public transport.   The game could be so much better improved and a sequel is long yearned for to iron out and flesh out more design choices in the game.  The game due to design choices makes it boring after a while because of limitations with the pathfinding, modding ability and support from the devs to rectify game design choices.   A lot of fun for a Tycoon and Public Transport enthusiast, and thumbs up for being the Traffic Giant 2.0 rewrite, but the devs could of been more sympathetic to their loyal fan base by attending to their requests and not abandoning this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016546516', 'num_games_owned': 2355, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1436818094}
review: Aunque me encantó la primera parte de Cities in Motion (incluido el "final" del modo historia), el juego que nos ocupa perdió por el camino la oportunidad de mejorar más el idioma español, impidiendo que lo llegara a disfrutar. De ahí salté a su siguiente juego, el Cities: Skylines, más redondo, maduro y que volvió a incluir el castellano entre sus idiomas. En definitiva, una secuela por desgracia casi olvidable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018191809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1516500146}
review: Annoyingly stupid. A metro station doesn't work. AFter 2 hours of playing, I still haven't gotten  my first metro station train to move. I've built tracks (in a circle, since that makes sense), two ways, with loops, with stops, and still haven't gotten 1 train to move. The tutorial is lacking, severely, the game mechanics aren't worth crap, and this makes me actually appreciate snowfall on trains here in Boston since this game is clearly worse than live train systems. Even on a bad day, the worse trains still move in real live. This is quickly becoming annoying and boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982235384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1535233593}
review:
This game had a lot of potential. I was hoping it would address some of the fundamental problems with Cities in Motion 1. While I played the first edition a fair bit, I have only put a few hours into the Motion 2 since they still have not fixed a lot of the problems around laying tracks and dealing with streets etc.

Overall the entire experience is very clunky and goes from being an enjoyable experience to terrible depending on how well the game can guess at what you are doing and how best to approach it.

On the positive side both games work well under Arch Linux and for that they get a big thumbs up. Too bad the execution of the ideals behind the game are so infuriating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062926678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1508884742}
review:
Cities in Motion 2 это большой шаг назад по отношению к предыдущей части игры. Да - что-то изменилось, где-то стало якобы больше возможностей. Но играть в это достаточно сложно, банально из-за действительно корявого интерфейса (в большей степени касающегося игровой механики). Он либо неинтуитивный, либо нефункциональный. По этой же причине удовольствия игра не приносит никакого.

В общем и целом проект получился провальный, возможно так и должно было быть. Просто по тому, что это эксплуатация предыдущей части симулятора. Созданная ради прибыли (разумеется по ощущениям).

В семье не без урода, как говорится. Вот и у студии Colossal Order напару с её издателем Paradox Interactive есть свой, так сказать, "шедевр". К великому счастью, следующий проект студии - Cities Skylines получился на 100 голов выше этого неиграбельного кошмара.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012814034', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1491934129}
review:
Sous ses faux airs de city builder, le jeu de gestion de transports en commun Cities in Motion avait su surprendre lors de sa sortie en 2011, mais ce n'est pas le cas du second opus. 

- 1 : Un point de pénible : Oui il faut le dire que centrer recentrer ou bien cadrer recadrer la caméra est certainement la chose que vous feriez le plus souvent dans le jeu, reste à en dire que 10% de votre temps sera consacré à apprendre à la maitrisé.

- 1 : Tutoriel raté manquement au principe simple : C'est simple mais même moi j'ai eu un grand mal à comprendre les objectif du tuto pourtant au final 35000 détours pour une chose assez simple. Sur le 1er tome il était direct et claire mais sa sa à disparu.

- 1 : Ho ma ville que je t'aime : Mais.... ELLE N'EXISTE PAS ET LA SA ME MET EN ROGNE DANS CITIES IN MOTION 2 LES VILLE SONT FICTIVE .... QUEL TRAVAILLE BACLER !!!!

-1  +1 : Des bugs ... oui mais vu la qualités du décors c'est un peu pardonnable bien que .... 

+1 on peut géré les horraire c'est cool sa bien qu'il faudris y amélioré le tuto....

Mais au final je ne recommande pas ce jeu il est trop bof.... de mon avis. Si vous possedez le 1er .... NE PRENEZ PAS LE SECOND PERTE D'ARGENT GARENTIE ET NON REMBOUSER !!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041435883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 6682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6759, 'last_played': 1661092317}
review: Kann dieses Spiel nur empfehlen für alle die sich in Planung und Aufbau von Öffis beweisen möchten

author: {'steamid': '76561198242899832', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2637, 'last_played': 1663620844}
review:
Neanche lontanamente all'altezza del primo capitolo.

Il gioco in sè non è male, ma anche per me che sono un fan del genere transport tycoon risulta dopo poco monotono e ripetitivo. La cosa che più delude però è quanto sia infinitamente meno profondo rispetto al primo capitolo, rispetto al quala l'unica miglioria è la grafica, che peraltro non risolve la pecca, a me personalmente molto fastidiosa, delle ruote di autobus e filobus che sono "finte", incastonate in un unico monolite 3d fisso. Inoltre per qualche assurdo motivo alcuni veicoli appaiono più dettagliati e realistici di altri.

Se vi piace il genere, comprate il primo Cities in Motion!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973940197', 'num_games_owned': 511, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 47355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44152, 'last_played': 1689077499}
review:
本作の最大の魅力は、住民１人１人の移動のシミュレートである。

これまでも、バスや鉄道路線を都市に引くことのできるゲームは
多く存在していた。

しかし、住民のシミュレーションが粗いため、
現実離れした結果を引き起こしてしまっていた。

例えば、鉄道と地下鉄の駅を隣接させて「乗換駅」のようにしたとしても、
駅の利用客は増えるどころか、鉄道と地下鉄で「食い合って」利用者が減少したり、
（これは、乗り換えのシミュレーションが全く行われないため生ずる）
特急用の線路を設けて速達路線を作っても、なぜか遅い方の路線に利用者が
集中したりといった具合だ。

本シリーズや、姉妹作品であるCities:Skylinesでは
より細かいシミュレーションを実現し、上記のような感覚から逸脱した
人の移動が「少なく」なっている。

都市交通をゲームの楽しみと考える人々にとっては
チェックするべきシリーズと言えるだろう。

author: {'steamid': '76561198067211020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3279, 'last_played': 1515940223}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065508767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1531456193}
review: Actually take the advice of reviews, unlike me, and don't buy this game. Half the game mechanics don't work and the cities feel sterile and artificial, because they are. CiM 1 or Cities: Skylines, both of which are by the same dev, are significantly better and more stable. In this game, you can't build a proper line half the time and structure placement is at best wonky. The tutorial is a joke; I couldn't even finish it because the game didn't detect that I completed the requirements. Another thing is that every single line has to route back to a depot, so you have vehicles returning at 99% condition to get serviced. These are just a few of the problems I encountered in my short playtime; save yourself the trouble and don't get this game, even if it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017712741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1503434697}
review: Na první pohled vypadá hra celkem dobře. Během tutoriálu mě trochu zarazilo to, že jsem nebyl takřka schopný postavit jednu blbou stanici metra... Ale po hodině boje jsem to nějak udělal - ani nevím jak. Pak jsem si pustil kampaň a první mapa. Když jsem stavěl autobusový zastávky, tak v pohodě. Pak jsem se začal hodinu patlat s kolejema pro tramvaj, aby hezky vedly od bytů dělníků až do jejich továrny, rozmístil jsem zastávky a začal tvořit novou linku. Po tom, co jsem spojil asi pět prvních zastávek, mi to napsalo u šesté, že se na ní nelze z té páté dostat? Asi jsem dělal něco blbě, ale nevím co a ta hra mi s tím taky nepomohla... Trpělivost došla a odinstaloval jsem to... Čekal jsem od toho o dost víc...

author: {'steamid': '76561198171839067', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 39859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16404, 'last_played': 1677434075}
review:
Anmerkung: Cities in Motion 2 hat ein sehr spezifisches Thema und somit auch eine eher kleine Zielgruppe. Dieses Spiel würde ich deshalb nur Genrefans empfehlen.

Cities in Motion 2 besticht zum einen durch eine sehr gute Grafik und zum anderen mit einem guten Spielprinzip. Dadurch wird es nicht langweilig und man kann immer wieder aufs neue Spaß mit dem Spiel haben. Wenn man eine Weile im Game verbracht hat, wird man aber merken, das sich dieser Glanz nicht durch das gesamte Spiel zieht. Viele Funktionen sind nicht sonderlich gut durchdacht, der Linienbau wird beispielsweise mit der Zeit sehr nervig. Das liegt daran, dass man dabei je nach Verkehrsmittel die Strecke mitsamt jeder einzelnen Haltestelle bis zu drei mal am Stück abgehen muss. Zuerst mit dem Gleis oder der Oberleitung. Dieser Schritt entfällt glücklicherweise bei Bus und Schiff. Danach ist das Vorgehen aber einheitlich: Die Haltestellen müssen in der zweiten Runde zunächst gebaut werden und in der finalen Runde dann zu einer Linie verbunden werden. Das hätte man deutlich einfacher lösen können. Auch die Kampagne ist ziemlich lieblos gestaltet: Als Ziel muss man eigentlich immer nur eine vorgegebene Netzabdeckung, einen Geldwert oder ähnliches erreichen. Glücklicherweise macht da der freie Modus deutlich mehr Spaß. Der hat seinen Namen wirklich verdient, und man wird nicht durch die Kampagne plötzlich zusammenhangslos aus einer halbfertigen Stadt durch erreichen eines der oben genannten Ziele aus der Stadt geworfen. Zum Schluss noch ein paar kleine Dinge: Mod-Support wird leider nicht ünterstützt, dafür gibt es aber Maps und Szenarios im Workshop.

Trotz der vielen Kritikpunkte hatte ich aber viel Spaß mit dem Spiel.

Pro:
+gutes Spielprinzip
+schicke Grafik
+viele Workshop-Maps
+Langzeitmotivation

Contra:
-vieles undurchdacht
-extrem lieblose Kampagne
-kein Mod-Support

review: This is a good game. It gives you all the tools you need to make amazingly detailed routes, timetables and fares. Having said that if you've never played a management game before this isn't a good place to start. There's a lot to understand.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280619572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3765, 'last_played': 1498186042}
review:
First of all, the design of all the vehicles and passenger behaviors is great. Nobody, or nothing, is behaving weirdly in this game. The control is not that hard once you get used to it, though the tutorial is kinda helpful but not enjoyable.

BUT, the graphics of this game look a bit depressing. I have to change a lot of settings so it doesn't look like some 90s educational simulation game. It is still not the reason I don't recommend this game though.

The main reason for me to give a thumb-down is that, for a game on transportation, there are WAY too many repetitive street names on any map, being original or custom ones. They don't even allow me to name sections of a city. It just really kills the fun because I don't sense that uniqueness in my city without naming it. After naming a bus stop 'florence street', I would discover another florence street not a few blocks away. How demotivating is that? What is point of naming your stops and your lines anyway then?

author: {'steamid': '76561198057724501', 'num_games_owned': 389, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1499765294}
review:
Gra nie jest zła, pod warunkiem, że nie grasz w nic innego, tylko w gry ekonomiczne. Myślałem, że mi się spodoba, i być mże grałbym dłużej, gdyby nie kilka mankamentów:
-Gra jest przynudnawa - niby są jakieś misje, ale tak naprawdę nie czeka cię nic innego, jak tylko budowa, tudzież restrukturyzacja lini autobusowych/tramwajowych/trolejbusowych/metro lub promy. No dobra, możesz też budować drogi, i pomagać w ten sposób miastu się rozrosnąć. Ale to dość drogi interes.
- Wspomniałem o misjach - są. Jakieś. O ile te wymagające kupna pojazdów da się zrobić od ręki, o tyle te z doprowadzeniem lini są niedopracowane. Dlaczego? Musiałem doprowadzić linię do jednego budynku. Ok, miałem tam przystanek (tuż przy celu misji), linia była doprowadzona, więc zaakceptowałem. Postęp 0%. Czemu? Bo przystanek był po złej stronie budynku, który był otoczony ulicą z trzech stron. Albo stawiasz wiaty tam gdzie każe gra, albo ci tego nie zalicza. koniec - tak przebiega większość misji - nieważne że przystanek masz po drugiej stronie ulicy, czy obok. Czy zasięg wiaty pokrywa cel - ma być w konkretnym miejscu (gra pokazuje tylko budynek).
- Ilość pojazdów. Tylko trzy na każdy rodzaj. 3 rodzaje autobusów, 3 rodzaje tramwajów itd. Po grze w której maczał palce Paradox, spodziewałem się czegoś więcej.
- Częste wachania cen biletów. Masz za drogie bilety. Ok. zmiejszasz cenę. parę minut później - "Cena niektórych biletów jest za niska" i okazuje się, że te bilety, których ceny przed chwilą tak mocno obniżałeś, teraz są zbyt tanie! Po obniżeniu cen, po paru minutach są za drogie. Dość irytujące.

Tl;DR
Jeżeli prawdziwie kochasz gry ekonomiczne i nie możesz bez nich żyć, może uda ci się dobrze bawić przy tej grze. Dla mnie była jednak zbyt nudna i irytująca, a jak na grę przy której pracował Paradox Interactive - wydaje się być niedopracowana.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110437647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1256, 'last_played': 1591458403}

author: {'steamid': '76561198114602905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 4893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4762, 'last_played': 1490968977}
review:
City in Motion 2 вторая часть игры City in Motion. Продолжением вряд ли могу назвать, игры самостоятельные ни чем не связаны, кроме общей механики. 
В связи с этим буду сравнивать CIM2 c первой частью. 
Это все тот же приятный экономический симулятор менеджмента общественного транспорта. Улучшилась графика, наступает темная ночь с освещением улиц. Появились троллейбусы. Улучшилась возможность строительства дорог, трамвайных путей и путей метрополитена. Стало больше уровней для метро и дорог. Появилась гибкая настройка расписания движения транспорта. Но несмотря на улучшения в игре сама игра мне понравилась меньше об этом ниже. 
Наша задача обеспечить общественным транспортом небольшой мегаполис. Берем кредиты строим депо маршруты общественного транспорта, закупаем транспорт и возим пассажиров зарабатываем деньги на новые маршруты. Я брал кредит и строил одну две линии метро в начале, после чего выполнял сюжетные задания. Метро лучше всего себя окупает в игре, хотя на деле только Лондонский метрополитен самоокупаем. 

Что не понравилось.
В первой части мы занимались тем же самым только в реальных городах Вена, Берлин, Амстердам, Хельсинки (Конечно это не полная натуральная модель, но города узнаваемы) здесь же имеем 5 городов отличающихся только своим расположением. Города безлики нет вокзалов, аэропортов, достопримечательностей. Типовая застройка "3-тья улица строителей". Серые кварталы отличаются только своим назначением жилой, рабочий, деловой, пригород. Со временем и в DLC открываются известные мировые достопримечательности которые вы можете построить, но особой красоты городам это не придает. Города однотипны неинтересны. Если в первой части вокзал посреди города создавал дополнительные трудности в организации движения то здесь этого нет. Для усложнения сделана куча дорог с односторонним движением там где надо и не надо. 3 - 5 полос в одну сторону это нормально. 
В метро нет станций пересадок. Депо вмещает в себя ограниченное число транспорта. И разнообразие самого транспорта уменьшилось. Что то можно приобрести в DLC, но как то мало. 
В игре темнота ночью начинает мешать при строительстве трамвайных путей или путей метро или троллейбусных линий. Просто плохо видно где ты уже построил что-то а где нет. 
Компания стала унылой. Разнообразие заданий и в первой части было не большим, а здесь еще упростилось. Все сводиться к строительству новой линии между несколькими точками. И к расширению вашей транспортной компании. 
Отдельно про цены на билеты. Они постоянно меняются, точнее вы должны их постоянно корректировать что бы они были не слишком высокими и низкими для населения. А меняться цены могут по несколько раз в день. Только ты увеличил цену на проезд уже надо уменьшать. или еще добавлять и поскольку нет кнопки Adopt для того что бы автоматом подстроить оптимальную цену вам надо постоянно следить за этим и то увеличивать то уменьшать. Через несколько часов это начинает напрягать, а к середине компании вымораживает. При этом та же фигня в режиме песочницы где вы можете играть без ограничения в средствах. 

В итоге цена на игру без скидки со всеми DLС завышена со скидкой можно взять ради песочницы. На мой взгляд первая часть с реальными городами лучше теплее и интересней. В DLC для первой части CIM вы даже можете найти другие мировые города и наконец-то разобраться  с пробками и работой общественного транспорта в них. :-)
7 серых домов из 10. 
Минусовать не буду игра все же не плохая.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082987512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4358, 'last_played': 1637090766}
review: I would not recommend this game. Why? because it is very hard to learn. It teaches you how to make a bus line BUT not how to make money off of it. It's more like taking a college course than a game. I've had this game for about a year now. AND I finally was able to get into this long enough to notice you ain’t ever going to make money with the vehicles in the base game. If you don't buy the DLCs you are guarantee to go under. Not saying it is a bad game just not made for younger people or anybody that doesn’t have patience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198234048108', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 67629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18555, 'last_played': 1708251485}
review:
초반에는 어떻게 해야 할지 모르겠고 막막하지만, 이걸 극복하면 상당히 재밌다. 시티즈 스카이라인처럼 하나하나 만져줘야 하는 것이 아닌, 길만 깔면 건물이 자동으로 들어서기 때문에, 도시도 복잡하지 않게 살짝 키우는 재미를 느끼고 싶고, 교통도 그에 따라 발전시키고 싶다면 추천. 다만 그 외엔 너무나도 불편한 점도 많고, 세세하게 교통 시뮬레이팅 하는게 불가능하고, 특히 버스는 툭 하면 막혀서 간선-지선 연계를 통한 체계적인 교통망 구축같은건 거의 불가능하니 이 점을 염두에 두고 살 것인지 고민해보면 좋다. 맵 에디터는 너무 어려워서 못 만지겠다.

혹시라도 이 게임 살거면 이 점 참조해두시길.
- 2021년 1월 30일 기준으로 스팀 워크샵 문제는 해결됨. 다만 후속작인 시티즈: 스카이라인과는 달리 워크샵으로 바꿀 수 있는게 별로 없어서 시스카같은 다채로운 모드를 기대할 수가 없음.
- 멀티는 사실상 없다고 봐도 됨. 이 게임 하는 사람이 워낙 없고 그나마 하는 사람도 시티즈 스카이라인으로 넘어가서 멀티서버에 잡히는 사람이 없음. 멀티 업적은 주변에 이 게임을 하는 사람이 없으면 사실상 못깨거나 한두개정도밖에 못깬다고 봐야됨
- 시나리오가 있긴 한데 너무 대충 만들어서 재미가 없음. 그냥 도시권역 몇%커버 이게 끝임. 시나리오 할라고 사는거면 절대 사지마셈
- 사운드트랙은 안 사도 됨. 딱히 살 정도로 좋은 음악은 없는 듯
- 철로를 지을 때 cannot build in water이 자주 뜸. 노선을 온전히 지하로 넣거나 지상으로만 굴리면 뜰 일이 별로 없지만 지상과 지하를 오간다면 종종 뜸. 이게 왜 문제냐면 이거 뜨면 지은 노선을 철거해야 하기 때문. 딱 그 부분만 수정할 수 없다.

자잘한 팁
- 강 건널 때 애로사항이 있는데, 지하로 굴린다면 높이를 -8m로 한 다음 강을 건너려고 해보셈. 강 앞에서 높이를 -8m로 맞추고 클릭 한번 해 주고 강 너머를 클릭하면 강이 건너질 때가 종종 있음. 안 건너지면 지상으로 올리거나 지하로 파고들어야 하지만.
- 기본 설정으로는 수송량이 너무 낮으니까 설정을 건드려서 수송량을 1000%로 맞춰주는게 좋음. 시나리오에서는 적용 안되지만 시나리오 하는 사람이 있나
- 지하철은 사람 지나가는 곳으로만 깔면 대충 깔아도 수요가 보장됨. 하나만 깔아도 버스-지하철 연계로 돈을 쏠쏠하게 벌 수 있고 두개 깔면 지하철-지하철 환승수요가 워낙 잘나와서 돈이 많이 벌림. 돈 무제한 모드로 하더라도 수요가 많으니 보는 재미가 있을 거임(?)
- 랜드마크 중 시드니 오페라 하우스는 돔 같은거 있는 부분이 아니라 뒷쪽의 계단? 있는 쪽으로 사람들이 오가니 뒷부분이 도로를 향하게 놓아야 함. 이런 식으로 랜드마크별로 손님이 오갈 수 있는 문이 있으니 잘 봐두면 좋음.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073430344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 4377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2205, 'last_played': 1562963813}
review:
[h1]CiM2 can be very rewarding IF:[/h1]
[list]
[*][u]You're patient[/u] - you can't just drag lines through the city (like in Cities Skylines) with instant results, each stop needs to be placed individually and hooked up to your line(s). More precise, but very time consuming.
[*][u]You want detail and control[/u] - if you want to create a massive city, with transit as a nice (but relatively shallow) bonus, get Cities Skylines. If you want to create a beautiful transit network and watch trams trundle along tree-lined European boulevards, play CIM1. Transport Fever is a good alternative if you like a model railway feel. If you want to design a network which feels realistic, manage frequency to create meaningful routes and actually keep a city moving as the traffic clogs up, CIM2 is for you.
[*][u]You don't mind a steep learning curve[/u] - once you've figured out how to set it up, the first bus route you build will probably end up clogged up in traffic. You have to experiment and tweak to keep your on-road network (buses, trolleybuses & trams) moving. Pricing and zones are clunky, positioning stops can be fiddly. It takes time and experience to crack these.
[*][u]You're willing to work with awkward tools[/u] - the best way to manage traffic is to add/remove lanes, rework junctions, pedestrianise streets or add bus lanes - there's no way to do this without demolishing and rebuilding each section. A mod (described below) makes this easier by highlighting buildings that are in the way and allowing manual building placement.
[*][u]You're happy to spend time 'setting up' the game before playing[/u] - the devs left CIM2 unbalanced and unpolished when they released Cities Skylines. To get the best experience you have to install several mods - and since the community has disappeared they are tricky to find and install.
[/list]

If you don't mind all of these issues, CiM2 is the most sophisticated and rewarding public transit simulator around. If you're not sure, get it on sale - it's very expensive for a game with no support.

__________________________________________
[h1]How to set up:[/h1]
[olist]
[*]Install eis_os's Bundle patches and eis_os's PatchPlus, found [url=cim2.bytetransfer.de] here. [/url]
[*]Install SweetFX visual mod and adjust the settings file as detailed in the  [url=forum.paradoxplaza.com/forum/index.php?threads/beautiful-cim2-mod.680456/] forum thread.[/url] (You have to register your game to access, a working link can be found on page 4. Set the FXAA/SMAA defines to 0 to avoid blurring text.)
[*]Adjust in-game time ruleset to around 25% so that timetables work more realistically.
[*]Download a map of your liking from the workshop (built-in maps are poor) and, because Steam integration is broken, transfer the .map file from [code]Program Files/Steam/userdata/{yourID}/ugc/referenced[/code] to [code]Program Files/Steam/steamapps/common/Cities in Motion 2/CIM2_Data/Maps[/code]
Most workshop maps work best if you check 'disable city growth' before starting your game.
[/olist]

author: {'steamid': '76561198089425566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1495305200}
review:
Çok düşünülmeden yapılmış başarısız bir devam oyunu. Hatta birincisiyle grafikleri aynı düzeyde olsaydı hangisi devam oyunu anlayamazdınız. Hatta fark ettiyseniz 1. oyun devaöm oyunundan daha pahalı. Oyunu yapanlar bile çop olduğunun farkında. Tek tek bahsedicek olursak:
1-Otobüs, troleybüs ve tramvaylarda pek bir değişim yok ama metro durakları o kadar kötü tasarlanmış ki insanın hiç metro ağı kurası gelmiyor.
2-Daha çok DLC lazım 5-6 tane harita var çeşitlilik yok
3-Hangar sistemi ve tarife saatleri güzel olmuş ama yetersiz.
4-Arayüz karmaşık öğrenmesi zor. Tutorial size herşeyi gösteriyor ama çok uzun sürüyor.
5-Sözkonusu şehir içi taşımacılığı olduğunda helikopter yerine banliyö treni veya teleferik koysalar daha iyi olurmuş.
6-Biraz oynadıktan sonra şehir trafiği sizin seferlerini çok etkiliyor bu yüzden yeni hat kurmayı bırakıp şehir planlamaya başlıyorsunuz.

Şahsi fikrimi soracak olursanız Cities Skylines oynayın. Evet o bir şehir planlama oyunu ama şehrinizi planladıktan sonra toplu taşıma ağı kurarken bu oyundan beklediğiniz herşeyi ve fazlasını karşılayacak.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085005272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1021, 'last_played': 1618168677}
review:
Jogo muito interessante para quem gosta do estilo Tycoon.
Apresenta com um certo realismo a dinâmica do transporte público em grandes cidades, permitindo a criação de linhas de ônibus, trens e metrô.
A partir do momento em que se entende a dinâmica dos tempos tanto de trajeto quanto de manutenção, se torna um jogo bem racional.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030892147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1751, 'last_played': 1500475939}
review:
For players reminiscient of older transport tycoon simulation games. This series reminds me of Traffic Giant, the gameplay is very similar and is the reason why I brought this game.

However, learning curve is steep in CiM2 and it has a very clunky UI, if you can get past this, its a rough gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069077248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 372385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337255, 'last_played': 1503517017}

author: {'steamid': '76561198282827638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1494104879}
review:
tl;dr: Get Cities: Skylines instead.  It has transit tools rivaling those in CiM2, but they are much easier to use, and you get to build the network in your own city, not in someone else's city.  Also seriously consider C:S mods like Improved Public Transit (IPT) and Transport Lines Manager (TLM).

Having played and enjoyed Cities: Skylines (C:S), I thought I would give Cities in Motion 2 (CiM2) a roll since it is from the same publisher.

When you open a new game, you are presented with a very large city with a few demographics maps.  In order to add your first a bus line to the city, you have to first zoom in and place each and every individual bus shelter, and then you have to go back, navigate a web of confusing menus, and finally link the bus stops together with a bus line.  It can take 20-30 minutes of manual labor just to add line.  Subway lines are even worse.  For comparison, in C:S, you simply draw your loop on the city streets, and the game automatically places the bus shelters and routes the vehicles for you.

I was initially drawn to the idea of customizing timetables, which you can't currently do in C:S.  I was thinking that timetables would allow me to do cool things like make timed transfers: have two infrequent buses that arrive at a particular transfer point together to reduce wait time.  Unfortunately, timetables in CiM2 are little more than a way for you to say, "I want more buses on the line during rush hour and fewer in the middle of the day".  I felt that I had very little control over the logistics of making timed transfers.

Another subtle improvement in C:S that makes a huge difference is that you can assign colors to each bus line, but it appears you can't do that in CiM2.

One problem in both C:S and CiM2 is that the speed of the buses is completely incompatible with the time-of-day tracker.  It takes half a day or more in game time for a passenger to travel across the city.  This completely defeats the purpose "morning rush hour" and "evening rush hour", because people who started in the morning are only first getting to their destinations by the time evening rolls around.  Another problem is that the simulation speed is simply too slow; in CiM2 particularly, I should be able to fast-forward super ultra fast and run an entire day in a matter of seconds, but even on my modern Macbook Pro with graphics card, the simulation speed is dog slow and I have to wait minutes to see if my new experimental transit line worked or not.

In short, this here is really the fundamental flaw: instead of giving me a quick and nimble way to draw and experiment with transit lines, CiM2 puts a huge emphasis on visual details of the city that make the game incredibly cumbersome and not enjoyable to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145639489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 10994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10699, 'last_played': 1609191822}
review:
The game is good but had a lot more potential. You better use that F5 autosave key before you try to delete or build something or else you are screwed. Your best efforts go to waste as buses back up for blocks due to your lack of foresight. Only experience and battle scars will make you an efficient and experienced builder. 

There are a lot of things the developers could have included, but that is the end mind dump of every single tycoon or simulator game I have ever played. Gamers start thinking about what could have been added.

author: {'steamid': '76561198360646791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 21847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11000, 'last_played': 1577710126}
review:
I'm a big big big bus fan in real life and I don't think I have any reason to dislike this game. Comparing with CIM1, CIM2 has a better visual quality, more realistic transportation system (except the rubbish metro construction system). A lot of details have been added to the game which player needs to take care of. Maybe not everyone like such complicated stuff, but that's so real that I love too much! I really wish the metro construction can be improved (at least like CIM1), and the depots can act more like in real life, but I don't think there will be CIM3. So, enjoy this game, as much as I can.

Rating: 8.5/10

review: Quieres ser el magnate de las corporaciones del transporte?, pues este es tu juego. Adentrate a tomar el control y poner en funcionamiento los servicios de transportes para la ciudad que tu elijas, haz que tu población quede satisfecha con tus servicios, establece horarios, precios, rutas, y además, tambien crea nuevas zonas en las que imponer tu sistema de transporte, observa como la población crece y demanda más y más tus servicios, arruinate, y vuelve de nuevo a empezar aprendiendo de los errores. Si quieres esa parada de bus/tren/metro/tranvia/barco frente a tu casa, es solo decición tuya, pero sobre todo, disfruta

review: Buen juego, mejoro mucho a lo que era el CIM 1, de todas formas faltan pulir mas cosas, como por ejemplo poder pintar a eleccion los vehiculos (colectivos, trenes, barcos etc), una opcion de actualizacion de precios de boletos automatica, y lo mas importante mas opciones a la hora de definir una victoria en un juego multiplayer, por ejemplo trasportar X cantidad de personas o tener X cantidad de Kilometros en lineas o por ingresos semanales, etc... en fin el juego como ya dije es bueno, pero se puede mejorar mas. Saludos

author: {'steamid': '76561198368552520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 10176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10116, 'last_played': 1506511196}
review: Nichts funktioniert in diesem Game, wie es soll: Der schnelle Vorlauf ist Müll. Mal funktioniert er - meist aber nicht. Und das unabhängig von Zeiteinstellungen. Der Fahrplan, des deutschen liebstes Kind, ist schlimmer, als die heutige Bundesbahn. Wozu erstellt man Fahrpläne, wenn sich kein Zug dran hält? Meine Einstellungen sind korrekt, meine Berechnungen ebenfalls. Und dennoch kommen die Züge ´ne halbe Stunde zu früh... Müll!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014237204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2235, 'last_played': 1670708888}
review:
Pole do popisu było wielkie ale pazerność twórców doprowadziła do katastrofy.
Plusy
+świetny edytor
+spora różnorodność środków transportu
+śledzenie pojazdów
+dowolność ustawienia kamery
+sprawdza się przy budowie sieci komunikacyjnej
Minusy
-fatalna optymalizacja (przy dłuższej pracy się zawiesza non stop)
-pazerność twórców - brak modów
-pazerność twórców - beznadziejne pojazdy
-pazerność twórców - pocięcie gry na liczne dlc
-brak licencji pojazdów
-brak mapy schematycznej sieci
-brak mozliwości przebudowy drogi
Grę zabijają tak naprawdę optymalizacja, zablokowanie sceny moderskiej i przejawiająca się wszedzie pazerność twórców.
Dla wytrwałych.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070102726', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 17603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14521, 'last_played': 1635778042}
review:
Once I had a VERY good time with this game when it worked, although some heavy bugs have never been fixed like multiple monitors, different loading issues. I play the linux version.

€19.99 for the game in its actual buggy state is way too much. I would have recommended this game in 2014, but cannot recommend it at the moment. A fair price for this 7 year old game, with no devs working on it any more for years, would be in the range €5 - €10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051376939', 'num_games_owned': 817, 'num_reviews': 480, 'playtime_forever': 3854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2654, 'last_played': 1633278023}
review:
Cities in Motion 2 это игрушка полная потенциала, однако совершенно не доведенная до ума.

К большому сожалению у игры нету особо полезного поучительного уровня и она полна багов, которые приводят как к внутриигровым денежным убыткам так и нашим временным. 

Порой цели задач отказываются работать, порой с управлением возникают сложности, увы но в этой игре всё так.

reVote 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198036914722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 3313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3196, 'last_played': 1553914038}
review: Very fun game, beautiful concept, love playing in Sandbox mode and just building train and tram tracks and linking things together with buses. The only downside is for some reason people complain ticket prices are too high, so I lower them until they are in the green zone (Meaning best price), then 5 or 10  minutes later people complain they are too low. This form of micromanagment ultimately ruined this game for me and made in unplayable as I had to spend so much of my time just changing ticket prices, only for it to complain again once I had changed it. What public transport company in the world changes it prices every few days?

author: {'steamid': '76561197984365953', 'num_games_owned': 591, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1422397188}
review:
I loved this game and it's predecessor.  A lot of the complaints about the Ui are valif, but I don't give this game a thumbs down.  I didn't play it often (yes, I know, I have ony about 5 hours on record), but I still think it was a good game.  You can see the progression from CIM to CIM 2 to CS.  CS is, of course, the Sim City game everyone wanted.  

All of that said, if you are looking for something like this game, but are scared away by the bad reviews, get Transport Fever or Train Fever.  If you want the best city builder around, get CS.  These two games have surpassed the CIM series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028568041', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1536636640}
review:
You can have some minutes with fun, but that's all.
This game only have a very limited number of vehicles, with totally illogical stats.. Why a classical bus can only have 40% satisfaction ?
Build an underground metro has bugged, 9/10 time you can't build a railway under the road !
Lags are common after around one hour of games, and IA has some problems with combo bus+tram in intersections.
Objects doesn't work all time.
Spend your money day after day, but is borring after one in-game week.
I love this genre, but this game cannot be perfect without more content, unbugged metro, and more events/fun.
This is sad because Cities in Motion 2 can be a very great game, some details like growable cities add something, but dosen't make the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255901909', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1512562056}
review:
Świetna kontynuacja 1 części, jednak pare żeczy dałbym do poprawki:

plusy:
+lepszy system budowania torów i dróg niż w pierwszej części
+steam workshop
+lepsza mechanika poruszania się niż w pierwsej części
+możliwość przybliżenia do poziomu ulicznych świateł (można robić fajne skriny z tej perspektywy)
+więcej opcji zarządania np. możliwość zmiany rozkładu jazdy (gdy autobusy mają zbyt duże opuźnienia)
+ładniejsza grafika

minusy:
-ludzie niezadowoleni z błachostek
-pojazdów jest mało (bez płatnego dlc)
-pojazdy są wolne i często się psują (te z dlc nie)
-mała poprawa grafiki (liczyłem na więcej)
-mikropłatności (dlc)

oceny:
grafika 7/10
sterowanie 9/10
pojazdy (bez dlc) 6/10

średnia ocena 7,5/10

ogulnie rzecz biorąc gra jest bardo fajna i można przy niej miło spędzić czas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021282950', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2319, 'last_played': 1515701004}
review:
И вот в который раз собираясь в спешке на работу из-за того, что проспал ты выбегаешь из дома бежишь до ближайшей автобусной остановки. На ней собрались не меньше 20 человек и вот после получасового ожидания ты думаешь, что хуже уже не может быть подъезжает переполненный автобус. Весь ржавый и грязный. В твоей голове появляется мысль что даже ты сможешь организовать работу общественного транспорта. Что ж это игра предоставляет такую возможность. вам предстоит решать разнообразные задачи от планировки маршрутов и закупки транспорта до установки цен на билеты. Всем любителям экономических стратегий рекомендую.
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198123489345', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1500185711}
review:
Bueno o malo, se me hace algo extraño y confuso, tiene inovaciones "si" pero no siempre las inovaviones son las mejores, tuve la oportunidad de probar el Cities in Motion 1 y es me gusto más, lo disfrute, realmente sentia que gestionaba una empresa de trasporte publico. Si dieran a eleguir entre quedarme con este o quedarme con el "1" sin dudarlo me quedo con el primer.

En Cities: Skylines se siente que vuelves a gestionar el trasporte de forma comoda, sencilla para evitar trafico o los atascos, la gestion de Skyline toma lo bueno y como funcionaba en Cities in motion 1.

Yo recomieno que no gastes tu dinero en este juego/simulador y lo ocupes en el Motion 1 "o" en el Skyline.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088852094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5977, 'last_played': 1652557890}
review:
The first thing that I should say is that this game will not appeal to everybody. That is heavily reflected upon seeing all the negative reviews on this game. That being said, I really enjoy this game.

It took me quite a while to get into the game and actually start playing it. I didn't play the actual career before passing the 80 hour mark, spending all of my time on sandbox. Truth is, the career isn't much to mention as it isn't any difficult and not anything that I will remember as a memorable time. The sandbox however, is a totally different thing.

The amount of fun I had while just playing around in the sandbox and trying to get 100% coverage on a city is what took most of my hours spent on this game, and it will be this way for many others. I'd say this game is worth getting for it's sandbox. Especially with all the workshop content being created.

The one thing that I find a bit sad is that multiplayer is as good as dead. But find a friend with the game and you'll have a good time creating stuff together or competing to be the best.

Buy on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002670868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2308, 'last_played': 1575575882}
review:
It took me a very long time to get into this one. I played it in fits and starts.

However, once I understood the underlying systems I spent a good deal of time enjoying it. Like a lot of building games, it's easy to spend hours and hours doing tiny little tweaks.
If you're struggling to enjoy this, it's probably worth doing a bit of research on howtos.

I liked the way the campaign worked, returning to previously completed maps. This meant that you really had to plan for the long term on each map.
