author: {'steamid': '76561198128810424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1846, 'last_played': 1573227080}
review: I really loved this game! Even with Cities: Skylines now out, this game focuses more on the public transportation aspect of a city, and from what I've experienced in real life, these mechanics seem quite realistic. For someone who is really interested in a simulation/engineering game genre, this game really hits the spot. The game's experience is great, and the openness of the single player quests really encourages you to achieve them your own way in your city. With so many options, you can truly play a completely different game than somebody else. I really hope others like me can enjoy this game, and a special thanks to my friend for gifting me this game in the first place! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198006531153', 'num_games_owned': 584, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1411078014}
review: This is a great game. Its biggest weakness is the lack of a good tutorial. When you're done with tutorial, you know about 5% of the game. Really... You are not learning anything useful. Especially if you are a player of Cities in Motion 1, you aren't learning something new with the tutorial. And that's why this game is so hard to play. The game is a big step higher in term of management and they are not teaching anything about this. So most people will give up before starting to enjoy it because they dont want to dig forever to find out how it works. And I guess this is the reason the reviews are so bad. I'll make mine a positive review even if I'm part of those disapointed people that don't understand half how the game works. Because I know it's a good game and a great step higher than Cities in motion 1. But still, I dont understand exactly how every features work and it's not making me wanna play more. This is sad. This game could have been a real blast to play if there was the appropriate tutorial to teach people how it works. That's something the dev could have upgraded. They could have get way better reviews and get more people interested into playing this game (especially now they released Cities Skyline which is a very popular and appreciated game). Come on Colossal order, give Cities in Motion 2 the tutorial it deserves!

author: {'steamid': '76561198119289127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4488, 'last_played': 1576008800}
review:
For those who come from the newer game from the devs, [i]Cities: Skylines[/i] wondering what this previous games of theirs is like: In short, CiM2 is [still] the best public transport simulator out there.
In [i]Cities: Skylines[/i] you get a way bigger map area, better and faster engine, more possibilities for building a city - but its public tr. system is simplified, whereas CiM2 is completely built around that with lots more options.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[*][b]Schedules[/b]: Creation schedules is incredible, you can tailor each line to demand. Also worth setting different lines from a same depot to leave with a delay (e.g. fist buses leaving each line at 4:30,4:35,4:40 respectively, for instance) to avoid queuing, jams, etc on the roads nerby. Don't forget to buy enough vehicles for every depot, for servicing. Don't buy too many either because they won't fit in and just deteriorate over time, waiting on the streets.

[*][b]Street types:[/b]: Building roads is incredible, you can curve the range of different types (avenues, one-way streets-bus lanes, and a large combination of these) at any angle and arc, more diversely than in Cities:Skylines.

[*][b]Vehicle parameters:[/b] Acceleration, capacity, maintenance cost, fuel consumption, attractiveness.
You can choose to invest in attractive vehicles early on to increase usage. You can choose smaller capacity vehicles running more frequently, or big ones running paced out.

[*][b]Finances:[/b] You can set driver/reparimen/inspector wages (and nr. of inspectors). The sweet spot for inspectors tends to be 11 credit wages, and an amount so that they catch ~33% of freeloaders. This yields maximum income. The income from inspection nicely balances the loan payment amount usually

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[*][b]Loans:[/b] This is almost like cheat. will have almost unlimited money: You take a huge loan, and set a long nr of installments. It means you can build an infrastructure of metros straight away and guarantee decent income while never actually repaying it (as it may take ~50 in-game weeks or more). Have the decency to work with the 100k starting money, and also don't burn it on metros or trams. Start with buses and replace them later with trams/metros.

[*][b]Campaign:[/b] The game jumps you into "Berlin", a huge city with a lot of tasks to do. It should start with a small village. Also the campaign scenarios are short, and not really diverse. Custom, free, Steam workshop user-created maps are great to try but offer no missions. Still it's fun to play this game as sandbox, like Cities: Skylines is also, basically.

[*][b]Performance:[/b] On larger maps or a large nr. of lines the game likes quite a bit. It is actually caused by the overlay (floating icons for vehicles, stops, lines, depots) which can be turned off but cumbersom (individually).
Also it is heavily CPU based, so even an 8-core AMD 8350 struggles on 3x speed (you don't play on 1x usually). When the CPU can't handle more, 3x feels like 1,5x. Not necessarily FPS drop but simulation speed is sluggish.

[*][b]Vehicles:[/b] While there is a nice selection of vehicles, there is one ultimate one in each category, meaning I never actually tried most of the buses/trams as they are inferior.

[*][b]Gameplay:[/b] While I put some 100+ hours into the game (therefore safe to say it is addictive) it is a grind sometimes. Also can't seem to change the default schedule to something better (2 hour frequency is really bad).

[*][b]AI:[/b] The citizens very rarely glitch into circling some vehicle at a crosswalk when too many of them want to cross the road.

[*][b]Road upgrade:[/b] Unfortunately, as good and diverse the road types are, you cannot upgrade them, but need to demolish and rebuild.

[*][b]Ticket prices:[/b] The game allows you to set ticket prices for vehicle type vs zones, and for single ticket and passes. While this is great to be flexible, it also becomes a grind. Basically a huge table of 6*5*2 cells that you continually need to monitor and update because as you build new lines, demand changes and hence the prices (really complicated system, you will see. The game gives you hints whether a price is below or above the normal. Per cell. With an alert at notification bar every time there is a single cell (ticket combination) that deviates moderately. Ouch.)

[*][b]Stop interest:[/b] The circle area of a stop that you place (which attracts only the buildings inside) is a little disappointing. A better solution would be the method in Train Fever where citizens will decide how much they need to walk, and they still choose a stop even if it's far, if it means they still get from A to B faster (that game starts from horse carriages are though).


Overall I greatly recommend the game, with its flaws there is still a ton of plus, and is a fantastic simulation for anyone loving traffic, public transportation, or just plain management games! Support a small company :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198250108424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 32840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28711, 'last_played': 1702602458}
review:
良いところ
とてもいいゲームだと思う。

改善してほしいところ
メトロの車両の種類が少ないと思う。（ＤＬＣを含めて５種類。組み合わせるのも含めて10種）
メトロとトラム（路面電車）で折り返しができないのが不便だった。
デフォの車庫（depot）の収容数がやや少ない。増設できるモジュールや、他の車庫からの応援とかができるようにしてほしい。
車庫から出て車庫に戻るのではなく、路線を設定してそれから車庫を選ぶようにしてほしかった。
路面電車の停留所を安全地帯のように作れるようにしてほしい。
メトロの複々線の内側の線路にもホームを設置できるようにしてほしかった。
定員を座席と立席で分けてほしい。
前作の車両の速度、時代の観念を復活させて。
一般車が緊急車両に進路を譲らない、2車線以上の道路で1つの車線固まる。
高層マンションの住人が20人と少なすぎる。
建物の区分に買い物と行政がなくなった。
メトロの上位互換、例えばリニア鉄道とかがほしかった。
ヘリコプター残しておいてほしかった。
鉄道駅と空港、遊園地とかがなくなって寂しい。
人の職業が単にブルーカラー、ホワイトカラーなどに省かれた。
歩道橋かコンコースを作りたかった。

１からよくなったところ
勾配のある所でもバス停などを設置できるようになった。
バス・トロリーバス・路面電車が停車できる停留所がＤＬＣであるが設置が可能になった。
建設できる道路・線路の種類が増えた。
モノレールが複線でも建設できるようになった。（要DLC）

author: {'steamid': '76561198007316850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1453680551}
review:
As a fan of simulation games I was interested to see how public transport simulation could be made fun and interesting.

I'm still wondering since the tutorial was unhelpful, rushed and doesn't explain the game well at all - there was no option to return to a step if you didn't understand the concept and it would allow you to accidentally skip a step without completing it. The tutorial leaves steps out of the process - like building bus depots before building the bus stops themselves - leaving you to try and piece the puzzle together yourself.

This game might be interesting and fun, but I'll be damned if I could get it to work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040872066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1452701572}
review:
I really wanted to like this game. In fact, I gave it several different tries. It's just not a very good sim game. The cities that you start the campaign with are huge and the tutorial really doesn't help much. I would have rather started on a city the size of the tutorial city and worked my way up. The font sizes are tiny and not very easy to read and the cities are hard to work around in due to the designs. This game would have benefited from a change from super-realistc graphics to something a little more cartoon-ish. I don't need ultra-realistic to run a transportation company. I just need easy-to-work controls. 

Like I said, I really did want to like this game, but it's just not very fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029980905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1424483556}
review:
It's like Cities:Skylines, But approximately 1/10th the quality.

If you're considering this game... Go buy cities skylines instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253059387', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 4325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3818, 'last_played': 1450034633}
review:
Cities in Motion 2 é um jogo de simulação de transporte público. Para quem gosta de simulação, recomendo fortemente este jogo. Apesar de inexistir desastres ou outras formas de intervenção no seu sistema de transporte, o jogo é bem divertido simplesmente pela ideia de montar suas próprias linhas e conexões e vê-las funcionando (ou não). 
Único detalhe, para mim, é o preço. Recomendo que comprem na promoção, até porque acho que alguns DLCs são essenciais para jogar, uma vez que há pouca diversidade de veículos no jogo base e, na promoção, o conjunto vale muito a pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091183329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 100526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 385, 'playtime_at_review': 34847, 'last_played': 1710601453}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044319682', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1668368179}
review:
I wouldn't recommend this game unless you're willing to spend hours restarting your game.

The learning curve is way too steep, the initial campaign (which I started with in order to get some goals) is very difficult because it starts straight away in a massive city. The map is also very deceptive as to how long it takes to get between places, what looks like a short bus route can easily be a 5 hour journey.

That said, I've not yet spent hours and hours playing this, so my opinion of it may well change as I get better at the game. It could do with a better tutorial/better ramp up of difficulty in campaign mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082055785', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1651376356}
review:
Die wird dann wohl meine erste nagative Review sein :(

[h1]Cities in Motion 2 macht vieles besser, hat jedoch nicht den Flair vom ersten Teil.[/h1]

[b]Fangen wir von vorne an...[/b]
Ich bin schon seit Anfang 2012 Fan vom ersten Teil der Cities in Motion-Reihe. Damals sah ich das Spiel im Laden (Ja, damals kaufte ich noch Spiele im Laden) und war sofort begeistert von den Screenshots hinten auf dem Spielecover. Ich beschloss mir das Spiel zu kaufen. Ich hockte Nächte lang vor dem Spiel um mein Verkehrssystem weiter zu verbessern und zu optimieren. Ich liebe Simulatoren oder auch Strategiespiele, vor allem wenn es um Management geht bin ich gerne dabei. Daher war das Spiel damals wirklich ein Knaller für mich.

[b]Nun zum Nachfolger...[/b]
Ich kaufte mir das Spiel nach vielem Überlegen günstig bei einer Rabattaktion. Ich hatte mich vorher gründlich über das Spiel informiert, mir Videos und Reviews angesehen/gelesen. Ich war nicht sehr begeistert von dem was ich gesehen hatte, aber ich wollte es dennoch selbst ausprobieren.

Zuerst muss ich betonen, dass dieser Nachfolger in keinster Weise den "Flair" des ersten Spiels einfängt. Keine Detailtreue, wenige Fahrzeuge, langweilige Städte, keine zur Zeit passende Städte oder Fahrzeuge, und und und...
Das alles war im ersten Spiel beinahe perfekt auf einander abgestimmt. Man konnte sich regelmäßig erwischen, wie man Passagiere verfolgt und sehen möchte wo sie hinreisen. Man zoomte nah in die Spielwelt um auch kleine Schilder lesen zu können. Dieses "gute Gefühl" fehlt im zweiten Teil.

Nun zu einer kurzen Zusammenfassung mit Pro und Contra:

[h1]Pro[/h1]
[list]
[*]Gute Performanz
[*]Aktuelle Grafik
[*]Fahrplanmanagement
[*]Bauoptionen
[/list]

[h1]Contra[/h1]
[list]
[*]Schwieriger Spieleinstieg
[*]Wenige Fahrzeuge
[*]Wenig Detailtreue
[*]Langweilig gestaltete und immer gleich aussehende Städte
[*]Langweilige Soundkulisse
[*]"Schlechtes Spielgefühl"
[*]Viele DLCs mit Inhalten, die im Spiel bereits enthalten sein sollten
[/list]

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Cities in Motion 2 ist leider kein würdiger Nachfolger vom ersten Teil. Es fehlt der "Flair" des alten Spiels, sowie eine schöne Spielwelt. Immer gleiche und ähnelnde Städte sind langweilig und es macht nach kurzer Zeit kein Spaß mehr in diesen zu spielen. Wer ein wirkliches Interesse an einem tollen Verkehrsmanagement-Titel hat sollte sich das 2011 erschienene Cities in Motion (1) kaufen. Hier stimmt sowhl die Detailtreue und die Fahrzeugauswahl, außerdem bietet der erste Teil einen Zeitraum von 1920-2020, in denen der Spieler gefordert wird sich den Bedingungen anzupassen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004828909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 48890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19806, 'last_played': 1600884959}
review:
Habe noch nie ein Spiel erlebt das so oft absturzt und so derbst stark verbuggt ist. Und dann waren die Entwickler der Meinung, das ein Autosave obsolet wäre. Für ein Spiel, das alle 5 Minuten abstürzt?!?! Vor allem auch beim Speichern stürzt es ab. Das ist als Profi-ÖPNV-Planer schon sehr ärgerlich. DIeses spiel ist jedenfalls nicht professionell entwickelt worden.

Das Spiel an sich ist recht gut, viel komplexer als der Vorgänger. Würde es nicht so oft abstürzen, würde es auch Spaß machen. 

Die Jungs und Mädels aus Tampere haben ganze arbeit geleistet, einen Scheißdreck zu programmieren. Anscheind waren es 3 Jährige, die noch nie zuvor einen Computer gesehen haben (hat man beim ersten Teil dieser Serie auch sehr deutlich gemerkt). Es ist mir auch unverständlich wie Paradox derart gravierende Fehler übersehen konnte und diesen Mist freigegeben hat!  

Das Problem ist folgendes. Das Spiel ist in 32 Bit geschrieben und benötigt weit mehr als 3GB Arbeitsspeicher. Kann es aber nicht adressieren, weshalb beim Speichern oft "Out of Memory" kommt (die Entwickler haben dieses Fenster wohl extra einprogrammiert, anscheind wussten die, dass das so passieren wird, war denen aber scheißegal!). Für ein so komplexes Spiel aus dem Jahre 2013 ist es völlig unverständlich es noch in 32 bit zu progrrammieren. An Größe ist das Spiel mit 1,27GB ein Fliegengewicht. Leider. Es dürfte gut und gern 15GB oder mehr groß sein, wenn es dafür zeitgemäß programmiert worden wäre und nicht auf Techniken beruhtr, die noch aus dem Jahre 1985 stammen!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198235793214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 15178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4300, 'last_played': 1690750396}
review:
Игра очень хорошая, затягивает надолго. Создана финскими разработчиками как продолжение 1-ой части игры. У Cities in Motion 2 есть много достоинств по сравнению с ней:
  + Большие карты, что даёт простор для фантазии, хотя и накладывает ограничения на производительность компьютера.
  + Удобный интерфейс: огромное количество графиков на все аспекты игры.
  + Смена дня и ночи, соответствующий цикл перемещений горожан.
  + Редактор правил, позволяющий подстроить игру под собственные нужды.
  + Красивая графическая составляющая, хотя и не такая яркая как в 1-ой части.
  + Мощный инструментарий в руках игрока: возможно строить кварталы прямо на ходу.
  + Разнообразие дорог, которые могут иметь самую невероятную форму и выделенку для транспорта игрока.
  + Наличие многопользовательского режима

Однако есть и недостатки, среди которых стоит отметить:
  - Отсутствие моддинга.
  - Отсутствие исторического развития, когда со временем появляется новый транспорт и здания, а старые исчезают.
  -/+ Американские здания портят вид игры, хотя это моё личное мнение.

В общем, хотя некоторые могут бросить 1-ую часть, но эта игра является не заменой а скорее дополнением к ней.

review:
Jeu de gestion vraiment intéressant avec son côté de gestion financière, d'étude de marché, l'évolution de l'offre et de la demande.
Le mode multijoueur est vraiment un super point car pouvoir jouer en concurrence contre un ami est vraiment drôle et l'esprit de compétition rend le jeu encore plus puissant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158047753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9785, 'last_played': 1451736038}
review:
I wanted to like this game... I love dealing with logistics and transport routes, and while this game could have had more, it had everything needed to build a whole mass transit system...

but there is one game-breaking bug that makes this game pointless to play...

passengers will run around in a circle around the stop, and never board a vehicle, and the driver isn't smart enough to close the doors and keep on going... "you had your chance to get on, you missed it..."

the vehicle just sits there, forever, waiting on the passenger that WON'T BOARD... backing up all the traffic behind it.

right now I literally have a hundred vehicles, all trapped behind 2 of these bugs in different places, and the only way to get them moving again is to turn the routes off and back on, removing all the vehicles to depot... which does no good, as they will just get trapped again.

Cities Skylines, focuses on city building... it has some transport support, but you don't get much control over it.
Cities in Motion 2, focuses on transport... it has some city building support, but you don't get much control over it.

If they would only merge the two games, giving us the city building of Skylines, and the transport  complexity of Cities in Motion 2, it would be perfect...

I highly recommend Skylines even with its drawbacks... the bugs aren't game-breaking...

Do yourself a favor and save your money, as buying Cities in Motion 2, is just a ripoff at this point. Until they fix this bug (and I don't expect them to ever bother with CiM2 again, as it appears to no longer be supported), there is no point in playing.

I don't even think it should continue to be sold at this point. Steam should remove it. Keeping games like this available, in this condition, reflects badly on Steam, and they should have higher standards about the titles they associate with their brand.

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME... You will only end up feeling ripped off...

-- Smoov

author: {'steamid': '76561198262978846', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 7391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1493, 'last_played': 1691154015}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018144619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1458086872}
review:
Really disappointed in this game - bought recently from Bundlestars, installed and tried to run it and kept coming up with error on Windows 10 about mono library being missing.

Went into the forums on Steam to see if their is a solution - only recommendation is to go to Paradox's forums and ask there.  Went there and found out the game was actually discontinued back in 2013, and so was the forums.

They still have Cities Skylines forum open but CiM2 is closed and it seems they're not interested in supporting this title at all - which I have a big question - if your not supporting it why on earth are you still selling it???  If it can't run on modern OS this should be made clear in the description that it's not compatible with Windows 10.  The only thing I can see is that minimum requirements mentions XP/7/8 and 10 isn't listed, but many other games also don't list 10 as it's a new OS

From what I can see it seems mono library is something to do with VC++ however as Windows 10 has a later edition of VC++ there isn't any way of getting it to use the older version of VC++ that this mono.dll is compatible with, so if you've upgraded to Windows 10 don't bother with this game 'cos it wont work - I'm now probably going to try and get it running on a Linux box and hopefully get it working so I wont have wasted my money.

review: Ta gra jest okrojona i podzielona na dlc. Podstawowe pojazdy są słabe, jest ich mało i w dodatku szybko się psują co zmusza nas do kupna dlc z lepszymi pojazdami. Pasażerowie często są za niedowoleni z błachych powodów wystarczy że cena biletu będzie droższa o 0,10. Twórcy zadbali też o mikrotranzakcje możemy kupić międzyinnymi lepsze przystanki lub też budynki specjalne np: sydney opera house. Jedyny plus to workshop gdzie możemy pobrać jakieś dobre mapy ale wydanie hajsu tutaj też nas nie ominie bowiem do niektórych map jest wymagany dlc o nazwie Europen Cities. Podsumowując CIM 2 to gniot który trzeba omijać szerokim łukiem. Traffic Giant z 2000 roku jest o wiele lepszy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035564796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5755, 'last_played': 1472665994}
review:
An amazingly addictive transport simulation. The game has beautiful graphics, an amazingly smart iinterface allowing to implement almost any idea on the map. In fact CiM2 is just one step from a full scale city builder. 

Although the campaign can be considered a weak spot (it's incomparable to the scenarios from CIM1), the game's strongest point is the community, filling the workshop with great maps from all over the world. All this will keep you playing CIM2 for hundreds of hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198187871345', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2077, 'last_played': 1646405614}
review:
Ach ja, das gute alte Cities in Motion!

Da ich den Vorgänger selber schon gespielt habe und aus reiner Begeisterung heraus den neuen nachgekauft habe, denke ich kann ich eine recht gute Rezension zu diesem Spiel geben.
Um's vorweg zu nehmen: Der Wertung von Gamestar kann ich teilweise nicht zustimmen. Zwar ist es schon ganz richtig, dass es sicher kein Glanzstück ist, jedoch heißt das nicht das Cities in Motion 2 gleich schlecht ist. Im Gegenteil! Manche Dinge macht die Fortsetzung sogar besser! Doch jetzt,... der Reihe nach!


Story

Nun ja,... es gibt keine :)
 
Allgemein

In Cities in Motion 2 nehmen wir, wie im Vorgänger die Postion des städtischen Nahverkehrsmanagers ein, und müssen ebenso wie im Vorgänger die Preise optimieren, Linien anlegen, Vehikel kaufen, Leute glücklich machen und, und, und...
Eigentlich alles wie im Vorgänger?
Nein eben nicht! Den es gibt sogar einige Verbesserungen! Wie zum Beispiel: Zonen, individuelle Fahrpreise, mehr Individualität beim Bauen, Straßen bauen, Bessere Grafik (Technik),...

Ansonsten eigentlich ja, wie im Vorgänger!

 
Steuerung

Nun ja, was soll man sagen. Die Steuerung im ersten Teil war manchmal nervtötend, die im zweiten Teil ist es auch! Aber eben nur teilweise, den das einzige wirklich umständliche ist das U-Bahn bauen und die Verlegung von Gleisen jeglicher Art. Ansonsten klarer Plus Punkt, den die Steuerung geht hier schon eher in Richtung modern.

 
Technik

Eine klare Verbesserung zum Vorgänger! Die Städte wirken lebendiger, Autos fahren realistischer, Leute reagieren realistischer, die Grafik hat eindeutig einen großen Schritt gemacht, die 3rd Person Kamera der Fahrzeuge links unten sieht besser aus und auch in den restlichen Bereichen hat der Technikteil fast überall einen großen Schritt nach vorne gemacht. Aber eben nur fast... So stört zum Beispiel, dass das Bulldoze Tool nicht mit der Kurztaste 'B' aufzurufen ist, und ja auch gibt es manchmal Kopfzerbrechen mit den Zahlen.


+MULTIPLAYER+

Der Multiplayer (hier übrigenes dazugeworfen, der Originaltext lässt sich auf www.gamestar.de finden) ist eine unglaublich spaßige und abwechlungsreiche Erweiterung des Hauptspieles. Dieser Part lässt dem Spiel einen gehörigen Punkteaufstieg geben, und verlängert die Spielzeit um einige dutzend Stunden. Voraussgesetzt sie finden jemanden der dazu bereit ist, denn es gibt nur dedicated Server. Doch hier kann eine Anfrage auf der offiziellen Steam Steite von CIM2 Abhilfe schaffen!

 
Fazit
Wenige Fahrzeuge, keine gute Städtebausimulation und hakelige Bedienung, so etwas hat man von Cities in Motion 2 gehört. Doch findet man sich erstmal mit dem ein oder anderen Bug ab, dann macht die Verkehrssimulation einen Riesenspaß!


 Kaufempfehlung?

>Ja und nein. Wer den Vorgänger nicht kennt, dem kann ich sowohl das Neue als auch das Alte ans Herz legen. Für Fans vom ersten Teil gibt es jedoch auch hier jede Menge zu entdecken und investieren. Viel Spaß wünscht euch Marian Kubanda<

author: {'steamid': '76561198037063911', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2536, 'last_played': 1487335697}
review:
Мне игра жутко понравилась!
Сразу хочу сказать, что это НЕ градостроительный симулятор! 
Это симулятор транспорта. Вам дается уже готовый город, в котором вы играете за транспортную компанию. Ваша задача - прокладывать транспортные маршруты таким образом, что бы людям было удобно добираться от места жилья к месту работу или развлечения и наоборот.

Эта игра для опытных игроков в экономических стратегиях. С первых минут, придется убить немало времени, осваивая все азы и тонкости графиков и таблиц, отражающий суть вещей в вашей компании.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999413547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 3405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1286, 'last_played': 1610830224}
review:
As of writing this review, the game costs $20. For that price I would maybe recomend it, but definetly buy it if it goes on sale as it has in the past.

I got about 30 hours out of it and maybe will get more. I'll start with con's since there are so few:

-Campaign is pretty simple in terms of building/planning: Just build a central metro/tram and then build buses/trolleys to feed into it. You'll always make a profit, and by the time you can, you are able to get 100% coverage on the campaigns.
-Not able to see all the routes people use who live/work in a build. You have to click on each person (opens a new window), then click on where they commute to (opens up a new window) and then on that window you have to click the scroll to button that moves your camera to that building, and then you have to close all the windows to see anything. Repeat these steps for each person. It really sucks the planning out of the game as you are just throwing down lines wherever you think people need them without any data to go on other than "buildings are here".

Pro's:
-Great graphics
-Entertaining game if you like managing the public transit system and tweaking the schedule of different lines and solving the bottle necks that occur with things like having a busy metro interchange with a busstop.


Overall recomend to play and explore, but it's lack of dept prevents playing it for much more than 30 hours unless you are really into this genre. Buy it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137435080', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 2597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2001, 'last_played': 1521150973}
review:
Cities in Motion 2 is a mass transit building and management simulator. It gives you decent options in building stops and depots for five different mass transit modes: buses, trams, trolleys, metros and boats.

In my opinion, this game is very tedious and boring. Most of the game you will spend waiting for things to make money so that you can buy one thing or another, and then you can wait some more. Even at the highest speed, the game is so slow.

Construction is a pain in the ass. Expect for buses (which make little money) and boats (which are kind of hard to effectively place), the other forms of transportation require that you zoom in and tediously place tracks or wires. Going from each street along the path placing block by block what you need. The metro tracks are such a pain. Building them is a constant stream of "Track is too long" or "curve is too sharp" or "track touches water" or some other issue that is hard to resolve due to the clunky controls. Connecting your tracks is also difficult. The game requires that you hit a tiny half circle spot at the end of the tracks to connect, which is near impossible underground as you can't hide roads. Screw up, and there's no real way to edit your metro tracks except to delete huge swaths of it,.

I can also see no advantage or disadvantage to using one system or another. The cities look terrible, entirely boring and grey. The "campaign" is 14 levels set across 5 maps, so you'll repeatedly return to your map. This "campaign" is also mostly composed of the same couple objectives, being to raise company value, increase population of the city or have a certain % coverage, all entirely uninteresting. The game also adds a couple randomized side objectives, but these are either to connect two arbitrary buildings together or to transport a certain number of passengers to a random building. So boring.

The achievements are alright I guess, and the big reason I have so many hours was from idling to get achievements (like the 60 hours of gameplay). This game also has CDN$ 76 worth of DLC for some reason, most of which seem to be overpriced reskins and other cosmetic changes.

This game isn't fun. Don't buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067927333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1472, 'last_played': 1639153844}
review:
Some advice for new players. Not sure if this is the best way, but they seems to work.
-Use buses the first few times. It's much easier to fix your mistakes.
-Build large bus routes. They seems to work better than lots of small ones.
-Try to have them connect to the seperate parts of the city. Crossing a bridge from a smaller part to one of the center islands increases ticket sales.
-Use the Economic Panel. You can change ticket prices, employee salaries, take loans(dont recommend this), and see your weekly cash flow.
-Don't increase ticket prices to much in the beginning. You will lose popularity.
-Look at you individual lines. If you click on them they will tell you how many vehicles are required, your weekly income and expenses, and passenger reports. Check this to see if a route is making or losing money. I ended up removing 3 smaller lines when I first learned this because they were costing me nearly 3000 a week.
-Connect your lines. Have two seperate lines use the same stop. It will allow you to transport them further without having to build a new line.
-Be patient. It takes time for your lines to make money. It might be a good idea to just leave this on while you do something else for a while. Be sure to save whenever you come back to check on it, though, sometimes you will start to lose money for no apparent reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014502377', 'num_games_owned': 2868, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1504008930}
review:
Although expertly built and chock full of options, Cities in Motion 2 is not my cup of tea. I'll do my best to critique it fairly regardless.

In most regards, CiM2 competes with genre and industry giants such as anything produced by Maxis. So, any Sim game, really. CiM2 competes visually, audibly, in terms of detail, and in terms of objective. This is both positive and negative. It's positive because, while CiM2 certainly offers it's own unique brand of flavor in the Sim genre, it's still just another flavor. Whether you're mircromanaging public transit systems in CiM2 or micromanaging individual people's lives in the Sims 3, you're still just micromanaging aspects of human function. 

That said, if you're into that, you'll love this. CiM2 is intricate, detail oriented to a fault, and undeniably rewarding to people with intense OCD.

If you don't have that, but still like micromanagement, you'll probably still find some measure of satisfcation from watching trains and busses make circuits. 

If you're neither of those things, you won't like this. You'll probably enjoy it about as much as you enjoy actually riding public transit to get to your monotonous job as you micromanage your REAL life. Which is about as enjoyable as a sharp stick in the eye.

So there's that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000964011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 14154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12446, 'last_played': 1709444006}
review:
I've owned this game for years and I still enjoy playing it. I think that overall it's an enjoyable game for people who are transit enthusiasts and who enjoy complex simulation games. There's a lot of micromanagement in the game (like being careful where you place your metro tracks and managing schedules). Once you are experienced, you come up with patterns that work well and you can quickly apply them to all of your routes so that you're able to get through dull parts more quickly. I'm still discovering new techniques to this day.

However, what makes this game annoying to play after a few hours with a city is the lack of editing tools and tools for automating tasks. You can't edit a route to add a stop in, so if you discover you missed a spot and want to cover that area, you can't just add another stop and have vehicles on the route reach out to cover that spot and then return to their normal route. You have to delete the route and create it all over again. The tasks you need to do as your city grows, like increase schedule frequency and buy trasit vehiicles, can't be automated. So as your city grows, it feels more and more of a chore to audit all your routes and make sure they're working well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042142755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 47489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24395, 'last_played': 1690663882}
review:
Also nach über 400 Stunden CiM2 muss ich dieses Spiel einfach positiv bewerten. Es macht Spaß, man kann Sachen ausprobieren und Städte verändern, die dank des dynamischen Wachstums relativ einfach wachsen. Dazu muss man nur eine Straße platzieren und schon werden dort Häuser platziert.

Auch das Erstellen von Linien ist super gestaltet, nur wenn es manchmal nervt, dass jede Linie erst zu ihrem Depot fahren muss bevor sie wieder starten kann. Man hat eine gute Auswahl an Verkehrsmitteln: Genau 5, wie bei CiM1 - Legendlich der etwas sinnlos erscheinende Helikopter wurde durch einen häufig brauchbaren O-Bus ersetzt.

Die Kampange habe ich noch nicht fertig gespielt, das liegt aber eher daran, dass ich gerne im Sandbox-Modus spiele (häufig mit unendlich Geld). Ich liebe es einfach nach einer Weile dem prosperierenden Verkehrssystem und allgemein der Stadt zuzuschauen. Die Gebäude mögen nicht so ein großes Detailreichtum wie in CiM 1 bieten, dafür gibt es eine größere Spielfläche, die unter anderem eine größere Stadt ermöglichen.

Man kann - anders als im 1. Teil - jetzt auch aktiv in die Stadtplanung eingreifen. Dafür stehen einem eine große Pallette an verschiedenen Straßen zur Verfürgung. Gut finde ich auch, dass man bei Abriss von Gebäuden (für benötigte Fläche für den Nahverkehr oder den Privatverkehr) nicht so sehr bestraft wird. Im ersten Teil, wo man noch nicht mal die Straßen verändern konnte, gingen bei einem Hausabriss schon mal gut zehn Prozent der Beliebtheit flöten.

Ebenfalls toll ist der Multiplayer, den es so im 1.Teil überhaupt nicht gab.  wobei hier nach einer gewissen Netzgröße (sehr gross) oder einer vollgebauten Stadt das Spiel schnell anfängt zu ruckeln. Ausserdem passiert es manchmal, dass verschiedene Spieler verschiedene Geldstände haben (im Co-op Modus) oder keine Straßen sehen, wo eigentlich welche gebaut wurden.

Allem in Allem ist aber die Steuerung deutlich verbessert gegenüber des 1. Teils. Auch das geringe Detailreichtum hat mich nur in den wenigsten Fällen gestört. Solange die Städte nicht ganz so abstrakt sind wie zum Beispiel in A-Train, ist das hier meckern auf sehr hohem Niveau.

Was ich mir gewünscht hätte/wünsche für einen 3. Teil:
- Nicht so verbuggte Verkehrsteilnehmer, also bessere und vor allem schnellere Routenfindung
- die Autos sollen auch über große Straßen fahren und nicht immer die Schleichwege durch das Wohngebiet verwenden
- die Freiheit die U-Bahnstationen überall zu plazieren, sollte beibehalten werden
- eventuell die U-Bahn auch über die Straße fahren lassen (per Tramgleis)
- der Multiplayer sollte ein bisschen entbuggt werden + unbegrenzt Geld im Multiplayer

Meine Spielzeiten: CiM 1: 140 h ; CiM 2: 400 h

author: {'steamid': '76561198066659845', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1524840555}
review: I have read many negative reviews about this game, but I think it's a great improvement on the first while comparing the camera angles, controls, graphics etc. Although these are all great, the only thing that is bad about this game is the design engine. While trying to join tracks for your metro system, you will constantly try and adgust it to fit perfectly in the way the game wants it to go. Then, the tram system. Trying to place a double track is a pain and has terrible intergration. The game lays it down and doesn't do it automatically. You have to manually click on every part of the road to place the tram track. Despite this negative feedback I reccomend this game more than the first because the graphics and controls are awesome and I enjoy the gameplay. Other than missing helicopters from the first, it allows you to customise the timetables, trains etc which is a great feature for someone like me who enjoys simulations. If you like graphics, controls and gameplay, get this game. If you prefer the story type of a game, get the first. If you want to improve your experience, buy the DLC! There is a pack available on g2a.com for you to buy this fairly cheaply. Thanks for reading, hope you have fun playing in the future!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024730417', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 5879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4627, 'last_played': 1459411534}
review:
The tutorial in this game is useless, since there's a ton of little annoying things that are not intuitive. But once you know, it works: 

You have to delete and rebuild roads to get bus lanes. Trams can have tracks on medians and pedestrian paths, and you have to build the tram station appropriately (in the median or on the side of the road). Metros can be built elevated or underground with the page up/page down key (minimum clearance is 8m, which is two page ups/page downs). Building metro track at elevation zero (0 m) will enable your cursor to snap to metro track stubs. Building a metro track/road curve is like using the pen tool in photoshop: you drop a vertex with left click and you undo the last vertex with right click. Waterbuses cannot navigate through/around terrain, so you have to manually waypoint around those. The metro passenger entry point is that tiny "teleportation box" that appears on the nearest roadway when you build the station. Tram tracks/Trolley Wires need to be connected through intersections by clicking on the tracks/wires on one side, then clicking on the side you want to connect to. If there's no routable path to the next station, zoom in and inspect the roads for one-way streets and missing intersections. When you delete intersecting roads/metro tracks, the remaining road can still have remnants of an "intersection" that makes it count as two roads. That "intersection" can be deleted again to turn the road back into a single piece of road/track.

If you do play multiplayer, PAUSE THE GAME OR SLOW IT DOWN BEFORE DEMOLISHING ANYTHING, and try not to demolish a lot of things in rapid succession. Don't play it on the fastest speed. If you do desync, have one person share their save file with everyone else and overwrite their local saves, then try to rehost the game.

You can adjust the rulesets to do things like make the game speed slower (helpful for big, lagtacular maps) and increase depot size (recommended).

Hopefully reading this makes the game playable, since it's pretty fun once you know all the little things. But then again, I was determined to make it work.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971052197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1664660127}
review:
In it's current format I can not recomend the game as it is completely unplayable.

I have recently had my eyes tested and they're above 20/20 and yet at about a foot and a half from my 27 inch screen at 4k resolution I cannot read any of the ingame text. I've tried changing to a smaller res but the font size doesn't get any better.

I can find no option to make the text larger and there seems to be no response from the devs despite public outcry. 

Such a shame as this actually looked like it could be quiet good if I could actually play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007417157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2543, 'last_played': 1440536281}
review:
Very Interactive and enjoyable game, which breaks away from some simple concepts from similar games which give it a far more realistic feel. For instance, rather then just building routes that bring in loads of money so you can build even more lucrative routes and then get bored from having too much money to spend, you actually have to invest by borrowing money, unless you goto bed leaving it running and collect the cash in the morning! 

The good thing about this game is that the % effort you put in will be the % you get back, its not just a case of hitting the right parameters, game won, yay, bored now. You can take time and look at building efficient time tables and interconnecting routes to gain better returns, or just slap in some basic routes with simple tables but not gain the same return.

Very realistic and replayable game that requires you to problem solve. Highly recommended.

review: Надо было очень долго стараться, чтобы получилась настолько депрессивная безжизненная атмосфера. И управление такое, чтобы с первых же минут возненавидеть разработчиков. Минусовое удобство и эстетика. А цветовая гамма заслуживает приза "безнадёжность тысячелетия". Но зато у них есть стимовские ачивки. Которые никак не перевешивают всего остального убожества этой поделки. Этот градостроительный симулятор кого угодно излечит от невыносимой лёгкости бытия.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139422867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1540013769}
review:
這個模擬經營遊戲十分的有趣，
但是對於不懂得英文的新手來說一大堆的英文或許有些難以上手。
然後再說說遊戲裡面的~不能從甲車庫調度車輛到乙車庫，或者是直接雙向發車這點設定有時候真的讓人抓狂！~
遊戲所給出需要購買的DLC對於增加遊戲的可玩性有一定的幫助。
此遊戲原價購入的話就算了吧~等大打折扣連同DLC一起購入或許會更加好一點。

author: {'steamid': '76561198087267326', 'num_games_owned': 3887, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1490706953}
review:
Paradox und Colossal Order haben es hier geschafft, zu einem genialen Spiel einen richtig miesen Nachfolger zu schaffen.
Ich habe jetzt ein wenig angespielt, und direkt festgestellt, dass die Hauptmeinung des Internets ziemlich Recht hat.

Hier einige meiner Punkte, warum CiM 1 besser als CiM 2 ist:

- Geschichte. Im ersten Teil konnte man ein Spiel in einem beliebigen Jahr starten, 1920, 1975, 2000 oder auch 2020,
  ganz wie man wollte. Dabei fuhren dann auch zu dem jeweiligen Jahr passende NPC-Fahrzeuge herum, und auch die
  Busse, Strassenbahnen etc., welche zu kaufen waren,  wechselten. All dies fällt im 2.Teil weg.

-  Fahrzeugauswahl. Während es in CiM 1 noch standardmässig pro "Zeitalter" vier Fahrzeuge gab, gibt es im 2. Teil nur 
   noch INSGESAMT drei (von jeder Fahrzeuggruppe) im Hauptspiel ohne DLCs.

-  Grafik. CiM 1 sah vieeeeeeel besser aus.

-  Umständlich. Im 1. Teil war das Verlegen von Strassenbahnschienen und vorallem -oberleitungen deutlich einfacher.
   Während es dort noch möglich war, komplette Trassen auf einmal zu verlegen, kann man in CiM 2 immer nur das  
   Stück bis zur nächsten Kreuzung verlegen.
   Und ausserdem (a.) MUSS eine Linie jetzt in einem Depot anfangen und
   aufhören, und (b.) haben diese Depots nur an EINER SEITE einen Ein- und Ausgang. So ist es nicht möglich, ein Depot
   von zwei Seiten anzufahren, was bei vielen Linien durchaus nervt. (Mal abgesehen davon, dass in echt auch nicht alle 
   Linien eines Stadtteils gegen Ende die gleichen Haltestellen bis zum Depot haben :D)
   So ist auch das Festlegen von Schiffsrouten sehr fummelig. Schiffe fahren nicht automatisch um Kurven, sondern
   benötigen in die Linien eingebaute Zwischenpunkte. Unnötig? Unnötig!
   Ähnlich läuft es auch bei U-Bahnen und O-Bussen.

-  Unübersichtlich. Überall kaum beschriftete und unbetitelte Fenster mit Tabellen und Daten, welche übereinander¨
   geöffnet sind. Der Vorgänger konnte das noch besser.

-  Strassenbau. An sich ja nichts Schlechtes, dass man jetzt eigene Strassen und Brücken bauen kann. Aber ist es 
   realistisch, dass ein Nahverkehrsunternehmen eigene Strassen baut? Ausserdem funktioniert das auch nicht richtig, 
   neue Brücken oder Strassen werden oft nicht genutzt. 

-  Hubschrauber? Gab es in CiM 1. In CiM 2? Nope. 

-  Ereignisse. Im 1. Teil gab es animierte Brände mit Feuerwehr und Staus, ebenso Verkehrsunfälle, was alles unsere
   Linienfahrzeuge blockieren konnte. Jetzt gibt es zwar immer noch Einsatzfahrzeuge, die sich mit Blaulicht und Sirene
   den Weg freikämpfen (oder durch andere Fahrzeuge durchglitchen :D), in diesen sitzen allerdings normale Bürger,
   welche damit zur Arbeit oder nach Hause fahren.

-  Städte. Früher echte Städte in klein nachgebaut, heute nur einfallslos "Südstadt", "Oststadt" und ähnliches.

Und gegen Ende meiner etwas lang geraten Review noch die verbesserten Sachen:

-  Fahrpläne. Diese gab es im ersten Teil nicht. Die Fahrzeuge drehten einfach ihre Runden. Jetzt kann man Fahrpläne mit
   mit Zeitabständen und anderem festlegen, ebenso Zonen mit Ticketpreisen, damit nicht alle das gleiche Zahlen, ob sie  
   jetzt quer durch die Stadt oder nur eine Strassenecke fahren.


FAZIT:
Es gibt nichts, was lockt.
Wer ein sehr gutes Nahverkehrsmanagerspiel sucht, holt sich Cities in Motion, den ersten Teil.
Und wer Strassen bauen will, der holt sich Cities: Skylines. Das ist auch genial (und von den selben Entwicklern).

Das Spiel ist nicht SCHLECHT. Allerdings bot der Vorgänger deutlich mehr, war übersichtlicher und unkomplizierter,
und sah deutlich besser aus. __ Würde sagen...  maximal 3.25/10. Wenns hoch kommt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166196746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1507478000}
review:
Cities in Motion 2 makes me want to cry. I've been playing the original for years now and I love that game (though I'm still yet to turn a profit). This updated version fixes the previous one's flaws in realism by adding depots and timetables, however now Cities in Motion is just a screen full of menus and graphs. This game dissappoints me because it took the relaxing first edition and made it into a business simulator. It's too complicated for me, and I would reccommend the original to people over this one. It's a dissappointment as I love Paradox and Colossal Order's games and I was ready to love this one. It just wasn't meant to be.

Sadly a thumbs down from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063963524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3184, 'last_played': 1694642371}
review:
Note globale :  4.6  / 5

Graphismes :  4,7 / 5

Globalement, les graphismes sont bon. Les textures sont détaillées et réalistes. Les bâtiments réalistent, tout comme les nombreux véhicules. Il y a aussi beacoup de petits détails, ce qui ajoute encore plus de réalisme. Les feux sont heureusement fonctionnels.

Gameplay : 4.8 / 5

Point important pour un jeu, le gameplay doit être au point pour fournir un jeu de qualité. Le gameplay est bien réalisé, l' IA ( Intelligence Artificielle ) est correct, car même si il y a quelque défauts ( ex : embouteillage de tramways... ), elle est globalement réussie. On peut aussi créer des horaires pour nos lignes, qui n' existait pas dans le premier opus. Un autre ajout intéressant, c'est le fait de pouvoir construire des routes, et des chemins pédestres. La gestion des salaires des employés y est présente, point împortant pour la gestion globale. Il y a aussi des graphiques et des statistiques, afin d' encore mieux gérer notre companie. 

Prix, qualité sonore et outils : 4.2 / 5

Cities in Motion 2 vaut son prix, il n'est ni trop cher, ni pas assez. Les musiques ne sont malheureusement pas très nombreuses, c'est donc assez répétitif. Le jeu propose des outils, on peut donc créer des maps, des règles pour le jeu ( ex : réglages de la vitesse du jeu, de la capacité des véhicules... ) et des scénarios.

Conclusion :

Cities in Motion 2 ne coûte pas trop cher, a un bon gameplay et des bons graphismes. Assorcié à ça, il y a un bon nombre de véhicules, et tout ( ou presque ) les types de transport sont là. Du métro au bâteau, en passant par les trolleybus, les monorails ( /!\ Les monorails ne sont pas présents dans le jeu de base : DLC ), et j'en passe. Le seul défaut, qui n'en est pas un grand, se sont les musiques peu nombreuses et répétitives. Je vous le conseille vivement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206298512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 28176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23497, 'last_played': 1523044400}
review:
I don't know if I really like this game or not. Franklin speaking, I really enjoy this game when playing and building a city via the map editor. However, there're just way too many bugs (which CO doesn't admit)  and unrealistic settings that annoys me A LOT. Moreover, some features are not sold as DLCs (which means I can never perchase them), and some DLCs are too expansive to some extent.
I suggest that:
1. Do not buy it unless it's 75% off.
2. Use a ruleset that sets private car rate to 5% or less.
Noticed bugs:
1. Passengers transfer between lines infinitely.
2. For some maps students' unemployment rate is too high in the first hours. It then drops slowly.
Annoying settings:
1. Default cities are far too unrealistic.
2. Building an interchange is too difficult.
3. Cannot destruct part of a road.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000013964', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1465132227}
review:
和一代比起来，很多东西过于复杂了，玩起来很困难，会让你感觉是在真的规划城市交通而不是享受游戏的乐趣。赚钱也很困难，要时刻关注经济的各种变化，不停调整票价（而且有好几十项不同的票价设定），还有调整不同人员的工资（司机，检票，维修工）。还有发车时刻表，过于复杂，而且调整了时刻表还很难一下反映出变化来。

如果你喜欢这种模拟游戏，还是推荐一代作品，各方面平衡恰到好处（虽然还是有点点难度）。

author: {'steamid': '76561198087930943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2268, 'last_played': 1676642929}

review: Kupiłem, pograłem godzine, odinstalowałem. IMO dużo lepsza jest pierwsza część. Wiem, że takich gier nie powinno oceniać się po grafice ale chyba to ona mnie tak odepchnęła. Nieudolne 3D a do tego brak rozciągnięcia w czasie jak w częśći pierwszej.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100616588', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2157, 'last_played': 1522604888}
review:
This Game starts to get fun when you figure out how to play. For me, i took a couple of hours alongside some online research to figure out how to play.

The tough part in the begginning was figuring out how to connect roads, tram lines, trolley wires. However, turns out it was quite simple. Just click on the trolley line that is already built, & then click on the road ahead that you want to continue building the line.

I also had a tough time passing the first Campaign as they wanted 15% coverage, and even with my extensive coverage, i still was around 50% of that 15%. After many hours, I figured that building lines should be 2-Way(I built 1-way), which means that the line must go back and forth to the same stop area(just like a regular public transport train).

This game's tutorial could be improved too. I know that the developers are currently unlikely to change it right now, but the tutorial is very 'Wordy', which to many new players may not seem interesting. It lacks ineractivivity as well.

Other than these cons, this game still proves to be worthy city builder game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049427695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1434474114}
review:
I got this game for free, and I'm glad I didn't actually spend any money on it.

Dispite what the tags say, this isn't a city builder. Imagine making bus stops in Cities: Skylines, but the mechanics are broken. That's this game. That's the entire game.

The city is already completely built. You just place some transporation spots for things like subways and buses.

It's 2/3 the price of Cities: Skylines, and there's a lot more, and working, transporation features in C:S than in this, plus it's an actual city builder.

Do not get. Get the other mentioned game instead It's only $10 more and it has everything this game wants to have and much more.

At this point I had to give up and uninstall the game; if something so fundamental to the gameplay is so glitchy and broken then I'd hate to see everything else.

It does look really nice, though! If they ever fix the game I'd be down to give it another try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047752428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 6347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4730, 'last_played': 1572122426}
review:
Great game.

Do you like to build transportation networks?
Do you like to solve mass transit problems?

If your answer was yes to any of the questions above, you will love this game.

The traffic and pathfinding is far superior in Cities in Motion than the broken simulation we saw in Sim City 2013.

Some parts of the game can definitely improve, but it is still a worthy venture into the exciting adventure of being a transport tycoon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088465004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 25015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19667, 'last_played': 1522686372}
review:
As someone who enjoys strategy and building games such as Roller Coaster Tycoon, Locomotion, SimCity and so on I think that Cities in Motion 2 is a great game offering a wide versatility of construction options, vehicles that look great in any setting and comprehensive timetables to accommodate the schedules of the various categories of the cities population.

However there are a couple things missing that i feel are vital to any cities successful public transportation like the ability to put a platform on either side of the track or that there are no roads going to the edge of the map like if they were going to other cities. There for there are no trains or grand central stations or an airport where a large number of bus, tram and subway lines could meet like they do in real cities. 

But overall yes, I do recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216431604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1431877753}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050976478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 13021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5714, 'last_played': 1622305662}
review:
It's a bit on the repetitive side, plus there are some in-game issues such as stupid traffic and customers that become unhappy far too quickly, but if you can ignore that, then what you have is a very nice combination of city simulator and transport simulator. The route building tools are very good and easy to use, there's a wide choice of vehicles, the way the city responds to what you build is also a nice addition, and for good measure, there's a great map editor built into it. 

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198166023149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5084, 'last_played': 1705927779}

author: {'steamid': '76561198076720286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1434106794}
review:
"Cities in Motion 2" ist ein Spiel, dass sich bereits nach dem spielbaren Intro als reines Preview eines künftigen Titels der Reihe erweist.

Besonders aufgrund der gemessen am Vorgänger deutlich zu schwachen und nun für eine 3D-Auslegung mit 1st-Person nahen Perspektiven nicht mehr ausreichenden Steuerung, bleibt es im Spiel selber so bloß bei der Vor-Augen-Führung eines Großstadt-Modells der Superlative. Schade!

Dennoch erhält der Spieler einige Errungenschaften, welche dessen Eindrücke, die bei einer ersten näheren Begutachtung der Stadt entstehen, anscheinend jedoch genau in solchem Punkt bestätigen sollen und diesen so also versuchen zu ermutigen, womöglich dennoch geforderte Anstrengungen zur Verbindungs-Versorgung der Stadt zu übernehmen, bis man das Manko an der Steuerung - vielleicht einmal in einem Update, dann beseitigt hat.

Das Spiel richtet sich damit allerdings an Puristen, denen die bereits erhältlichen Nachfolger "Cities XXL" etc. noch fremd sind und die sich daher tatsächlich noch in der Hoffnung auf ein Update zum Spiel, weiterhin durch die neue Stadt und entlang zu entschlüsselnder Botschaften verbundener Errungenschaften trauen, auch widrigster Anzeichen zum Trotz!

Mich selber zähle ich dazu, also über das soeben erlebte, allerdings nicht und so muss ich von einer spielerischen Seite aus betrachtet, natürlich ein deutliches "Daumen runter" für den ansich doch so interessant begonnenen zweiten Teil der Cities in Motion Reihe vergeben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064710893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 14688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13271, 'last_played': 1704308766}
review:
J'aime bien le jeu. Il laisse place à la crativité de développer sa ville et de gérer le transport assez bien.

Quelues petits bémols, on ne sait pas dessiner correctement les rues (place une bende bus sur une voir centrale par exemple ou sur la voir de gauche, faire 2 bandes dans un sens et 1 dans l'autre, etc) et le jeu ralenti su la ville grossit. Globalement, je suis très satisfait et j'y passe des heures malgré les quelques bémols :)

Je n'ai aucun regrêt en rapport au jeu. Et surtout, je suis très content qu'il soit comme il est :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198003631784', 'num_games_owned': 1275, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1494501766}
review:
Un peu innovant mais rien de bien folichon.

Personnellement je me suis très vite ennuyer et l'interface est un peu complexe, rien n'est instinctifs faire la moindre ligne c'est une mission. Le jeu est beaucoup trop touffu sans raison valable.

Le jeu est truffés de bugs des saves qui ne fonctionnent plus des textures qui se font la mal.

Sans oublié qu'il n'y a de vrai version française. On a à la place une espèce des patchs amateurs immondes ou la moitié des textes sont remplacer par leur ligne de code et un quart n'est pas traduit. Globalement j'ai pas de problème avec l'anglais mais là on est sur du langage trop specific malheuresement. 

J'ai pas grand chose à dire de plus mais même pour un fan de jeu de gestion ce jeu n'est pas vraiment recommandable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083450327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1474203884}
review:
This isn't a city builder game. You can expand your city but other than that it is just about creating tram/bus/boat lines. It is fun if you have nothing else to do. This game has nice maps, atmosphere and it is very interesting and good looking. 
Cities: Skylines... now that is something to check out if you are into city builder games, it is made by the same developers. 

Hehe... the people in my city don't like that everything (tram lines etc) is a mess. Everything is all over the place. By hearing that I know I am doing something right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101171932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 8188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7186, 'last_played': 1489491539}
review: Completely unlike what feedback I've garnered from Cities: Skylines so far, this "urban transport planning simulator" is a TOTAL JOKE. No mod support. No logical vehicle progression. Extremely processor-intensive and inconsistent traffic simulation. WAY too many DLCs. No left-hand drive support (it's more important than you think). Hilariously game-breaking dynamic urbanisation mechanic. Extremely little map content. Pointless, inflexible "campaign" mode. Metric tons of micromanagement. More eye-pleasing cities? NEIN. And most importantly, an extremely user-hostile network construction method. No thanks to my OCD, I usually spend over 12 hours just to plan ONE perfect metro line. The lack of assistance to deal with the gridless game engine is really taxing on my rigid SC4-style urban planning skills. To be honest, I wish Colossal Order had instead tried to emulate the gameplay of the original CIM as much as possible, as well as implementing actual multiplayer support that supports third-world internet connections and properly-synchronised gameplay for once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087577235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1387842436}

author: {'steamid': '76561198055313876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5901, 'last_played': 1520174917}
review: When it was published I already have played the classic CIM for a long time and thought that it probably would be as good as the old one (or better) and so I didn't wait and bought the game. However it wasn't that what I expected: It's nice that there are vehicles carrying more passengers and a better track building. But the game design isn't the best one, since it isn't as "realistic" as the design of the classic CIM. Moreover you have to build your transport networks in "futuristic american" cities which aren't  really cities (but Tutorial City :D). I hoped that you could build in NYC or Wahington, but those cities aren't in the game. It would also have been nice to be able to play scenarios in europe cities, but for it you have to buy a ectension pack which costs some money :(.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991350396', 'num_games_owned': 7652, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 8191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4350, 'last_played': 1430054248}
review:
I enjoyed the first Cities in Motion and completed 100% of the achievements and campaigns.   CIM2 retains some of the themes but rearchitects the engine and simulation.  I eagerly picked it up, played through a little bit, enjoyed what I saw but found some of the controls difficult and frustrating, so it languished for awhile. 

Then I started reading all of the excitement about Cities: Skylines in its prerelease phase, saw the simularities in the look and feel of C:S, and thought I'd take another look.  Applying myself a little more, I found I was able to overcome some (but not all) of the frustration with the user interface of CIM2 and in belated retrospect, it is a very enjoyable simulation.  

I'm planning to finish the campaign (and in a sale, maybe pick up some DLC) before moving on to Cities:Skylines, which I fully expect to build and expand on the CIM2 experience.

review:
I love hate this game.
I want to have fun with it. 
But it's SO complicated.
My view is if I ever take the time to really learn the game, I'll enjoy it immensely.
But I haven't been patient enough yet. 
SO I guess recommend if you are patient enough to learn the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984658225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1645199624}
review:
Nachdem ich Cities in Motion ausgiebig gespielt habe, dachte ich der zweite Teil wäre auch interessant.

Leider ist außer dem Transport von Personen nichts wirklich gleich.
CIM 2 hat einen Tag/Nacht Wechsel, einen detalierte Fahrplanausarbeitung, Linien enden und starten nun in Depots, diese wiederrum haben unterschiedliche Größen bzw. mehr Fahrzeugwartungsplätze, weiterhin können sich mehrere Linien ein Depot teilen.
Die Städte sehen alle gleich aus und haben nicht die Unterschiede aus Teil 1, was wirklich schade ist.
Außerdem ist meiner Meinung nach der U-Bahnbau sehr nervtötend im Gegensatz zu CiM 1.

Meiner Meinung nach hätte man die Ideen aus CIM 1 weiterverfolgen sollen, Teil 1 hat mir bedeutend mehr Spaß gemacht. Aber das ist nur meine Meinung, es wird eine Menge Spieler geben die die Neuerungen von Teil 2 sehr gut finden und somit auch das Spiel.

Schade das es kein Mittelwert zwischen Daumen hoch und Daumen runter gibt.
Trotzdem werde ich positiv bewerten, da es an sich ein gutes Spiel ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989426478', 'num_games_owned': 525, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1426888782}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970532603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 6268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6234, 'last_played': 1405298349}
review:
If you like Cities: Skylines, this game might be of interest to you. Take away the majority of the city building and add in significantly more public transit management and you get CiM2. Dealing with rush hour, different demographics, balancing your fleet of vehicles. It's interesting.

Though if you haven't played Skylines, go for that instead. It's probably more what you're looking for.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970720922', 'num_games_owned': 781, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1425949159}
review:
This is a pretty game, a detailed game, and a game with some interesting and simple innovations like an amazing wealth of charts and graphs that you can really dig into to understand the city you're planning.   Unfortunately, there are enough little quirks that made it difficult enough for me to play that I have to give it the thumbs down.

I didn't want to... I WANTED to build cool bus and trolley routes, but half the time my depots just wouldn't connect to the street they were right next to no matter how much I zoomed in and shifted roads around.  I would like to say that building ferries made my city magically accessible, but it was dang hard to find a place where a pier would actually fit, much less a ferry depot, whatever that was called, and the silly ferry drivers couldn't manage to find their own way around a peninusla without a few straight line waypoints.  People digging tunnels for the metro, on the other hand, were somewhat troubled by both straight lines and curves that were too tight... also, it's not clear to me how you can have underground metro stations but a metro line that can't cross under streets.  Or was it just some streets?

I dislike writing negative reviews -- I'd give this a middling score if there were options between yes and no -- but I think this game could be made much better with some simple tweaks -- if I want to bulldoze a station, it's OK if I scrap a few vehicles in the mix; or just pop up a window asking me to sell or move them.  Recommend some nice paths for overlapping lines that actually work, or give some tutorials that explain when and how a trolley line and a metro line can cross, because I really just couldn't figure out why some of my intersections were disallowed.

Oh well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073483785', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6289, 'last_played': 1556440911}
review:
[h1]:([/h1]
Dit spel had zo veel potentie. Cities in Motion 1 was een prachtig spel maar miste een paar belangrijke basis functies zoals dienstregelingen en goed functionerende overstappen. Maar helaas. 
We zijn nu een jaar of twee verder en beloftes zijn niet nagekomen van de ontwikkelaars. [b]Er is GEEN support voor mods[/b]. Waarom?!!!! Dit spel had zoooooooo veel meer waarde kunnen hebben met support voor goede modding. Maar ze bleven zelf maar DLC's uitbrengen. En na 109+ uur aan speeltijd is dit spel nu niet meer vernieuwend. Telkens maar met dezelfde bussen, trams, en metro's op de zelfde wegen naar de zelfde gebouwen kijken. Zo jammer. Ik geef ze nog 1 kans in cities skylines. Maar ik hou mn hart vast.

Conclusie: Het is het waard als dit spel in de steam sale zit. Is wel een leuk spel om wat tijd te doden. Maar ga er alsjeblieft geen €20 euro voor neer leggen en dan ook nog de dlc's kopen. Jammer is het gewoon :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198085252661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1667, 'last_played': 1425525478}
review:
This game takes a while to get into.  It looks simple, but there's some surprising depth to it.

I've found myself staring at a traffic jam, with cars piled up in one lane battling to merge at the last minute, thinking:  "Why don't they use the lanes available?!"  Then I realized something:  Traffic engineers think the same way about us.  I was pleasantly surprised to find that I could build my own custom graded intersections to positive benefit.

The bad part of the game is the missions.  You get missions where someone asks you to connect a building to your transit network.  If they're already covered it doesn't count, but if you just remove a stop and add it back in it counts that:  That's not fun, and it doesn't make sense.  And it'll give you missions such as "expand the size of the city."  These are alright, but they take too long.  Way too long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071438379', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1346, 'last_played': 1454281356}
review:
Very interesting and good-looking game. You will create your own transport company. Very flexible line creation system. Various social groups prefer different types of transport. All people have where to live and where to work.
Expert mode could be very challenging. 
Map editor is another very interesting part of game. You could create your own city and share it in workshop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165781327', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2555, 'last_played': 1537848902}
review:
This is a very interesting game that puts the player in charge of all mass transit within a city. The HUD takes a little getting used to, but once that is understood, the gameplay is great. While balancing your budget, you have a main task that you are trying to achieve. Overall, once you have been playing around for a little bit, everything seems to fall into place, making this an enjoyable game. 
I do not like the fact that players are forced to BUY DLC, much like other games, that could break the bank if you are not careful. Why can developers not release a full game all at once like they used to, but instead milk the customers now for a few extra bucks for a couple, small extra features, one or two at a time?

author: {'steamid': '76561197993837389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1424895240}
review: A game built around traffic and transporation where the traffic lights don't work and four lane roads get clogged because cars can't change lanes. A lot of the design and interface decisions in this game make no sense. I had some fun with Cities In Motion 1, which has also has some problems, but this sequel sucked the character out and replaced it with nothing interesting. It's simultaneously unchallenging and frustrating. Not worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061518047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 978, 'last_played': 1546168753}
review:
I have played Cities in Motion 1 and 2, but I miss just the atmosphere in the game if I compare it to Cities in Motion 1.

The graphics of CiM1 I find more atmosphere than CiM2. The standard cities are just buildings with some roads around it, in CiM1 there's just more decoration options (trees, mailboxes, newsstands, etc.).

What a pity that CiM2 not to modding. In CiM1 you had there a enough sites where you could get good mods, like the ScheweBahn mod.

There are some good things to report, the timetable is very convenient, because in CiM1 it is not easy to get a good frequency. The day/night cycle is a nice addition.
