author: {'steamid': '76561198038795239', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 5991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4855, 'last_played': 1454570651}
review:
I enjoyed it quite a bit.  So I guess that's the ultimate standard for a review.

But I'd also be doing you a disservice if I didn't also say I was extremely disappointed with the bugs and lack of polish.  It can become infuriating at times.  If you plan on playing the coop mode, just forget it.  It is so broken I dare say it doesn't work at all.   Frequent network disconnects, and a broken save system makes it too easy to corrupt and be unable to reconnect with your partner.

The interface is really bad in general.  And some vital flaws with the campaign makes it lose its challenge.  Like being able to make your city just barely profitable, then leave your computer running over night one the fastest time factor and coming back to be ridiculously rich.   A simple solution here would have been putting time limits on missions, or making people become more and more upset with lack of public transportation over time, or anything really.  It just makes the rest of your efforts seem worthless.   I ended up enjoying the game more by self imposing time limits on myself. 

If you can overcome all that, the game has a lot of enjoyable moments.

Oh, and you probably need a decent computer to run this game well without weird stuttering when panning the camera around on high settings.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985020273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1374176116}
review: The simplistic UX of the first CiM has been transformed into a sluggish experience thanks to the unmatured engine and gameplay mechanics. I bought this game just at release, and, after a few hours I left it for good. I tried it a few months after release, and still, not many changes were done for the better. If you want to play a transport sim, just buy CiM 1 (it's still the best there is, though it doesn't have multiplayer).

author: {'steamid': '76561198022336947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1540054259}
review: Das Spiel ist verglichen mit dem 1. Teil der Reihe einfach lieblos gestaltet worden! Wo bleiben die schönen europäischen Altbauten, die engen Straßen etc. ? Das Spiel wirkt komplett grau, der Multiplayer buggt und die Städte sind lieblose HOCHHÄUSER-Bauten wie in amerikanischen Großstädten à la New York! An die europäischen Spieler wurde bei diesem Spiel wohl kaum gedacht. Man könnte das Spiel auch: Cities in Motion 2 (New York Edition) nennen, dann würde es passen! Sie hätten definitiv beim Stil des 1. Teils bleiben sollen! Leider ein richtiges, liebloses  FAIL-Spiel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198078192360', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1618756702}
review: Игра для любителей Transport Tycoon и других экономических стратегий. Только здесь упор на пассажирские перевозки. После обучалки легко вылететь в трубу. Но потом игра захватывает, хочется построить больше линий, покрыть весь город, получить все субсидии, а в это время город растет, пассажиры не влазят в прежние автобусы, нужно строить депо размером побольше, трамваи покупать поновее, вместо столбов с табличкой "остановка" ставить остановки с навесом и скамейкой, пассажиры жалуются на долгое ожидание транспорта, водители троллейбусов и контроллеры просят повышения... С этим всем вы столкнетесь, если решитесь поиграть в Cities in Motion 2 :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198049611878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1527397886}
review:
Finally I can make the transit network that I always wanted. As a child I wanted to be a bus driver. My grandfather was a bus driver and I looked up to him. I wanted to be just like him. But one day, my family was taking the bus home. It was being driven by none other than my grandfather. Suddenly, one the wheels bursted into flames. We crashed into an orphanage. Everyone died, including the orphans. I vowed to never to enter a bus again. But now with Cities in Motion 2 I don't have to.
-Train Conductor Bruce Willis

review: The UI is not user friendly at all. After spending half an hour in the tutorial which failed to work I was able to start a campaign only to be disappointed by the lacking UI and ability to make the transit systems work correctly. Even on guided quests the game would path incorrectly making it nearly impossible to finish quests. Overall I would probably play it again to try to fight with the game but I would not tell others to spend money on this.

review: This game has one of the worst tutorials I've ever come across. It leaves the majority of the game completely unexplained, and the parts that it does cover are barely touched upon. This is basic stuff.

review:
Before played this game I only played the OpenTTD game, which is a similliar type of game, and I loved the game as well the type of mind needed to build routes and manage the traffic and beyond.
Then, Cities in Motion 2, appeared in my account and, in the first game I became in love with the game. The jump from OpenTTD to CIN2, in my opinion, was a beatiful jump. CIN2 if, for me, one of the best simulators I played in my live! I would recomend to everyone who likes city simulators to play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037822218', 'num_games_owned': 970, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1387738308}
review: Ever want to build your own transportation system though cities? Well here's your chance! It's a rather interesting game that's more intricate than it first appears and it can actually give a decent challenge if you're not expecting too much. All in all it's a game that's good for people who can plan things out and are good at micromanaging, otherwise this game isn't for you. It's still entertaining enough that you don't realize how much time is passing and it actually has some amusing story lines.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989570764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 3014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3013, 'last_played': 1417830391}
review:
There are pros to the game: The potential for an awesome city-transport simulator is there. It is quite detailed in this respect.

However, the gameplay is severely lacking. Construction can be an expensive endeavour that will leave you frustrated and wishing you'd saved. You could easily blow 50% of your (easily obtained) budget because you built something different than what you wanted. And there's no undo button, so the easiest is usually just to reload if you make a mistake during construction. This is worse if you accidentally delete something critical in the infrastructure and essentially have to start over.

Transport Tycoon had more variety in transportation in one form alone, but this game requires you to buy DLC to get variety (seriously Paradox, stop it with the DLC).

The campaign missions are bland. The maps are different, but the goals are essentially the same. Establish coverage. Build a number of good lines (reputation is pointless, just build something that will cover as much as possible), wait until you have more money or take out a loan, and build more lines. You don't have to think about where people are going. You just need to cover everything until you reach your goal, then move on to the next coverage mission. Growing cities is just a matter of waiting until you have enough money.

Metros in this game are of the Danish variety - no one knows how to build them underground, so the most effective ends up being floating them 8-12m above the city streets. Even if you did build it underground (which is possible) you can't build stations underground, so again, just build them floating.

For these reasons, I would not recommend this game, although it is a fun little game. I certainly wouldn't pay more than 2-3 euroes for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029463783', 'num_games_owned': 572, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1577, 'last_played': 1580503776}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986299587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1386871674}
review:
Cities in Motion 2 (or just CIM2) is one of the most boring games ever created. The pretending mayor - or better, city engineer - position the player is put into is manager through a series of complex menus, which are very counter-intuitive. From there the player has to build the structures to make the city work.

The point is that the city is already an existing city, with citizens that go to work and home, but without any of the infrastructures that you'll have to build. How the heck did those people manage to get around then? 

This is the downside of this game: there is no story in it, no reason d'être for the city to exist.

I don't recommend this game. If it weren't for the steam trading cards I wouldn't have spent so much time with it. Once the 4 cards were dropped the game was uninstalled at once.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990973978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1794, 'last_played': 1486540235}
review:
This game is fun.

However, recently changed my rating from positive to negative because:
While at its core this is a great game that is quite fun; once you sink in some time and become familiar, you realize there is extremely limited content for this game, and a ton of paid DLC!!!!

I HATE PAID DLC!!! Especially when the content in said DLC's is overpriced, and should have been included for free into the original.

I will still continue to play, as it is fun. But I will call out this greedy business model, that pisses me off greatly. There is no excuse, the original release is appallingly limited on vehicles and content; there is no way we should have to pay more to get "extra" stuff that should have been there to begin with.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995138062', 'num_games_owned': 2637, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 6238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3559, 'last_played': 1655241218}
review:
This game is great fun to play alone and even more fun to play with a friend in coop mode. But: The game is very limited in its options and gets boring and repetitive very soon. Also lots of sync-bugs prevent you from playing the multiplayer properly. I really enjoyed the coop mode, but you always only have a very limited time to play before the game totally craps you up.

WARNING: If you play this game in multiplayer over a longer period of time, you'll always get out of sync without any chance to get back. Your coop-partner may build lines but you don't see them and also other important data (like the time of the day, your money, your company value and your weekly income) is totally off for you and your partner. Saving and loading the game again does NOT help to fix this! (Edit: Turns out you can manually end the game, let the host send you the savefile and then load it again to enjoy another few minutes of synced multiplayer gaming until it gets out of sync again. It's still very annoying though, you kinda have to spend half your playing time to manually keep the game synced...)

Do I recommend this game? If this was a beta version: Totally yes! Unfortunatelly the options and variety of this game are very limited and it's totally bugged (at least the multiplayer) and there is very little chance that there are any updates still being made to this game, so it's not really worth its price.

All in all: Great concept, great ideas, bad implementation.
Stay away from this game and eventually hope for a sequel to make a better implementation of this great game concept.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034338714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1387127726}
review: This game isn't really what it was made out to be in my opinion. I had hoped to construct the roading on empty land and then stuff would come along as you added traffic stuff. This however doesn't seem to be the case, as all of the options seemed to be to add stuff to existing towns. Compared to a certain other city builder, which i'd rather play and seems more easy to figure out, I'd say this was a bad buy on my end and I wouldn't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003659833', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 9023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3392, 'last_played': 1697536603}
review: I didn't like this at first, but a year or so after buying it, I kept trying to get into it, I guess the adjustment from the original is so vast. But you know what? I LOVE IT, i have changed my opinion completely, I absolutely love this game now, more than the first! And that's from someone whom hated it. Timetables were my biggest game breaker, but I love them now, the game's realism is sublime, and animations and level of customization. 10/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561197988591203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1387044620}
review:
Trying to place a road or train track in this game is akin to being forced to solve graduate level calculus.

But it's not because the process itself is overly complicated - it's just that when you try placing a road, on the off-chance you actually find a spot the game will let you place one, the road usually isn't anywhere near where you want it to go. My trams were taking forever, and the tram customers were terribly unhappy, all because I had to route it the long way around a few intersections that were inexplicably blocked from tram tracks for no apparent reason.

Another time, after I'd finally managed to sort out the bus route and the tram route, I tried to create a metro. I tried placing train tracks over a road, thinking it would make an overpass, or at the very least tell me I couldn't do that - instead, it simply demolished my road, stopping my tram and bus routes in the process. I quit playing when I couldn't find any way to undo that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042465972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1387043457}
review: Absolute load of Crap. If you're into Sims City, then alright. But if you're not, then don't buy this game for yourself. Or Others, if they ask you to get it, just save them the sadness and don't buy them it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003030886', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1499456375}
review:
Раньше никогда не играл в симуляторы городов. CiM 2 же подкупила тем, что самому постоянно приходится ездить на общественном транспорте - и хотелось понять, каково это, видеть весь процесс снаружи. Многие вещи интуитивно понятны, многое стало открытием - раньше не сталкивался с делением города на зоны. 

Интерфейс не самый дружелюбный, временами бывают глупые ситуации, когда на въезде к депо встаёт десяток автобусов и получается здоровенная пробка. С другой стороны это сигнал о том, что даже выгодный маршрут спроектирован не совсем верно и надо оценивать и рассчитывать всё по новому.

Для себя в игре вижу бесконечные возможности по поиску оптимальных решений в хаосе: сначала ты строишь всё от балды, затем убираешь всё то, что плохо работает, затем оптимизируешь работающие решения и делаешь новые. Плюс контролируешь финансовые потоки: увеличиваешь доходы контролёрами и ценами на билеты, а расходы оптимизируешь новыми маршрутами.

Если вы такой же любитель, как и я, постоянно делать, оценивать и переделывать - вэлком :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198063782169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 20800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17782, 'last_played': 1609938028}
review: Jedna z nejlepších her co jsem kdy měl možnost hrát! Ti kteří si už zkusili CIM 1 rychle pochopí co se po nich vlastně chce a budou se rychle orientovat co se jak dělá. V 2.díle přibylo mnoho úžasných věcí které přidávají na realističnosti a taky je potřeba zmínit přepracování enginu a grafiky, což působí ve hře úchvatně! I když ale 2jka disponuje většími mapami, možností tvořit jízdní řády a podle nich vypravovat vozidla s patřičnou kapacitou stále mi připadá první díl jako ten lepší. Moje hodnocení: 10/10.

review: From the little I have gotten into the game I find it somewhat amusing. One pitfall is the very steep learning curve associated with the campaign, so sandbox is my starting recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023927911', 'num_games_owned': 2732, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1549094214}
review: Die Grafik ist sehr detailiert, und durch die freie Kameraführung kann man sich die Stadt aus jeder Perspektive ansehen. Der Tag/Nacht-Zyklus ist etwas störend, da man Nachts kaum etwas erkennen kann. Der Bau von Straßen und U-Bahnen ist teilweise sehr kompliziert, und durch den unebenen Untergrund werden ständig Brücken und Tunnel erstllt, was man leider nicht beeinflussen kann. Bei der Fahrplangestaltung kann man allerdings Stunden zubringen, und alles bis ins kleinste Detail anpassen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047210200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1405010553}
review:
I loved Transport Tycoon Deluxe, I still do and I still play it, so I was really thrilled to play CIM 2 too, as I was told it's similar in many aspects with TTD. High expectations, higher disillusion. I'm trying to have fun playing it but so far, to no avail. CIM 2 feels soulless, unchallenging, plain dull. 

It feels simplistic where it should've been complex (for example, only passengers can be transported, no mail, goods or other products/resources), and it feels overcomplex and too intricate where it should be simpler (the distribution of bus stations, for example). 

Well, at least it comes with trading cards and rather easy to obtain achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063883568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1386939000}
review:
Tu vois un jeu de gestion? Ben tu vire tout ce qui est cool et tu le remplace par une interface illisible, un gameplay sortie de l'imagination d'un prof de comptabilité de toute évidence faché avec le français car on peut jouer en anglais en polonais en allemand ou en italien pour que le français moyen aille se faire foutre, devoir prendre trois plombes rien que pour configurer les touches afin que ça soit "jouable", tout ça pour que au final un groupe de féministe te file 3000$ pour construire une ligne de métro entre trois point de la ville qui sont suffisamment proche les uns des autres pour pouvoir y aller à pied en moins de 5 minutes. Enfin, ce jeu nous prouve qu'un PNJ peut être féministe ET une grosse feignasse. Tout ça pour dire, si tu veux jouer à ce jeu, appelle tes potes et faites vous une partie de Risk.
Heureusement que ce jeu m'a été offert à contre-coup par un humble-bundle, j'aurai au moins donné 5$ à un pauvre développeur de vaccin contre le cancer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024970573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1386808520}
review:
Maybe this is a case of mismatched expectations, but Cities in Motion 2 was really, really lame. The concept seems like it would be a decent Sim City-lite, but it's really just a... transit simulator...? Seriously? There is a cumbersome map editor which generates terrain at a snail's pace. Apparently you have to use it to start a city from scratch, or at least I couldn't find another way. 

And for a game that is focused mainly on transit, it's pretty ridiculous how poorly designed elements of rails and trams are. The way rails connect through intersections and turn corners is so hit and miss that you can only hope the game will cooperate. Stops give you vague information about not being connected to previous stops, but logic shows they ARE - etc etc - just a weird, empty game. Installed with some hope, uninstalled 1.5hrs later.

review:
CIM 2 is a very good game, and I recommend it to all people who love Transport Systems, Urban and Regional Planning of a city and even those people who want a strategic game.

The game works well on low performance computers if turned to low settings running on smaller maps.

All in all a good and enjoyable game. Can't stop playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082235627', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1382732106}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040401422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 973, 'last_played': 1394592933}
review:
Takes one of the best parts of city-builders (transportation construction and management) and drills down into the finest of details.  Spend surprisingly satisfying hours tweaking bus or train schedules to make the best transit system.

Steam Workshop support allows rules to be modified to suit your play style.  If you liked Simcity 4 Rish Hour expansion, you'll love this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038949937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1472, 'last_played': 1446178612}
review:
I want to come out an make a review for this product. There are very few games created like this because it is a very niche market of video games. This game is great for those who like Transport Tycoon, Locomotion, OpenTTD, and similar games. What I like about this game is that it is very in depth with owning and running a transit system. Being in depth it is very complicated and takes a very long time to play. If you want a simpler and less time consuming transit game, go with the first Cities in Motion, but if you are up to a challenge get this one. I love these kinds of games and will buy them up, I enjoy this game and hope improve on the time consumption part of the game, but it is still a fun game.

The hours on record is a little misleading because I had to leave my game open a lot to make a decent amount of money to expand my transit system (What I was saying about time consuming)

author: {'steamid': '76561198061315577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1416796069}
review: Cities in Motion 2 é uma porcaria. A Steam não se reponsabiliza pelo suporte e a produtora do game é muito burocrática. Se você estiver interessado neste game, compre para windows no Mac OS X Maverics não passa de tela de apresentação e depois fica tudo preto. Um pena!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019745869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1527069689}
review: Игра не для каждого. В ней сначало придется разобраться. Как Устроить свою империю по общественному транспорту. Сначала вы начинаете с малого. Вам будет дан внушительный своими размерами город и полная свобода действий. Вам придется решать, как будет расположен путь вашего транспорта, искать пути, чтобы ваша техника ходила без пробок. Вы можете рискнуть и попытаться получить сразу все или потерять то, что у вас есть. Играйте только в лучшее. Советую каждому любителю симуляторов. Поиграйте в нее.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197994028265', 'num_games_owned': 831, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1386381188}
review: I recently picked this game up and was really impressed by the great ability to manage every aspect of a public transportation system. This game does exactly what it says on the box, and does it well. If you enjoy micromanagement and a structured sandbox-style build game, you'll like Cities in Motion 2. If that doesn't appeal to you, though, don't buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966597020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1385945876}
review:
This review is based on my time with this games Multiplayer part, and from playing with a friend.

The first hour of the game was exciting, me and my friend having a good time figuring out the basics of the game.
But then it started, the crashes.. and graphical bugs starting to crawl out of the woodwork, making me unable to enjoy the game at all.

Having 4-5 game crashes and graphical glitches on both the UI and gameworld during my first 1-2 hours of my time playing this game is not acceptable. When other games work perfectly fine, ruling out any issues at my end.

I wish I could recommend the game, cause I really liked the concept, but the crashes and UI bugs made me lose interest in this game far too early.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031944757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1398020640}
review:
Relativt kul spel även om det inte når upp till det smått legendariska Transport tycoon. Är dock lite svårkontrollerat, GUI't hade mått bra av ett lyft med lite lättinställda vyer, möjlighet att se i 2D ovanifrån med färgkodade zore+stats osv.
Dessutom är det ibland mkt svårt att koppla ihop rutter- speciellt Metro, och bygger man fel så finns ingen undo utan de pengarna är kastade i sjön, och eftersom det är mkt lätt att se fel eftersom det bitvis är plottrigt så kan det sabba en hel omgång :/
Men som transportsimultaor ändå ganska ok, framförallt karteditorn lyfter spelet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033530482', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1940, 'last_played': 1616360659}
review:
Do you want a game to burn some time? Do you want a game where the point is to ship people from point A to B and back? Do you want a unmoddable, unexpandable(as of now 12/1/13, there are no known expansions other than the monorail.), and generally generic game? 

Well, here you go, a city transport game in full 3D with a handful of vehicles to haul people and NO goods or other transport-worthy stuff. However since this game is a people transport game I suppose I can ignore that fact. However I cannot ignore the fact that after you plop the stations and watch the buses go... there is nothing else to do... I have played OTTD (Open Transport Tycoon Deluxe) and I can be on it for hours, mainly due to the fact you have TRAINS. In CiM2 I play with some metros which oversimplify the game generally. Also, you'd have to pay at least $5 more to get a decent amount of trains or verierity, since the regular game has just 2. 

This puts me into the main problem of the game, the game lacks a worthwhile amount of content. You get about 11 vehicles in total (14 or so if you preordered like me) and probably 150 props and buildings. Thats it. The devs are working to cram more vehicles, but only if you pay $5 for 5 vehicles. It is unknown if the devs want to make a building pack as well.

Something I can give it credit is its road system, it has a really  flexible road system which includes from roads, expressways, and one way roads

Graphics:
Odd, the graphics/color sceme might not be for everyone, I had mod it in order to suit my tastes. Modeling and texturing are fair but not world-class.

6/10

Content:
As I said before, there isn't much beyond the 150 buildings and props, and the handful of 11 vehicles in the regular version, the DLC adds some  20 more but the cost of that alone can buy the game probably twice.

4/10

Gameplay:
Gameplay is well, like it is, you place a line from point A to B, and hope to make as many stops as possible to make more money. It generally thereafter is just making sure you have sufficient vehicles and depots to store them. Making grids with the roads is a hazzard, since the roads don't snap with each other in order to make crossings, thus resulting in you making grids road by road until you have a grid. After all is done and said, there is pretty much nothing else to do.

5/10


Rating:

5/10
 

My Final Opinion:

Don't buy this at full price, or better yet, buy CiM1, you'd have more fun than this dead end game. Maybe if you wait a year or two maybe the game gets better. Right now, its not worth the $20 (+ $27 DLC).

review: 전작에 비해서 아주 좋아진 대중교통 시뮬레이션 게임. 시간이 상당히 세분화되었고 노선짤때 경유지도 지정해 줄 수 있으며 배차 시간표도 정해줄 수 있다.  DLC가 없으면 기본 차량이 별로 없어서 좀 빡빡하지만 솔직히 하다보면 주로 쓰는 차량은 항상 정해져 있는것 같다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974082578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2057, 'last_played': 1590247344}
review:
Excellent jeu de gestion, c'est, à mon sens, ce qui se rapproche le plus d'un city builder sans l'etre vraiment. Vous démarrez dans une ville, et vous aurez des objectifs à accomplir (objectif principal en mode campagne, mais objectifs secondaires en campagne et en mode libre).

L'interface de gestion est assez simple une fois qu'on a pris le coup, les graphismes sont assez beaux, pas trop de bugs. La difficulté est assez élevée au début, mais s'atténue vite une fois qu'on comprend comment optimiser ses transports, et il devient assez facile par la suite. Avec les objectifs secondaires, une partie sur la meme ville ne ressemble pas à une autre, et on a une bonne rejouabilité.

On regrettera toutefois la politique commerciale de DLC à 5€ pour juste quelques vehicules ou maps, mais comme le jeu n'est vraiment pas cher à l'achat, ce n'est pas trop abusif. 

Au final, un bon jeu de gestion PC comme on n'en voit plus si souvent. Après l'echec de Sim City, la solution se trouve, à mon avis, chez les indépendants.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048355266', 'num_games_owned': 852, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2494, 'last_played': 1405149769}
review:
楽しい。一人でもくもくやっても良いけどマルチプレイは更に楽しい。
ダイヤは始発駅の発時刻を曜日や時間帯で区切って指定できるとか、一人一人の住人に勤務先と住居が設定されていたりとか、なにかと細かく、TropicoとSimutransが両方好きなら間違いなくハマる。

ところで、このゲームのマルチプレイヤーモードでは時々「同期漏れ」が発生する。いずれかのプレイヤーが行った行為が、他のプレイヤーの目の前の世界には反映されないことがあるのだ。シミュレーション自体はローカルでも行われているらしく、同期が損なわれてもゲーム自体は何事もなく進行していくため、発見が遅れやすい。プレイヤーが行う行動のほとんどは会社の保有する現金の額を変動させるため、こまめに各プレイヤー間で現金の額を読み合わせたり、同期が取れている状態で小まめにセーブしたりするといった運用が必要。なお、トラブルがあった場合は存続させたいセーブデータを各プレイヤーに配布して上書きすればひとまずの続行はできるようだ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198054780409', 'num_games_owned': 1814, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 7378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7158, 'last_played': 1704992875}
review:
Добро пожаловать в мир постоянно находящийся в движение, если конечно вы не попали в многокилометровую пробку. С чем же вам придется столкнутся в игре? С извечной проблемой дорог и транспорта. Признаюсь сразу, в режим компании, где надо лишь строить остановки и пускать транспорт в городах я не играл. Все свое времяпровождение в игре я отдал режиму «Песочница», где надо развить свой город с нуля, построив первую полосу дороги вокруг которой тут же начнут застраиваться здания. Чем дороже и солиднее дорога, тем более заметные строения будут появляться вокруг нее. Самому строить нельзя, все происходит автоматом, за небольшим исключением. Возможность строить может дать пак DLC «Lofty Landmarks», правда созидательство ограниченно лишь 4 архитектурными проектами, которые предназначены для привлечения туристов на линию.

Граждане желающие покататься на общественном транспорте очень придирчивы и в один момент могут повесить над остановкой красный смайл, показывая свое неудовольствие происходящей ситуацией. На то могут повлиять разные факторы: привлекательность транспортного средства, частота хождения транспорта по маршруту, скорость движения, цена билетов и другое. Думаете пусть негодуют? Не тут то выйдет, не успеете заметить как общественный транспорт опустеет и улицы заполонят машины, на которые пересели недовольные.

В игре присутствуют: автобусы, троллейбусы, трамваи, поезда и водный транспорт. Авиации в игре нет, а жаль на больших картах, когда создается несколько городов самолеты бы не помешали. К слову, как не парадоксально, но главный минус игры по-моему таится как раз-таки в транспорте, а точнее в его количестве. По умолчанию в игре совсем скудный ассортимент средств перевозки. Пара поездов, три автобуса, и со всем транспортом так. Конечно увеличить количество транспортных средств можно покупкой DLC, но все же остается налет искусственной распыленности игры на части.

Да к сожалению, хоть игра и привлекла меня к себе похожестью на TTD, в отличие от старушки здесь можно перевозить только одних пассажиров, никаких товаров и это немного печалит. В целом же игра оставляет приятное впечатление и несомненно, на данный момент является лучшей в своем роде!

Рейтинг 8 из 10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025008206', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1585497548}
review:
I'd love to recommend this because the original Cities in Motion is amazing. However the sequal just doesn't measure up somehow. The cities, which are all absolutely vast, lack character and feel largely homogenous; building routes is a bit more awkward with the requirement for depots; and the variable-height metro systems are awkward. Elevated metro lines often float unsupported, and feature teleport booths to travel between ground and platform level.

Avoid. Play the original Cities in Motion instead, it's so much better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008261054', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1908, 'last_played': 1535669487}
review:
Togliamoci subito il dente e diciamolo: Cities in Motion 2 è un gioco riuscito a metà. E il motivo principale è che la software house finlandese ha voluto farlo uscire troppo in anticipo rispetto all’attuale stadio di sviluppo. Giocandoci anche solo per qualche ora è chiaro che soffre ancora di molti problemi imputabili probabilmente ad un beta-test troppo sbrigativo. La prima cosa che salta all’occhio è il gameplay ancora sbilanciato soprattutto su alcuno fondamentali lati come la capienza dei mezzi e dei depositi o la tabelle orarie delle linee che ancora non funzionano sempre come dovrebbero. In più il tanto pubblicizzato multiplayer allo stato attuale non funziona ed è quasi impossibile riuscire a giocare efficacemente.

Prima di proseguire oltre è necessario però fare una piccola introduzione di base per capire come Colossal Order abbia voluto totalmente rivoluzionare il gameplay e che, forse, il giudizio andrebbe mitigato rispetto alle nuove sfide che il gioco vuole fornire. La nuova scelta di porre tutto il focus sulle città dinamiche, ossia la possibilità di costruire strade che poi verranno automaticamente “popolate” da edifici che potranno upgradarsi in base a quanto bene li copriremo con le nostre linee, ha fatto infatti propendere per la scelta di città fittizie al posto delle città reali del primo Cities in Motion. Se la cosa ha creato qualche scompenso nella comunità degli appassionati, la scelta diviene decisamente più sensata alla luce della possibilità di far crescere una città personalizzata, e ci fa propendere per considerarla tutto sommato una decisione azzeccata. Inoltre, un punto a favore è assegnabile per la grandezza delle mappe, che ci permette non solo di avere una grande metropoli, ma anche di creare città satelliti, o mappe composte da vari centri di uguale importanza.

Leggi la recensione completa su TheShelterNetwork.com: http://theshelternetwork.com/cities-in-motion-2/

author: {'steamid': '76561197997569888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 108028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31553, 'last_played': 1514681383}
review:
This game is awesome!  It has a few quirks, and is artificially difficult in "normal" mode, but it is still playable, once you learn how to use the Metros.

I tend to play it with my own rule set in sandbox mode, and I use that same ruleset in multiplayer mode with a close friend.  As a result, a "day" lasts six hours! o.O

We enjoy the game for it's challenge, and yet the relaxed atmosphere and pace.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047600636', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1379711553}
review: I am a fan of the first installment of Cities in Motion and did not hesitate to buy number two. I was kind of disappointed. The fun of the real-world cities has been replaced with a big soulless city. I did not really get the hang of the new mechanics, it was a bit more difficult than Cities in Motion 1. If you are expecting the kind of arcade-style game play of Cities in Motion 1 I would not recommend this game. Also what is going on with the prices for the DLC? They are so expensive! If you are like me not a hardcore traffic simulation lover, I would stick with Cities in Motion 1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006722471', 'num_games_owned': 969, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1643, 'last_played': 1455948616}
review:
Malheureusement, le deuxième essai n'est toujours pas le bon et le titre est toujours aussi éloigné des promesses qui sont faites. Certes, il corrige certains défauts du premier volets, créant bien moins d'embouteillages par exemple. Mais il en ajoute de nombreux, comme ceux qui permettent un déficit infini sans que personne ne s'en inquiète. Coupez toutes vos lignes, laissez vos dettes s'accumuler, et vous aurez encore des messages du maire félicitant votre travail alors que rien est fait.

Pire que tout, le prix bas du jeu camoufle un manque de contenu et l'obligation d'achat de DLC pour trouver un jeu « normal ». Tous les véhicules présents sont lents, ou moyennement lent, ne vous permettant pas d'établir les meilleures lignes et de progresser correctement. Pour d'autres véhicules plus performants, il faudra forcément passer par la boutique.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000548487', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1393002699}
review:
Dans l'ensemble, le jeux est très bien, mais c'est regrettable que quelques détails qui s'accumulent, s'accumulent ... nuisent grandement à l'expérience de jeu.

POINTS POSITIFS :

- Graphismes très beaux dans l'ensemble, mention particulière pour le cycle jour/nuit qui est vraiment sympathique. Les bâtiments sont très bien, mais la réalisation de l'eau l'est un peu moins.
Par contre, quand on commence à un peu zommer sur les textures, on se rend compte qu'elles ne sont pas vraiment terribles...
Quelques bugs graphiques remarqués au niveau de l'affichage des arbres, mais rien de bien méchant.

- Les cartes sont plus grandes que dans CIM 1, c'est très appréciable !

- Le gameplay donne une certain impression de réalisme. Après, je ne sais pas trop si on peut parler pour autant de simulation, mais il faut avouer que les fonctionnalités sont complètes et balaient pas mal d'aspect, économiques ou sociaux.

- Le prix, plutôt léger, donne après la possibilité d'acheter les DLC sans avoir l’impression d'être un pigeon. Je préfère payer 20€ le jeu de base + 5/10€ ensuite par DLC qui me plaisent, plutôt que de banquer tout de go 50€ pour des contenus qui ne me plairaient pas tous.

- Le système est beaucoup plus équilibré que dans le premier CIM. Alors que dans celui-là j'avais trouvé que les véhicules n'étaient que peu rentable alors que le métro l'était beaucoup trop, dans ce deuxième tout a été réglé et le jeu en devient beaucoup plus agréable.

POINTS NEGATIFS :

- Le jeu ne dispose pas d'une traduction Française, don c'est tout en anglais, ou allemand et quelques autres. Jouer dans une autre langue est tout à fait possible (en terme de compréhension), mais pour moi ça reste inconfortable.
J'espère seulement qu'ils vont sortir un patch correctif amenant plusieurs nouvelles traduction dont le français, mais pour l'instant je ne trouve pas ça très sérieux de leur part...
(A noter que certains français ont commencé à proposer des traductions françaises faites par leur soin, ça peut être une bonne solution en attendant une possible version officielle)

- Le gameplay n'est pas forcément très intuitif, donc c'est un peu déroutant au départ, c'est dommage...

- Pas mal de détails ratés dans l'interface. Individuellement, ce n'est pas forcément pas grand chose (raccourcis clavier pas forcément très pratiques à changer ; changement des prix des tickets fatiguant à la longue, ils auraient dû mettre un système automatique ; etc...) mais à la longue, ils viennent réellement parasiter le jeu.
De plus, l'interface générale est assez lourde, et pas forcément très ergonomique à utiliser.

- Le multi se départage entre Coop et Compétition : en gros, vous construisez un réseau, soit avec un "allié", soit avec un concurrent. Franchement pas convaincus, puisque d'une part le Coop n'est pas des plus intéressant (on se marche souvent sur les pieds), et il est assez difficile de trouver des joueurs...

La bande son est plutôt moyenne, sans plus ; et certains bruitages sont vraiment mauvais (les sirènes de police par exemple).
J'ai été par ailleurs victime d'un crash soudain (qui ne peut provenir que du jeu car la config de mon PC est largement suffisante pour le faire tourner). C'est dans un cas comme celui-là qu'on regrette que le jeu n'ait pas de fonctionnalité d'auto save...

A noter pour finir que le jeu n'est pas du même genre que SimCity : dans Cities In Motion, vous gérez votre réseau de transport, à la limite gérer un peu les routes/autoroutes/voies ferrés de métro, mais ça s'arrête là.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084475927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3305, 'last_played': 1470472169}
review:
So, I've played this game for a real long time, and everything works pretty good. I like that kind of "free-style" interchange and interstate construction concept and I tried so hard to make my cities' traffics look better, but here's the problem: the way vehicles changeing lane is the stupiest thing I've ever seen, in really life, you just go on to the road and change lane during driving, but in this game, everything changed, people change 3 or 4 lanes right after the interchange, and change 3 or 4 lanes right before detours, which makes a huge unnessasary trouble for city's traffic, which never gonna happen in the real life.

Some cars just "parked" on the expressway or whatever interstate and blocks all the traffic, this game is so buggy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980589123', 'num_games_owned': 906, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1387390946}
review: То ли я зажрался, то ли сделали плохо, но после CiM1 играть в CiM2 не тянет. Пропала некая лёгкость и несерьёзность, игра воспринимается как очередной скучный тайкун, не более того. С самодельного движка игра переехала на Unity, появилась возможность вращать камеру, смена времени суток - выглядит даже лучше SimCity 5. Но не цепляет. Даже если забыть про множество багов в экономической модели и самой симуляции, которые терроризировали игру первые 3 месяца, даже исправив их играть просто скучновато.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026074605', 'num_games_owned': 633, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1680, 'last_played': 1420621185}
review: CIM2 is a wonderful simulator game where you can set up your very own public transport business. The graphics are well done, the timetable system is decent and the fact that you can build extra "bus-only" roads is very interesting. However, the online mode needs some work; you can't see the others' view in Coop, so there's no way of telling what someone is talking about. Also, the passengers and the traffic are not sync'ed, so where one player sees a huge traffic jam, the other might see an empty street. The game is still very good and for fans of tycoon games, it's worth it. Just be ready to deal with some minor issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038637049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 615, 'last_played': 1616992686}
review:
Crashes regularly. Camera sucks compared to the first game. Cities lack flavour. You need to tamper with the game settings to get a half-way decent day/night simulation going (set time to 10%), The default settings render especially the theoretically great time tables ad absurdum (A bus does 7km in 5 hours).

The DLC is slighly less of a rip-off than before. At least they are not selling basic functunality separately anymore.

Have I already mentioned it crashes regularly, and no patch that is released does anything about that?

2/10 - Very meh.

review:
Contrary to the first game which really is Cities In Motion, this is "Cities In Dead stop" because thats what the UI feels like, it is horrendous and very difficult to use compared to the first game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046231209', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1486304272}

author: {'steamid': '76561197997530379', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1254, 'last_played': 1503253424}
review:
If you liked TTD (Transport Tycoon Deluxe) back in the days, you will most likely like this game as well. The goal is to transport people across a city in multitude of ways. The real challenge comes from efficency and you can really grind down in to the details. You can change the layout of the city by creating new roads (one way, avenues, with or without sidewalks or bus lanes) or you can adjust the individual time tables (frequency, what type of vehicle, times etc.) of busses and other transports.

It's a good deal of fun, and the simulation is really good. I can only recommend for those who liked TTD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100047908', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 50171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24239, 'last_played': 1592290675}
review: 其它都好说,就是脑残的AI实在无法忍受,这个只需要观察小人的行进路线就能看出,但似乎开发商只顾出DLC圈钱而无意改善AI,那我也只好把评测改为不推荐.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041323443', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 11807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6392, 'last_played': 1446882745}
review:
Even if you're not a fan of the transport simulation subgenre, CiM2 will keep you entertained for hours with its city builder aspect. I've never found any game in which you can create such detailed road and rail networks (including highways).
If you like creating cities, well this one is a must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972007738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 22026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3026, 'last_played': 1636710558}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020708723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 15198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14095, 'last_played': 1678559412}
review:
优点：画面比1代说不上谁优谁劣。1代的画面精致。2代的画面写实很多。
缺点：没有开放MOD不得不说是一个大败笔。地铁不能建造换乘枢纽和岛式站台，而且没有机场。上手难度相比1代有所提高，不过上手之后会乐此不疲，游戏后期不同玩法的组合很多，推荐给所有模拟游戏玩家。

author: {'steamid': '76561197992909443', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 5182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5149, 'last_played': 1384121119}
review: Значительно улучшили по сравнению с первой частью, но проблемы ИИ никуда не делись. Авто спешат перестроиться в нужный ряд за три перекрестка до поворота. При перестроении занимают до трех полос. Не могут корректировать маршрут и едут только по кратчайшему пути (а не по более скорому). Авто паркуются только на той стороне дороги, где находится их точка назначения. Глюк с выходом транспорта на несоответствующую линию. Но все эти недочеты видны не сразу и мне, как бы то ни было,  доставило море удовольствия преобразовывать Туториал-сити.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960684279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1438514576}
review:
While it has occasional stability issues (which are often caused by the unity engine and the developer can't actually do anything about this at the moment) it is a load of fun if you like transport simulations. It entails a lot of optimization of existing lines, so if that's not your thing this probably isn't for you.
It is a MASSIVE improvement over the first game though, which I already liked quite a bit, so I can only heartily recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197988051221', 'num_games_owned': 1255, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 5372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2544, 'last_played': 1424631657}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022750486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 45953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9302, 'last_played': 1485701126}
review:
Cities in Motion 2 is a worthy successor in all regards. The city is now 3D and can be tilted in any direction. Most importantly the city development is now dynamic so less easy to predict and it also doesn't get quickly too boring unlike the first part where you basically repeated the same steps over and over again for the same result. The interface has been improved immensely and it's quite a lot of fun to develop the transit system. On top of that CiM2 was quite cheap, compared to the first part, however it comes with its downsides.

Yes, CiM2 is much cheaper (about half the price of its predecessor) however time is now being calculated in weeks and not in years anymore. As a result period vehicles have been abandoned and you are stuck with the vehicles you get from the beginning (3 busses, 2 trams, 3 trolleys, 2 waterbusses and 1 metro, as far as I remember). Everything else is DLC content, though quite surprisingly not all as expensive as with CiM1 (I probably was just lucky as everything but the bus/tram pack was on offer).

CiM2 obviously - who would have expected - comes with quite some bugs (as the first one did), most importanly, it has a multiplayer, but we couldn't get it to work. We had to bypass the multiplayer problems by using Hamachi. Obviously not a solution. Many tiny but annoying issues with the interface, i.e. going underground still shows the overground streets, as a result a metro track under a street is basically unclickable. The usability suffers a bit, however has still greatly improved. Another issue seems to be the dynamic growth of the city, as sometimes three or more buildings of the same type are put right next to each other, which doesn't necessarily make sense (3 opera houses in the middle of the industrial zone). 

A massive improvement is the fact, that streets can be built, especially streets with bus lanes and many many more options which greatly improves the way you can build your tracks. This includes bridges and tunnels, metro now looks like the CiM1 train tracks and can be build over- and underground by simply using PAGE UP and PAGE DOWN, entrances for the stations are build automaticaly and off you go watching the people walking around like crazy popping out from one stop into the next one. 

Everyone who liked CiM1 should definitely get CiM2, despite the hickups and bugs and little annoyances - it's a great game. And though you might say "damn DLC" - the game can be played without the DLCs. Yes it's nice to have a choice of 2 metros instead of one, but in the end, you don't need it. Tell the game to send out a subway every 10mins instead of every 30min and you can compensate for the heavy usage. If you still would like to have the DLCs, check Steam for sales (only Bus DLC at the moment) or currently the other vehicles (Tram DLC, Waterbus and Trolley DLC) are cheaper in the Paradox store (however, you need to use Steam Wallet for that, which ones more makes nore sense, but they promised to make the rest of the DLCs available in Steam asap as well).

author: {'steamid': '76561198073565562', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1489860923}

author: {'steamid': '76561198074082406', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 21218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8387, 'last_played': 1496297963}
review:
Интересная игра, конечно, есть глюки и баги, но в целом - прекрасный симулятор  компании общественного транспорта.
Great game, not without bugs and some problems, but it is wonderful simulator of public transport company.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004604229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 126194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96476, 'last_played': 1613870920}
review:
輸送網の構築に重点を置いたゲーム
都市開発要素には期待しない方が良い、あくまで輸送ゲーム
輸送ゲームであるにもかかわらずゲーム内で使用できる乗り物は非常に少ない
UI周りは実装だけしてあり使い易さを考えられていない部分が多い
パッチが出続けるなら期待しても良いかもしれないが、現状は機能不全・機能不足の要素が多い
マップエディタ・マルチプレイ・ワークショップなどの充実さは評価できる

輸送ゲーと都市経営ゲーは、作りは似ているがジャンルは結構違う
この開発会社はもうこのゲームに戻ってこなそうなのが残念

author: {'steamid': '76561197984153882', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 12137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5230, 'last_played': 1485135681}
review:
If you like Transport Tycoon you would certainly like this, only difference that in single player there is no competing companies. Build a public transportation network in pre-designed or custom (Workshop) regions that can have multiple cities/towns in it!

It also looks beautiful, especially with the day/night cycles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073673201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 9141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4816, 'last_played': 1492175866}
review: Dobrá dopravní hra :) Máte velkou mapu města, kde si zavádíte autobusy, stavíte tramvajové tratě, tratě pro metro atd. atd. Samozřejmě máte vše pod kontrolu, upravujete jízdní řády, ceny jízdenek, platy zaměstnanců atd. Hned po tom co jsem si to koupil mě to trochu zklamalo (stejně jako všechny hry co jsem si koupil), ale pak jsem zjistil že je to úžasná hra  (stejně jako většina her co jsem si koupil :D). Najdou se zde občas nějaké bugy, které opravdu zamrzí, ale co se holt dá dělat. Také musím pochválit úžasný workshop map, najdete tam spoustu úžasných měst, takže až vás přestanou bavit základní mapy, neváhejte a stahujte.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999063373', 'num_games_owned': 1931, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1394497167}
review:
[b]Moviendo el esqueleto urbano[/b]

VOLVER DE LAS VACACIONES ES SIEMPRE TRAUMÁTICO. Pero volver anticipadamente... ¿A quién se le ocurre? ¿Con qué motivo? ¿Para gestionar el transporte público? Otros pueden hacerlo por mí. ¿O no? Si no tengo competencia. ¿O sí?

Tenés que terminar con este caos, ruegan. Sos el indicado, adulan. Tenés que construir una red eficiente, sueñan. Colectivos, trolebuses, tranvías, subterráneos, lanchas colectivas –como en Tigre–. Y cada una con variedad de unidades. ¿Por dónde empiezo? Los colectivos requieren poca infraestructura, una terminal y algunas paradas. Pero se quedan trabados en las horas pico. Los tranvías, en cambio, pueden circular sobre los bulevares, pero se encarecen con la construcción y mantenimiento de las vías. De los subterráneos ni hablar, apenas puedo conectar los rieles a las estaciones cabecera. Los ferris sirven, pero solo para la zona costera –o para los diluvios–.

Pueden leer mi review completo del juego en el número 13 de la revista [Irrompibles].
[url=http://www.irrompibles.net/revista/6867-revista-irrompibles-13-thief]Más información...[/url]

review: If you enjoy city management sims, you'll enjoy this. You handle ONLY the mass-transit system for the city (which can be MASSIVE), and occasional requests from residents. The interface and road/track building can be a little clunky at times, but once you adapt (and find a few video tutorials) it gets easier. It's like CitiesXL or SimCity, but without the micro-management and whining residents. Or giant robot attacks...

author: {'steamid': '76561198006595411', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1202, 'last_played': 1384531956}
review:
It surely has unfulfilled dreams and wishes compared to the first part.
But after the patching that has already been done, it's a very well enjoayable Transportation Simultation.

I would like to neither recommend this game nor doing the opposite, since I don't like the whole DLC stuff and it's prices, especially what you get for the money (I mean paying for FOUR buildings that might be interesting to maybe a map designer only?! Please, such a bad experiment. Still the other stuff: 10 bucks for a monorail add on? hahaa).

But if you enjoy City Simulation games in which you can press pause and think without time pressure in a beautiful and, compared to similar games, a HUGE urban environment, that is expendable through almost unlimited Workshop real life and fantasy maps...

you have to buy it; at least on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974937902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 13163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2467, 'last_played': 1486773261}
review: Great fun if you like city builder/transport sims. A breath of fresh air after the Sim City 5 fiasco, this much more playable game (from an indie developer - hello!) lets you manage a public transport company in various humongous regions that grow and change based on your work. You can even build tons of different roads and create your own cities from scratch! The tutorial is a bit hard to follow, but you'll quickly get the hang of the game once you just start playing. Plus, there are many different free game guides available, made by enthusiastic players. Get This Game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197963287189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6503, 'last_played': 1460362104}
review:
The ultimate road-building sandbox that happens to be about public transportation as well. If you can get past the uninspiring UI, your inner civil engineer might just fall in love.

Veterans of CiM1 will miss the warm art direction and simple UI, but the amount of building options here for roads is dizzying. Half of the time, I'll be tearing up and rebuilding expressways and roads for the idiotic, unpredictable little commuters--turns out this is pretty fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040911440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 10759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8438, 'last_played': 1428082987}
review:
Город начинается с дороГ. (Гарун Агацарский / ГОРОДА )

В первую очередь, хотелось бы отметить, что это не градостроительный симулятор, как на первый взгляд может показаться. Но элементы развития города в Cities in Motion 2 присутствуют, хоть и самые минимальные.

Так о чем же этот Cities in Motion 2? Игроку предлагается развивать  транспортную сеть города, выполняя как основное (сюжетное) так и дополнительное (якобы просьба граждан) задание. В вашем депо есть такие виды ТС (транспортное средство) как: автобус, троллейбус, трамвай, метро, водный ТС и монорельс. Монорельс стал доступным с последним ДЛС Cities in Motion 2: Marvellous Monorails. Нужно отметить, что ДЛС вышло достаточно для такого типа игры, а связано это с тем, что разработчики не позволили рядовым игрокам заниматься модингом и самим создавать транспорт. Обосновано это якобы запретом от создателей «движка» игры, выдавать его манул в массы. Что звучит глупо и неубедительно. Без модинга игра становится, спустя некоторое время, просто скучной, однообразной и неинтересной. Но разработчики поддерживают игру, выпуская дополнение за дополнением. Отмечу лишь, что цены на ДЛС, которые включают пару тройку новых автобусов или трамваев, завышены! Не стоит тратиться на них, если вы не такой безумный фанат как я. 

Игра получила депо, смену день-ночь, собственные троллейбусы (в первой части их сделали мододелы), строительство/ разрушение дорог и зданий, расписание и самое интересное – мультиплеер. Мультиплеер сделан криво, частый рассинхрон и отсутствие интересных режимов. Как следствие в него уже никто не играет, ибо от одиночной игры отличается он только наличием чата, ну и, иногда, вы увидите, как строит ваш соперник, если не будет рассинхрона. Интересно достаточно сделано расписание, которое все время приходиться корректировать и оттачивать до идеала.

Плюсы: 
Строительство/разрушение дорог и зданий
Удобная система прокладки линий
Гибкая система настроек (население, скорость игры, расход топлива ТС и т.д.)
Расписание

Минусы:
Отсутствие модов (карты не в счет, их достаточно в мастерской steam) 
Однообразные, скучные города (хотя опять же, в мастерской можно найти достаточно интересные карты)

Моя оценка: 8,5 из 10

review:

The game is great and gives you smart tasks and things,but the most interesting about this game is the opportunity for you to create your own map cities with huge... I mean really huge maps. Great game for those SImulators lovers. I would  recommend it to everybody who loves a good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978238059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 5117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2382, 'last_played': 1426434280}
review:
Comparing this game to the first one it has come quite some way. Even comparing it to Simcity 5 It is arguably a better game, Cities in Motion focuses on the logistical side of people movement in an urban environment. The placement of tracks, Stations, and Depots is not glitchy at all.  You can add roads and new buildings will show up, so yes the population density goes up and you will have to expand as the city does or you can buld them. Great game, Graphics are good, not Glitchy.

You can run the trams above your roads - 

Good game 

Pro's

Refined
Better placement Tools (track laying, Raising/lowering)
no more crashing

Con's

small things - nothing hindered my gameplay.
no subway :( -  (interesting metro lines)


- 8/10 - Worth the $20.00

author: {'steamid': '76561198005723020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1818, 'last_played': 1399848678}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198025405592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2055, 'last_played': 1480982908}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996666573', 'num_games_owned': 3577, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 10298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10156, 'last_played': 1426550700}
review:
Who needs bugged Sim City 2013? EA/Maxis, watch out!


- Cities are huge (1 city in CiM2 is almost 1 region of SC)
- You get money if people use your busses/trams etc.
- It has a metro...
- much more street options (buslane streets / tram can drive everywhere)
- vehicles looks awesome
- much better AI for vehicles and the Cims (Sims)
- Map Editor
- NO DRM
- much lower price for a much better game
and and and...


Of course, you can't really compare these games cause 1 is a city- and the other a transport simulation but i do cause CiM2 has much more SC style as SC itself.

If you want to expand your city you just need to build some streets and the game generates some random houses. And the whole city is dynamic, that means more busses/trams/trolleys/metros/watertaxi lines you make, the more the city grows.

I was already fascinated by CiM1 while ago but CiM2 is much better. Of course it still has some missing features i would like to see but i totally trust the developers cause they do what the community want. They will also publish Modding Tools for this game as it was in CiM1.

CiM2 came out exactly at the right point, already see many players who totally forgot SC and play CiM2 now. Don't feed EA/Maxis anymore...

Sim City 2013: 5/10

Cities in Motion 2: 8/10 (if they do the features the community mentioned, what they will do definetly, it will have 9/10)

author: {'steamid': '76561197990726862', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 18894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5291, 'last_played': 1544210251}
review: Well...where do I begin?  This game is surely the most detailed city simulation I've ever played.  The new features from the first game are too many to list.  The AI is much improved from the first, and very realistic.  The way in which transit systems are constructed is very flexible and easy to use.  It just makes sense.  The ability to create new roads is unbelievable; it feels like I'm playing a highway building simulator because of all the things I can do with them, even though it's a public transit simulation and it's not the main focus of the game.  I sincerely applaud the developers of this game for putting so much care into making it realistic and fun, in a time when most developers wouldn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022051263', 'num_games_owned': 434, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 23823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11088, 'last_played': 1542226471}
review: A highly anticipated sequel from the Finnish developer with a multitude of improvements from the previous take.  Offers incredible value for money, also DRM free as appose to EA’s Simcity which, even though has a completely different focus, was incredibly overpriced.  As a transport simulator, this one ticks almost all of the boxes. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198079653886', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1562495469}
review: Ich bin der Meinung das die Idee mit dem Depot ganz lustig ist. Doch ich bin von der U-Bahn entäuscht, es gibt zwar nun 4-Gleisige Schienen, denoch kann man die nicht unter die Erde legen. Nur oben. Aber trotzdem ist Cities in Motion 2 doch ein bisschen besser als sein Vorgänger. Das man die O-Busse schon benutzen kann, ohne ein Addon, Klasse. Oh...eins noch. der Multiplayer läuft nicht als zu gut. Ich persönlich finde das eigentlich schon schade. Das hörte sich nur zu gut an. Egal. Geiles Spiel. Klar empfehle ich das Spiel allen die sich ein netten Tag mit dem planen vom ÖPNV. BrianLP

author: {'steamid': '76561198023310315', 'num_games_owned': 722, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 73513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65671, 'last_played': 1545462666}
review: Komplexní budovatelská strategie z prostředí MHD nebo jinak řečeno simulace dopravního podniku. Co si pod tim představit? Hodně mikromanagementu. Je až neuvěřitelné, kolik CiM2 nabízí mikromanagementu. Její problém ovšem je, že ho neumí tak dobře využít, jak by se čekalo. Například jízdní řády nefungujou tak, že budou přicházet na zastávky lidi podle toho, kdy má jet spoj, ale berou v potaz pouze průměrný interval mezi spoji. Což je docela škoda. Dál tuto hru trápí několik bugů s chováním cestujících (radši jedou třemi autobusy, dvěmi tramvajemi a jednu stanici metrem než jet přímo metrem), ale když si na to člověk navykne, ve finále je Cities in Motion 2 opravdu dobrá hra. Akorát pořád potřebuje patche, které [strike]ovšem průběžně do hry Colossal Order vyrábí[/strike] ačkoliv vývojáři (Colossal Order) slíbili, nikdy nevyšly. Škoda.
